question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. 

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will die before Saturday? This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Given both Kamala's odds increase according to Nate Silver and Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will the market get 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, and (b) Joe Biden dies before Saturday. 

(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Then, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?

Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
Suppose Slovenia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. Then, will the linked market have at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Slovenia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced as having qualified for the Grand Final by the EBU.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the linked market has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise. The market is linked here: (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

question.title: Given USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On August 9th, 2024, the USD/JPY exchange rate closes at or above 145 JPY as listed on Yahoo! Finance. 

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle?

For the condition to hold, the USD/JPY exchange rate must be at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024.

For the outcome to resolve as YES, Joe Biden must make an unambiguous and conclusive announcement before the specified date and time, indicating he will not accept the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, the outcome resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Given USD is worth < 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On August 9th, 2024, the USD/JPY exchange rate closes below 145 JPY as listed on Yahoo! Finance. 

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle?

For the condition to hold, the USD/JPY exchange rate must be less than 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024.

For the outcome to resolve as YES, Joe Biden must make an unambiguous and conclusive announcement before the specified date and time, indicating he will accept the nomination. If such an announcement is made by the deadline, the outcome resolves as YES.

para_P.title: If the USD reaches a value of 145 JPY or more at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following condition is met: On August 9th, 2024, the exchange rate for USD to JPY is at least 145 JPY at the closing price as reported by Yahoo! Finance. 

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election cycle?

For the condition to be satisfied, the USD/JPY exchange rate must be a minimum of 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024.

For the result to be YES, Joe Biden must provide a clear and definitive announcement before the stated date and time, indicating he will not accept the nomination. If such an announcement is not made by the deadline, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Given both USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9, 2024 and Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The USD/JPY exchange rate is at least 145 at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

not_P.title: Given both USD is worth < 145 JPY at close on August 9, 2024 or Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will the BSE SENSEX not close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The USD/JPY exchange rate is less than 145 at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

para_P.title: If the USD is valued at 145 JPY or more at the end of trading on August 9, 2024, and Joe Biden publicly declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: 
(a) The exchange rate of USD to JPY is at least 145 at the market close on August 9, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before midnight Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not be seeking or accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be clear and definitive.

Then, will the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be more than 75,000 but not exceeding 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body:
(a) USD/JPY value will be determined by the close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.
(c) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth < 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 75k or greater than 76k?

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will seek or will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.
(c) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following events will take place: (a) the USD will be valued at 145 JPY or more at the close on August 9, 2024, (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will exceed 75,000 but not surpass 76,000?
para_P.body:
(a) The exchange rate of USD/JPY will be based on the closing figure provided for August 9, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear and official public statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election. This announcement must be definitive and leave no ambiguity regarding his acceptance of the nomination.
(c) The resolution of this question will depend on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will South Africa not elect a president before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the South African National Assembly does not officially elect a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the president of South Africa is officially elected by the National Assembly before the date of July 1, 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Conditional on South Africa electing a president before July 1, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?

Consequently, will the associated market have at least 377 participants by the end of July 15? It will resolve to YES if the market mentioned above reaches 377 participants before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve to NO if it does not.

question.title: Conditional on South Africa electing a president before July 1, 2024, and the market getting at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as follows:

**Condition**: The condition is met if both of the following occur:
1. The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to credible sources.
2. The linked market has at least 377 traders before it closes on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time.

**Outcome**: If the condition is met, the outcome resolves to YES if the July 2024 Manifold poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

The Manifold poll asks respondents if weak AGI has been achieved, without providing a definition, allowing them to vote based on their own understanding. The poll opens on the 23rd of each month and closes on the 30th.

not_P.title: Conditional on South Africa electing a president before July 1, 2024, and the market getting at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, will less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as follows:

**Condition**: The condition is met if both of the following occur:
1. The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to credible sources.
2. The linked market has at least 377 traders before it closes on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time.

**Outcome**: If the condition is met, the outcome resolves to YES if the July 2024 Manifold poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) less than 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

The Manifold poll asks respondents if weak AGI has been achieved, without providing a definition, allowing them to vote based on their own understanding. The poll opens on the 23rd of each month and closes on the 30th.

para_P.title: If South Africa chooses a president prior to July 1, 2024, and the market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by July 15, 2024, will at least 30% of respondents on Manifold concur that weak AGI was realized before July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry resolves as follows:

**Condition**: The condition is satisfied if both of the following take place:
1. The South African National Assembly formally elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reliable sources.
2. The associated market has no fewer than 377 traders before it concludes on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time.

**Outcome**: If the condition is satisfied, the outcome resolves to YES if the Manifold poll in July 2024 shows a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) that is at least 0.3, disregarding "no opinion" responses. If not, it resolves to NO.

The Manifold poll queries participants on whether weak AGI has been accomplished, without specifying a definition, thus allowing them to respond based on their personal interpretation. The poll is open from the 23rd to the 30th of each month.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, and the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **South African Presidential Election and Market Traders**:
   - The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.
   - The market linked [here](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

2. **Manifold Poll on Weak AGI**:
   - The July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. This indicates that at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, and the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. **South African Presidential Election and Market Traders**:
   - The South African National Assembly does not officially elect a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.
   - The market linked [here](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

2. **Manifold Poll on Weak AGI**:
   - The July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) less than 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. This indicates that fewer than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) A president is elected in South Africa prior to July 1, 2024, and the associated market has a minimum of 377 traders by July 15, 2024, (2) At least 30% of respondents on Manifold concur that weak AGI was accomplished before July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. **Election of South African President and Trader Count**:
   - The South African National Assembly officially selects a president before July 1, 2024, as reported by reliable sources.
   - The market linked [here](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must have no fewer than 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

2. **Manifold Survey Regarding Weak AGI**:
   - The results of the July 2024 survey show a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) that is at least 0.3, excluding respondents with "no opinion". This demonstrates that a minimum of 30% of Manifold participants agree that weak AGI was realized before July 23, 2024.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

In this context, "accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (possibly requiring payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be deemed a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines? If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls NOT take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, none of the following events occurs: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines? If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Assuming that OpenAI's ChatGPT is fully accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the scenario where OpenAI's ChatGPT is fully accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Fully accessible" indicates that individuals in the EU can utilize it without needing a VPN, possibly with a fee, and at least over half of the population has access to it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the standard web interface for engaging with GPT models and will still be deemed valid even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that before June 1, 2024, at least one of the following occurs: The Philippines sends away at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC, the PRC sends away at least one diplomat from the Philippines, or the PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines? If there are no such incidents reported before that date, then the answer is **No**.

question.title: Conditional on both ChatGPT being available in the EU and diplomatic actions between the Philippines and China, will OpenAI publish an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, with at least >50% of the population able to use it. (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, where one of the following occurs: The Philippines expels or recalls a diplomat with the PRC, or the PRC expels or recalls a diplomat with the Philippines.

Given both (a) and (b) occur, will OpenAI publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models? If so, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on either ChatGPT not being available in the EU or no diplomatic actions between the Philippines and China, will OpenAI not publish an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, with at least ≤50% of the population unable to use it. (b) No diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, where neither of the following occurs: The Philippines does not expel or recall a diplomat with the PRC, nor does the PRC expel or recall a diplomat with the Philippines.

Given either (a) or (b) does not occur, will OpenAI not publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models? If so, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, NO.

para_P.title: If ChatGPT is accessible in the EU and there are diplomatic movements between the Philippines and China, will OpenAI release an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union as of June 30, 2024, indicating that the standard situation for EU residents is that they can use it without a VPN, with over 50% of the population having access. (b) Before June 1, 2024, there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China, where one of these events occurs: either the Philippines expels or recalls a diplomat from the PRC, or the PRC expels or recalls a diplomat from the Philippines.

If both (a) and (b) are true, will OpenAI issue a public report by June 30, 2024, detailing the findings from an external red-teaming assessment of one of their AI models' safety? If the answer is affirmative, the response is YES; if not, it is NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (3) OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) The question about diplomatic expulsions or recalls resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(3) The question about OpenAI publishing a report resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

This combined question resolves as **YES** only if all three conditions (1), (2), and (3) resolve as **YES**. Otherwise, it resolves as **NO**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls do not take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, or (3) OpenAI does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) The question about diplomatic expulsions or recalls resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(3) The question about OpenAI publishing a report resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

This combined question resolves as **YES** only if at least one of the three conditions (1), (2), or (3) resolves as **NO**.

para_P.title: Are the following events all set to happen: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (2) There will be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024, and (3) OpenAI will release a report detailing the findings from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The inquiry regarding OpenAI's ChatGPT will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. "Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was the scenario in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) used to interact with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) The inquiry about diplomatic expulsions or recalls will resolve as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, any of these four events occur, based on official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If there are no reports of such events before that date, then this will resolve as **No**.

(3) The inquiry regarding OpenAI publishing a report will resolve as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI issues a *public* report with findings from an *external* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

This combined inquiry will resolve as **YES** only if all three conditions (1), (2), and (3) are resolved as **YES**. Otherwise, it will resolve as **NO**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is neither dropping out nor resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and resign before the end of July?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement that he is both ceasing his campaign for re-election and will be stepping down from the presidency, and this must occur before the conclusion of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and left office by that time; a declaration of his plan to do so is adequate to settle this market.

If he does not make such an announcement, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris be president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July; an announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

Given this, will Vice President Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this outcome will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris not be president by Friday?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July; an announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

Given this, will Vice President Kamala Harris not be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this outcome will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw and resign, will Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden states that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will step down from his current position before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not necessary for him to have formally left office before the end of July; a declaration of his intent to do so suffices.

In light of this, will Vice President Kamala Harris be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The main source for determining this outcome will be official communications from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports.

question.title: Given both Joe Biden drops out of re-election and resigns, and Kamala Harris becomes President, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024. This question resolves to YES if both of these conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden announces that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement suffices; he does not need to have formally resigned by then. (b) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting will be used as the resolution source. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

Then, is it true that diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Given both Joe Biden drops out of re-election and resigns, and Kamala Harris becomes President, will there be no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024. This question resolves to YES if both of these conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden announces that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement suffices; he does not need to have formally resigned by then. (b) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting will be used as the resolution source. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

Then, is it true that no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden withdraws from the re-election race and steps down, and Kamala Harris takes over as President, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between China and the Philippines prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both of these events occur: (a) Joe Biden declares his intention to withdraw from the re-election and resign before the end of July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024. This question will be answered with YES if both conditions are satisfied: (a) Joe Biden makes a public announcement that he is no longer seeking re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement is sufficient; he does not need to have officially resigned by that time. (b) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable reporting will serve as the basis for the resolution. If either of these conditions is not fulfilled, the question will be answered with NO.

Consequently, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? This question will be answered with **Yes** if any of the following four events take place before August 1, 2024, based on official announcements or [reliable reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If there are no such announcements before that date, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, (2) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and (3) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if all of the following conditions are met: 

1. Joe Biden announces that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement suffices; he does not need to have formally resigned by then.

2. Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting will be used as the resolution source.

3. Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden does not announce he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, (2) Kamala Harris is not designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, or (3) no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: 

1. Joe Biden does not announce that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time.

2. Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET.

3. Before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomats representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomats representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any of these conditions are met, the question resolves to YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will take place: (1) Joe Biden declares he is withdrawing from the re-election race and resigning prior to the end of July 2024, (2) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and (3) there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: 

1. Joe Biden makes an announcement that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and will step down from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement alone is sufficient; he is not required to have officially resigned by that time.

2. Kamala Harris is officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources will serve as the basis for resolution.

3. Prior to August 1, 2024, one of the following four scenarios occurs, based on official communications or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

If any of these conditions are not fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If she is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris set to become the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if a different candidate is chosen for the VP position, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the outcome of this market. The market may resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Details for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves negatively if Trump is not removed or blocked from any ballot by July 15, 2024.

not_P.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Details for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to no. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves positively if Trump is not removed or blocked from any ballot by July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President, will Donald Trump face removal or obstruction from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President, will Donald Trump be removed or obstructed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Condition details: If Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP, this market will conclude with a yes. If a different candidate is chosen for VP, this market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or obstructed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or obstruction must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The question will resolve as no if Trump is not removed or obstructed from any ballot by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee and Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President candidate, and (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:

- For the condition: Kamala Harris must be officially nominated as the Democratic VP candidate. Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, confirmed through official state announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports.

- For the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its 2024 presidential candidate. Resolves **No** if only one ballot is required.

not_P.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee and Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President candidate, and (2) Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. Then, will the Democratic Party not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:

- For the condition: Kamala Harris must be officially nominated as the Democratic VP candidate. Donald Trump must not be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, confirmed through official state announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports.

- For the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its 2024 presidential candidate. Resolves **No** if more than one ballot is required.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate and Donald Trump is barred from participating in the primary elections due to the 14th Amendment, will the Democrats need a contested convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) Kamala Harris is officially chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, and (2) Donald Trump is prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. Will the Democratic Party necessitate multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 presidential election? 

Criteria for resolution:

- For the condition: Kamala Harris must be formally selected as the Democratic VP candidate. Donald Trump must be officially barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, as confirmed by official state announcements, court rulings, or reliable media sources.

- For the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to select its 2024 presidential candidate. Resolves **No** if only a single ballot is needed.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee, (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: This condition will be satisfied if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this condition will not be satisfied. The nomination decision is final at the time of the initial nomination.

(2) Donald Trump: This condition will be satisfied if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice. The condition will not be satisfied if these criteria are not met as of July 15, 2024. Legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date are not considered; the focus is strictly on the status as of July 15, 2024.

(3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee, (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (3) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: This condition will be satisfied if Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this condition will not be satisfied. The nomination decision is final at the time of the initial nomination.

(2) Donald Trump: This condition will be satisfied if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice. The condition will not be satisfied if these criteria are met as of July 15, 2024. Legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date are not considered; the focus is strictly on the status as of July 15, 2024.

(3) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024: This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the following three events all going to take place: (1) Kamala Harris becomes the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, (2) Donald Trump is either removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (3) the Democratic Party experiences a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: This requirement will be met if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic VP. If another individual is appointed as VP, this requirement will not be fulfilled. The decision regarding the nomination is final at the time it is initially made.

(2) Donald Trump: This requirement will be met if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or barring must be validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements do not qualify. This requirement will not be fulfilled if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024. Legal disputes, appeals, or later changes after this date are not taken into account; the emphasis is solely on the situation as of July 15, 2024.

(3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This requirement is met as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 U.S. presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this requirement is met as **No**.

question.title: Will Armenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Armenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Armenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Armenia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Armenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Given Armenia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also qualify?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Armenia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It resolves as **Yes** if Belgium also participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Armenia has qualified. If Belgium does not qualify under these conditions, the question resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for P: Armenia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for P to be true.
Resolution criteria for Q: Given P is true, Belgium must also participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for Q to resolve as **Yes**. If Belgium does not qualify, Q resolves as **No**. If P is not true, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given Armenia does not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also not qualify?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Armenia does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It resolves as **Yes** if Belgium does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Armenia has not qualified. If Belgium qualifies under these conditions, the question resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for P: Armenia must not participate in a Semi-final or not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for P to be true.
Resolution criteria for Q: Given P is true, Belgium must also not participate in a Semi-final or not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for Q to resolve as **Yes**. If Belgium qualifies, Q resolves as **No**. If P is not true, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Armenia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also make it?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Armenia reaches the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. It concludes as **Yes** if Belgium also competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, assuming Armenia has qualified. If Belgium fails to qualify under these circumstances, the inquiry concludes as **No**.

Criteria for resolving P: Armenia must take part in a Semi-final and be officially recognized by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for P to be considered true.
Criteria for resolving Q: Given that P is true, Belgium must likewise compete in a Semi-final and be officially acknowledged by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for Q to be affirmed as **Yes**. If Belgium does not qualify, Q concludes as **No**. If P is not true, the inquiry resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both Armenia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Armenia and Belgium participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if both Armenia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given both Armenia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Armenia and Belgium participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if both Armenia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If both Armenia and Belgium secure their spots in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also make it through?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both Armenia and Belgium take part in their respective Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their places in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Then, will Ireland also make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is satisfied if both Armenia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final.
- The outcome will be **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.
- If the condition is not satisfied, the question will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following countries qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024: Armenia, Belgium, and Ireland?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Armenia participates in its respective Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (2) Belgium participates in its respective Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (3) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following countries qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024: Armenia, Belgium, and Ireland?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (1) Armenia participates in its respective Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (2) Belgium participates in its respective Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (3) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If all of these countries qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Armenia, Belgium, and Ireland all advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if each of the following criteria is fulfilled: (1) Armenia takes part in its designated Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (2) Belgium participates in its designated Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (3) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these nations do not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the French Prime Minister be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the coalition of the French Prime Minister is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Given the Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, is the following true: Joe Biden is still president by the end of July? This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Given the Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition of New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition of New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, is the following true: Joe Biden is not still president by the end of July? This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: If the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office until the end of July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the coalition of the Prime Minister of France is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

Then, can we say that: Joe Biden is still in office by the end of July? This market will confirm yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Given both the Prime Minister of France is not from New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, and Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
1. The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
2. Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves as true if both conditions (1) and (2) are met.
- The outcome resolves as Yes if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome resolves as No. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Given both the Prime Minister of France is from New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, or Joe Biden is not still president by the end of July 2024, will Rishi Sunak not fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
1. The party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
2. Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Rishi Sunak not fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves as true if either condition (1) or (2) is met.
- The outcome resolves as Yes if for any reason Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome resolves as No. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: If the Prime Minister of France is not affiliated with New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, and Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024, will Rishi Sunak be unsuccessful in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: 
1. On July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France does not belong to the New Popular Front or Together, according to reliable sources.
2. Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will Rishi Sunak not be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- The situation is deemed true if both statements (1) and (2) are satisfied.
- The outcome is Yes if Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election for any reason. If he is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome is No. Resolution must reference credible media reports or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he stands in any constituency).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 (c) Rishi Sunak will fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
