(2) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (3) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election, according to credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 (c) Rishi Sunak will be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if not all of the following conditions are met: (1) The party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (2) Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (3) Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election, according to credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place: (a) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together (b) Joe Biden will remain in office as president until the end of July 2024 (c) Rishi Sunak will not secure a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if all of these stipulations are satisfied: (1) As of July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with a party other than New Popular Front or Together, based on reliable sources. (2) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States as of 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (3) Rishi Sunak does not win a parliamentary seat in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, according to trustworthy media reports or an official statement from the election officer of his constituency.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that at least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024? The poll asks respondents whether weak AGI has been achieved, without defining the term, and resolves to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that less than 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024? The poll asks respondents whether weak AGI has been achieved, without defining the term, and resolves to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is less than 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses.

para_P.title: Considering that Trump's advantage over Biden is between 3 and 4 points as of July 15, 2024, will a minimum of 30% of Manifold survey participants concur that weak AGI was accomplished prior to July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 3 but not exceeding 4 points according to the national polling average from 538. This is based on the figure shown on the chart for that date, which was reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

Then, can we say that at least 30% of those surveyed in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024? The poll inquires if respondents believe weak AGI has been realized, without providing a definition for the term, and concludes with a YES if the proportion of YES/(NO + YES) is at least 0.3, disregarding responses of "no opinion."

question.title: Conditional on both Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points and at least 30% agreeing weak AGI is achieved, will Biden announce dropping out and resigning before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce both that he is dropping out of the 2024 presidential race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For condition (1), Trump's lead must be assessed based on 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024.
- For condition (2), the Manifold poll must show at least 30% of respondents saying YES to weak AGI being achieved, based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio.
- For the outcome, Biden must announce his intention to drop out and resign before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The formal resignation does not need to occur by this date, just the announcement.

not_P.title: Conditional on both Trump's lead over Biden being not between 3 and 4 points or less than 30% agreeing weak AGI is achieved, will Biden not announce dropping out and resigning before August 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 3 and not less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. (2) Less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden not announce both that he is dropping out of the 2024 presidential race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For condition (1), Trump's lead must be assessed based on 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024.
- For condition (2), the Manifold poll must show less than 30% of respondents saying YES to weak AGI being achieved, based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio.
- For the outcome, Biden must not announce his intention to drop out and resign before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The formal resignation does not need to occur by this date, just the announcement.

para_P.title: Given that Trump's advantage over Biden falls between 3 and 4 points and that a minimum of 30% agree weak AGI has been reached, will Biden declare his intention to withdraw and resign prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (1) On July 15, 2024, Trump's margin over Biden is more than 3 points but not exceeding 4 points, according to the national polling average from 538. (2) At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold survey concur that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024. 

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden make an announcement regarding his decision to exit the 2024 presidential race and step down from the presidency before the conclusion of July 2024? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- For condition (1), Trump's lead must be evaluated based on 538's national polling average as of July 15, 2024.
- For condition (2), the Manifold poll must indicate that at least 30% of participants responded YES to the achievement of weak AGI, calculated using the YES/(NO + YES) ratio.
- For the outcome, Biden needs to announce his plans to withdraw and resign before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The formal resignation does not have to take place by this date, only the announcement.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be assessed based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on their chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The question resolves positively if Trump's lead is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. (2) The Manifold poll, conducted monthly, asks if weak AGI has been achieved, allowing respondents to use their own definitions. The July 2024 poll must have at least 30% of respondents saying YES for this part to resolve positively. The poll results are based on YES/(NO + YES) ratio, ignoring "no opinion" responses. (3) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be assessed based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on their chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The question resolves negatively if Trump's lead is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 points. (2) The Manifold poll, conducted monthly, asks if weak AGI has been achieved, allowing respondents to use their own definitions. The July 2024 poll must not have at least 30% of respondents saying YES for this part to resolve negatively. The poll results are based on YES/(NO + YES) ratio, ignoring "no opinion" responses. (3) Resolves NO if Joe Biden does not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must not be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is not sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024, (2) at least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll will affirm that weak AGI was achieved prior to July 23, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden will declare both his withdrawal from the presidential race and his resignation from the presidency before July 31, 2024?
para_P.body: (1) The assessment of Trump's advantage over Biden will rely on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on their chart dated July 15, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump. The question will be affirmed if his lead is more than 3 and up to 4 points. (2) The monthly Manifold poll inquires whether weak AGI has been accomplished, permitting respondents to define it as they see fit. For this part to be affirmed, at least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 poll must respond YES. The evaluation is based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio, disregarding "no opinion" responses. (3) This will be affirmed if Joe Biden states that he is both ceasing his campaign for re-election and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated office by the end of July; an announcement of his intention to do so is adequate to confirm this market. Otherwise, this market will conclude with a NO on August 1st.

question.body:

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Conditional on BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

(b) On June 1, 2024, Russia has control of Chasiv Yar, as indicated by the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map showing the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories such as Assessed Russian Control or similar.

Given these conditions, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024? This resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? (c) Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(c) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through end of July 2024, will OpenAI commit to no retaliation for public risk disclosure before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not affect this condition.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle? This resolves as YES if both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China in the context of Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Condition: Vivek Ramaswamy must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following events occur, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, the question resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee and diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

2. Before August 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, as defined by the following events: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given these conditions are true, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

For the purposes of this question, a "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this question resolves to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

   - The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC does not expel any diplomats representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given these conditions are true, will Iran not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

For the purposes of this question, a "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this question resolves to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

para_P.title: Assuming that Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate and there are heightened diplomatic conflicts between the Philippines and China, will Iran launch a military operation prior to August 13th, 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider the following assumptions: 

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

2. Before August 1, 2024, there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China, characterized by these events: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

Given these conditions hold true, will Iran carry out a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

In this context, a "military operation" refers to any act of force conducted by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for example, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, this question would be answered with "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by credible reports. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic measures are excluded. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil, will be considered. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups will not be included.

   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

3. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this condition, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this condition is met) that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this condition. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this condition. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this condition.

If all three conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will none of the following occur: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, and (3) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if none of the following conditions are met:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines does not expel any diplomats representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC does not expel any diplomats representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

3. Iran does not initiate any military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this condition, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this condition is not met) that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this condition. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this condition. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this condition.

If none of these three conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any of these conditions are met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024, and (3) Iran launches a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if all of these conditions are satisfied:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The individual who receives the Republican nomination on election day in 2024 is irrelevant; it is strictly determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Prior to August 1, 2024, one of these four scenarios occurs, based on official announcements or [reliable reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats located in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats based in the Philippines. 

3. Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For this condition, a "military operation" will be defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas (e.g., if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot on Israeli soil, this condition is satisfied) that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not count toward the fulfillment of this condition. Only actions by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the fulfillment of this condition. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (i.e., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be considered for this condition.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given the BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition (P): The closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000.
- For the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 25th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given the BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday?

- For outcome (Q): Resolves to YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 25th, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Given that both the BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Joe Biden dies before July 26, will he announce dropping out and resigning before the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k, according to Yahoo Finance, and (b) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before the end of July 2024, in Pacific Time, that he is both dropping out of the re-election race and resigning from the presidency, even if the formal resignation occurs later? An announcement of intention is sufficient for a YES resolution. If these conditions are not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, this market will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Given both (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing Biden's early nomination and (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

The resolution criterion is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the final nominee on the election day.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO serves as the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, revealing that many of their members are significantly concerned about Biden's candidacy moving forward.

Huffman commented in an interview, "This is a poor decision by the DNC. Some believe it’s a smart tactic to close down debate and achieve unity through sheer force, but that approach is ineffective." He did not confirm the letter's existence.

This market will resolve YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House members or Senators aligning with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice for a YES resolution. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, it will resolve NO.

(2) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024: This question will resolve **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any statements about potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with indictments needing to occur before June 1, 2024.

(3) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to currently mentioned candidates; others may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Larry Elder going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to additional candidates that may be nominated in the future.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Given this, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If more than one round is needed, this resolves as Yes, indicating a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as No.

not_P.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Given this, will the Democratic Party not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If no more than one round is needed, this resolves as Yes, indicating a non-brokered convention. If more than one ballot is required, then this resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate, will the Democrats need a contested convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than the choice made on election day.

In light of this, will the Democratic Party need to go through multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If it requires more than one round, this indicates a Yes, pointing to a contested convention. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, then this indicates a No.

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee and Democrats have a brokered convention, will the US end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD by August 3, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? If the agreement is ended before that date, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee and Democrats have a brokered convention, will the US not end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD by August 3, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will the US Department of Commerce not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? If the agreement is not ended before that date, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate and the Democrats face a contested convention, will the United States discontinue its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD by August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario: Larry Elder is chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention, and the Democratic Party needs multiple voting rounds in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Will the US Department of Commerce officially end or phase out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's administration of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024? If the agreement is terminated before that date, the answer will be **Yes**; if not, the answer will be **No**. If the initial condition is not satisfied, the answer will be N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, and (b) the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (2) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If both conditions are satisfied, this question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee nor Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, nor (b) the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (2) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If neither condition is satisfied, this question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate and the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024, and (b) the US government cancels its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and the Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. (2) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If both criteria are met, this question will resolve as **Yes**; otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Are Kamala's chances of victory expected to rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Will the party of the Prime Minister of France not be New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources?

not_P.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, will the Prime Minister of France belong to the New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Will the party of the Prime Minister of France be New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources?

para_P.title: If Kamala's chances of victory rise in the coming week as per Nate Silver's analysis, will the French Prime Minister be part of a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: The probability for Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Will the French Prime Minister's party not be New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable information?

question.title: Conditional on both Kamala's odds increasing and the French PM not being from specified parties, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, specifically if her Electoral College probability is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, as verified by credible sources.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will be nominated as the Democratic Vice President? If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this question resolves to YES. If someone else is selected as VP, it resolves to NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

not_P.title: Conditional on either Kamala's odds not increasing or the French PM being from specified parties, will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, specifically if her Electoral College probability is less than or equal to 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition of New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, as verified by credible sources.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will not be nominated as the Democratic Vice President? If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this question resolves to YES. If she is selected as VP, it resolves to NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

para_P.title: Given the increase in Kamala's chances and the French Prime Minister not being from certain parties, will Kamala Harris become the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (a) According to Nate Silver's model, Kamala Harris's chances of winning rise in the upcoming week, particularly if her Electoral College probability exceeds 46.6% by Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. (b) The French Prime Minister is affiliated with a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024, as confirmed by reliable sources.

Is it accurate to say that Kamala Harris will be chosen as the Democratic Vice President? If Kamala Harris is indeed chosen as the Democratic VP, this question will be answered with YES. If another individual is appointed as VP, the answer will be NO. Any changes to the Vice Presidency after the initial selection do not influence the outcome.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (c) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(c) If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (c) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(c) If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to no. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (a) Nate Silver's model indicates an increase in Kamala's chances of winning over the next week (b) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with a party other than New Popular Front or Together (c) Kamala Harris receives the Democratic VP nomination?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the probability of Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This inquiry will be affirmed as Yes if the Prime Minister of France's party is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

(c) This market will affirm yes if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic VP. If a different individual is appointed as VP, this market will affirm no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can affirm immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals not be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators push Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have stated to local media that they have already dismissed Biden's chances of winning in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as reported above, or it might take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals separately indicating to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's end date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th.

Then, will Joe Biden still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

Politico reports:

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

para_P.title: If a coalition of no fewer than five identifiable Democratic House Representatives or US Senators urges Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, will Joe Biden maintain his presidency until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already called for Biden to step aside publicly. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news outlets that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. Letters are being drafted by House Democrats, with at least one letter reportedly urging Biden to end his campaign, as stated by five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will conclude with a YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to think about terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could include signing a letter as mentioned above, or could take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

For this market to resolve YES, all five individuals must be part of a unified group message. If five individuals communicate separately to reporters their belief that Biden should step down, it will not be enough for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If the stated conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Assuming the following is accurate: A coalition of at least five identifiable Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to pressure Joe Biden to withdraw from the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th.

Then, will Joe Biden still hold the position of President of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Given both Democratic pressure on Biden to drop out and Biden's presidency by July end, will Trump gain 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, and (b) Joe Biden is still president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference must be >= 0.03. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given both Democratic pressure on Biden to drop out and Biden's presidency by July end, will Trump not gain 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, and (b) Joe Biden is still president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump not gain at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll does not exceed that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference must be < 0.03. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Considering the Democratic insistence for Biden to withdraw and his presidency by the end of July, will Trump see a 3% increase among Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: (a) A coalition of no fewer than five named Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborate to urge Joe Biden to think about stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid prior to July 20th, and (b) Joe Biden remains the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

In this case, will Donald Trump experience at least a 3% boost in support among Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democratic candidate? 

The criteria for determining the outcome: This will be considered YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold poll surpasses that in the subsequent poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation employed is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference must be >= 0.03. If not, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July, and (c) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this condition is not satisfied.

(b) Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024.

(c) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July, and (c) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter or in another form such as not having a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. Not all five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this date. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this condition is satisfied.

(b) Joe Biden must not still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024.

(c) There are not two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls does not ask Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another does not ask respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls do not consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed does not poll ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents not representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will take place: (a) A collective of at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, (b) Joe Biden will remain president until the end of July, and (c) Trump will achieve a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) A coalition of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must unite to request Joe Biden to think about stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could take the form of a signed letter or another method such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively ask him to withdraw. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication. Any reports of an unspecified number of Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to resign will not fulfill this requirement unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before this date. If these conditions are not met before July 20th, this criterion will not be satisfied.

(b) Joe Biden must still hold the official position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

(c) Two Manifold polls will be conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul

This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or greater at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
