The answer will be NO if these conditions are not met.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be declared president by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any moment prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolution of this market will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: If Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This designation can be confirmed through official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Given this scenario, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, regardless of any other candidates or options that may be present.

not_P.title: If Kamala Harris does not become President by Friday, will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This designation cannot be confirmed through official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Given this scenario, will Nikki Haley not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is not chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, regardless of any other candidates or options that may be present.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris assume the role of President by Friday, will Nikki Haley be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This recognition can be validated through official announcements from the US government or a general agreement among reliable news sources.

In light of this situation, will Nikki Haley be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is considered Yes if Nikki Haley is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate, irrespective of any other contenders or alternatives that might exist.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and Nikki Haley being selected as the Republican nominee, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, will a reliable media outlet cover the story of Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and Nikki Haley being selected as the Republican nominee, will a reliable media outlet not cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story of Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris assumes the role of President or Acting President prior to July 26, 2024, and Nikki Haley is named the Republican nominee, will a trustworthy news organization report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) Kamala Harris is inaugurated as President or takes on the responsibilities of Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Nikki Haley is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

(a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, alongside a consensus from credible news reports.

(b) Nikki Haley is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than the individual who is nominated on election day.

Then, will a trustworthy news organization report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves to YES if a major and reputable news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, (b) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) if Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(c) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, (b) Nikki Haley is not selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (c) if Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet does not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(c) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will take place: (a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, (b) Nikki Haley is nominated as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) in the event that Joe Biden withdraws, a reputable news organization reports on the situation at least 6 hours ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus of credible news reporting taken into account.

(b) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on election day.

(c) Should President Joe Biden decide to withdraw, a major and trustworthy news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post must report the withdrawal with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Trump's lead in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this situation, will Joe Biden drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time? Resolves YES if Biden drops out before this date, otherwise resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Trump's lead in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this situation, will Joe Biden not drop out or be otherwise able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time? Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out before this date, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.title: With Trump's advantage over Biden ranging from 2 to 3 points on July 15, 2024, is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average. This is ascertained from Trump's lead in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as of July 15, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

In light of this scenario, will Joe Biden exit the race or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024? Resolves YES if Biden exits before this deadline, otherwise resolves NO.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, and Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose both of the following conditions are true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 presidential race before July 20, 2024. Given these conditions, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for P: 
- (a) Resolves true if on July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average.
- (b) Resolves true if Biden drops out before July 20, 2024.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if credible reports indicate an attack attributed to Iran within Israel's borders leads to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, or Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024, will Iran not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose at least one of the following conditions is true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Joe Biden does not drop out of the 2024 presidential race before July 20, 2024. Given these conditions, will Iran not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for not P: 
- (a) Resolves true if on July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average.
- (b) Resolves true if Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if there are no credible reports indicating an attack attributed to Iran within Israel's borders that leads to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, and Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, will Iran execute a lethal assault in Israel before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming both of the following statements hold true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3 points according to the national polling average from 538, and (b) Joe Biden exits the 2024 presidential contest before July 20, 2024. Under these circumstances, will Iran conduct a deadly attack within the borders of Israel before May 1, 2024? 

Criteria for determining the truth of P: 
- (a) Resolves to true if on July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is found to be greater than 2 and no more than 3 according to the polling average from 538.
- (b) Resolves to true if Biden withdraws before July 20, 2024.

Criteria for determining Q: Resolves to YES if reliable reports confirm an attack linked to Iran within Israeli territory results in the deaths of at least five people before May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) Biden will drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Iran will carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

(c) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) Biden will drop out before July 20, 2024, or (c) Iran will not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) If Biden does not drop out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

(c) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has not led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 2 but not be more than 3 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average, (b) Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and (c) Iran will execute a lethal assault within Israel before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(b) If Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will resolve to yes. If not, this market will resolve to no.

(c) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report that an attack linked to Iran occurring within the borders of Israel has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

If not, then the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions, resulting in an answer of **Yes**.

question.title: Given the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the outcomes of two scenarios at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Suppose the following is true: A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means the same nation must win at least two of these events.

Then, the question asks: Will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The resolution criteria for the second part: The market resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If confirmed prior to the end of the Games, the market resolves immediately to "Yes". Otherwise, it resolves to "No".

not_P.title: Given the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question explores the outcomes of two scenarios at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Suppose the following is true: A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means the same nation must win at least two of these events.

Then, the question asks: Will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The resolution criteria for the second part: The market resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If confirmed prior to the end of the Games, the market resolves immediately to "Yes". Otherwise, it resolves to "No".

para_P.title: If a single country secures victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates the results of two conditions at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Assuming the following holds true: One National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This implies that the same country must triumph in at least two of these competitions.

Subsequently, the question inquires: Will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively secure 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The criteria for resolving the second part: The market will be deemed "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes attain 21 or more gold medals, according to the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reputable sources. If this is verified before the conclusion of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes". Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

question.title: Given that both a single nation wins more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals at Paris 2024, will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question considers the scenario where both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics:
(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question resolves positively if the USA is the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

not_P.title: Given that both a single nation does not win more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals at Paris 2024, will the USA not top the Olympic Medal Table?
not_P.body:
This question considers the scenario where both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics:
(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) does not win gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team not be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question resolves positively if the USA is not the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

para_P.title: If a single country secures gold in multiple women's team sports and Individual Neutral Athletes earn 21 or more gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Table?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation where both of the following happen at the Paris 2024 Olympics:
(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) is victorious in gold for more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively achieve 21 or more gold medals, as verified by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC reporting is not available.

Under these circumstances, will the United States Olympic Team be the sole highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them by:
1. Total Number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1) Total Number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2) Total Number of Bronze Medals.

The question is affirmed positively if the USA is the only highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027, and negatively if any other team achieves a higher or equal ranking compared to the US team.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (1) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, and (2) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question resolves to Yes if all of the following conditions are met at the Paris 2024 Olympics: 

1. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

3. The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
   - Number of Gold Medals
   - (Where Gold Medals are tied) Number of Silver Medals
   - (Where Silver Medals are tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (1) The same nation does not win more than one women's team sport or Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals, or (2) The USA does not top the Olympic Medal Table?
not_P.body:
This question resolves to Yes if at least one of the following conditions is not met at the Paris 2024 Olympics: 

1. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) does not win gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

3. The United States Olympic Team is not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
   - Number of Gold Medals
   - (Where Gold Medals are tied) Number of Silver Medals
   - (Where Silver Medals are tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. If all of these conditions are met, the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (1) The same country secures victories in more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes achieve 21 or more gold medals, and (2) The USA leads the Olympic Medal Table?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if all of the following criteria are satisfied at the Paris 2024 Olympics: 

1. A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) earns gold in multiple events out of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes together obtain 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal count published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC reporting is not available.

3. The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are calculated by tallying all the medals won by each participating nation and ranking them by:
   - Total Gold Medals
   - (In case of a tie in Gold Medals) Total Silver Medals
   - (In case of a tie in Silver Medals) Total Bronze Medals.

The question will be considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. If any of these criteria are not fulfilled, the question will be answered as No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or any other pertinent authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply here. Additionally, if Biden himself invokes Section 3 of the 25th Amendment, it will not be considered.

Background: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to consider the invocation of the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then is the following true? Before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports, at least one of the following events happens:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

not_P.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls not occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then is the following true? Before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports, none of the following events happens:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Should President Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Before August 2024, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that President Biden is incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his position, resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President. The length of the incapacity is not pertinent to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not relevant. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

Then, is it accurate to state that before August 1, 2024, based on official announcements or trustworthy reports, at least one of the following occurs:

- The Philippines expels a diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls one of its diplomats from the PRC.
- The PRC expels a diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

If no such reports exist before that date, then the answer is No.

question.title: Given both Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 and diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, meaning one of these events occurs: The Philippines expels or recalls at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), or the PRC expels or recalls at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

Then, given these conditions, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment does not cause a NO resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Given both Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 or diplomatic expulsions or recalls do not occur between the Philippines and China before August 2024, will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, (a) Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President not to serve as Acting President, and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls do not take place between the Philippines and China, meaning neither of these events occurs: The Philippines does not expel or recall any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), and the PRC does not expel or recall any diplomat representing the Philippines.

Then, given these conditions, will Biden not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

para_P.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment and there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to August 2024, will he continue to be President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before August 2024, (a) Biden is declared incapacitated per Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, which means that the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President acting as President, and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China, indicating that at least one of these situations arises: The Philippines expels or recalls at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC), or the PRC expels or recalls at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

Given these circumstances, will Biden remain the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This is answered with YES if Biden is still President at the end of July 2024; it is answered with NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being President before that time. It is important to note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment does not result in a NO answer, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 2024, and will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 nor (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 2024, and will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines does not expel at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines does not recall at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. The PRC does not expel at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. The PRC does not recall at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as Yes. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Biden being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occurring between the Philippines and China before August 2024, while Biden continues to serve as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden's departure from the office of the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

(b) Resolves YES if one of the following events occurs before August 1, 2024, as per official announcements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC. The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines. The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. If no such reports exist before that date, this resolves to No. This question resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden remains the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President as per the Constitution)

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If she is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: In the event that Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is appointed as VP, the market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, it is not met. The VP nomination is considered final at the time of initial nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th. This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

not_P.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, it is not met. The VP nomination is considered final at the time of initial nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th. This could be by not signing a letter or another form of collective action. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris be the Democratic Vice President, will a minimum of five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators press Joe Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Imagine that Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. In that case, will a coalition of at least five specific Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate stepping back from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Criteria for determining the condition: This condition is satisfied if Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP. If a different individual is appointed as VP, it is not satisfied. The nomination for VP is regarded as definitive upon the initial selection.

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be considered a YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate unites to ask Joe Biden to reflect on withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to actively push him to do so, before July 20th. This could be through signing a letter or any other form of joint action. All five members must be included in the same group communication. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this will be a NO.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP and at least 5 Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Biden have a 45+ minute on-camera interview before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President, and at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively urge Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th. Given this scenario, will Joe Biden participate in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Kamala Harris must be initially nominated as the Democratic Vice President.
- A group of at least five named Democratic lawmakers must collectively act to urge Biden to reconsider his re-election campaign before July 20th.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024.
- The interview must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include podcasts, late night shows, or edited interviews like those on 60 Minutes.
- At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person must be released.

not_P.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP and at least 5 Democratic lawmakers do not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Biden not have a 45+ minute on-camera interview before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President, and at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not collectively urge Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th. Given this scenario, will Joe Biden not participate in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Kamala Harris must be initially nominated as the Democratic Vice President.
- A group of at least five named Democratic lawmakers must not collectively act to urge Biden to reconsider his re-election campaign before July 20th.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Biden must not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024.
- The interview must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include podcasts, late night shows, or edited interviews like those on 60 Minutes.
- Less than 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person must be released.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris be the Democratic Vice President and if a minimum of five Democratic lawmakers encourage Biden to withdraw before July 20th, will Biden have a 45+ minute on-camera interview prior to the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President, and a minimum of five identified Democratic Party members from the House of Representatives or the Senate collectively pressure Joe Biden to exit the 2024 re-election race before July 20th. In this situation, will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?

Criteria for assessing the condition: 
- Kamala Harris must be officially chosen as the Democratic Vice President.
- A group of no fewer than five specific Democratic legislators must jointly urge Biden to reconsider his re-election bid prior to July 20th.

Criteria for determining the outcome:
- Biden must take part in a direct interview for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024.
- The interview should exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc., but can include formats like podcasts, late-night shows, or edited interviews such as those featured on 60 Minutes.
- At least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in person must be made available.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP, at least 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. The resolution is based on the initial nomination, and any changes after that do not affect the outcome. (2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The group must act collectively, such as by signing a letter or meeting Biden in person. (3) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. If all three conditions are satisfied, this question resolves to YES. If any condition is not met, it resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP, fewer than 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, or will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic Vice President. (2) A group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or do not urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The group must not act collectively, such as by not signing a letter or not meeting Biden in person. (3) Joe Biden does not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must not be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. If at least one of these conditions is satisfied, this question resolves to YES. If all conditions are met, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris set to be the Democratic Vice President, given that a minimum of five identified Democratic lawmakers urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th, and will Joe Biden have a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if all of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Democratic Vice President. The resolution relies on the original nomination, and any subsequent alterations do not influence the result. (2) A coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The coalition must act in unison, such as through signing a letter or having a direct meeting with Biden. (3) Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, published before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night program, or an interview incorporated into a show like 60 Minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to be considered valid. If all three criteria are met, this inquiry will resolve to YES. If any one of the conditions is not met, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday?
question.body: This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET

not_P.title: Will Maria Corina Machado not be imprisoned before Friday?
not_P.body: This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is not imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET

para_P.title: Is it possible that Maria Corina Machado will be jailed prior to Friday?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a YES if the opposition figure Maria Corina Machado is detained before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.

question.title: Conditional on Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Given this condition, we are interested in whether a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post will cover President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be imprisoned before the specified date and time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if a reliable media outlet covers the dropout at least 6 hours before the official announcement. The question resolves as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Conditional on Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday, will a reliable media outlet not cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Given this condition, we are interested in whether a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post will not cover President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be imprisoned before the specified date and time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if no reliable media outlet covers the dropout at least 6 hours before the official announcement. The question resolves as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated prior to Friday, will a credible news source report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours ahead of time?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation in which Maria Corina Machado, the leader of the opposition, is incarcerated before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Under this premise, we seek to determine whether a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post will report on President Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation a minimum of 6 hours before he makes an official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy sites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be adequate.

Criteria for the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be incarcerated before the specified date and time.
Criteria for the outcome: The question is answered YES if a credible news source reports the withdrawal at least 6 hours prior to the official announcement. The question is marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Given both (a) Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday and (b) Joe Biden's dropout is covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
(a) Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition is only relevant if Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given both (a) Maria Corina Machado is not imprisoned before Friday and (b) Joe Biden's dropout is not covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance, will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
(a) Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is not imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition is only relevant if Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given these conditions, will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: If both (a) Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated prior to Friday and (b) Joe Biden's withdrawal is reported by trustworthy media outlets at least 6 hours ahead of time, will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House/Senate endorse a public letter against the early virtual nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
Assume the following situations hold true: 
(a) Maria Corina Machado, the leader of the opposition, is incarcerated before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) In the event that President Joe Biden withdraws, a major and credible media source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his formal announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This stipulation is only applicable if Biden withdraws before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

In light of these conditions, will at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate sign a public letter opposing the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially planned, which they claim suppresses the ongoing vigorous debate regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain profoundly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose by sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado not be imprisoned before Friday? (b) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (2) Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply settled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.
