Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Will Hurd is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This query is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included in the future.

For this question, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this context, we want to know if there will be another Democratic party presidential debate. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise. 

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there be no another Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this context, we want to know if there will be no another Democratic party presidential debate. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise. 

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there be an additional debate for the Democratic party's presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this scenario, we seek to determine if there will be another debate among the Democratic party's presidential candidates. 

Criteria for the condition: Will Hurd must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise. 

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Will Hurd is the Republican nominee and there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given these conditions, will Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

not_P.title: Given Will Hurd is the Republican nominee and there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Kamala Harris not become President by July 26, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. para_P.title: If Will Hurd is the chosen Republican candidate and there is another Democratic presidential debate, will Kamala Harris take office as President by July 26, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is based solely on the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election. question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) there be another Democratic party presidential debate, AND (c) Kamala Harris be designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. If at least one condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will take place: (a) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) another debate occurs among Democratic presidential candidates, AND (c) Kamala Harris is officially named as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024?

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the Summer Olympics of 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The response will be negative if the aforementioned circumstances do not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official body of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person (other than the terrorists) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? The question will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be no armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person (other than the terrorists) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will there be no armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? The question will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, there are no credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be a military conflict fatality involving China and Taiwan in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: A terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, resulting in injuries or fatalities to at least one individual (excluding the terrorists) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. This incident must be classified as a 'terrorist incident' by any official agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

In light of this, will there be a military conflict fatality involving China and Taiwan in 2024? The question will be considered affirmative if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports verify one or more fatalities among the armed forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between the two nations. If this condition is not satisfied, the outcome will be N/A.

question.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (b) there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024. 

Details for (a): Resolves Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for (b): Resolves Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Then, is it true that at least 24 world records will be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as Yes if 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (b) there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024. 

Details for (a): Resolves Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for (b): Resolves Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Then, is it true that fewer than 24 world records will be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as Yes if fewer than 24 world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: If a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and there is a military conflict resulting in fatalities between China and Taiwan prior to June 6, 2024, will a minimum of 24 world records be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (a) a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (b) there is a military conflict resulting in deaths between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024. 

For (a): Resolves Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is characterized as such by any French State agency, the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

For (b): Resolves Yes if, prior to June 6, 2024, credible sources confirm one or more fatalities among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between the two nations.

Then, is it accurate to say that at least 24 world records will be surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as Yes if 24 or more world records are achieved at the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) An armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) At least 24 world records broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act in metropolitan France will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The question about world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics will resolve as Yes if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) An armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) At least 24 world records broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act in metropolitan France will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The question about world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics will resolve as Yes if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is less than 24.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) A terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) A fatality resulting from military conflict between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, and (c) A minimum of 24 world records being surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding a terrorist incident in metropolitan France will be deemed Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The inquiry will be considered No if the aforementioned does not happen. An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any governmental agency in France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The inquiry concerning a military conflict death between China and Taiwan will be determined as Yes if, prior to June 6th, 2024, credible sources verify one or more fatalities among the armed forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between the two nations.

(c) The inquiry about world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics will be resolved as Yes if the total number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or more.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolves as YES. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolves as NO. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Criteria for the condition: Resolves to YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves to NO in all other cases.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if the Greens–EFA political group has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups have an equal number of seats, this also resolves as YES. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Given both a Democratic debate and Greens-EFA win, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Given both a Democratic debate and Greens-EFA win, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Then, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If both a Democratic debate occurs and the Greens-EFA achieves victory, will Biden be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) There is a debate among prospective Democratic candidates (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) the Greens–EFA party secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?

Criteria for resolution: Resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) There will be another Democratic party presidential debate prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, (b) Greens–EFA will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, AND (c) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en), credible media reports, and official declarations regarding the 25th Amendment.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) There will not be another Democratic party presidential debate prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, (b) Greens–EFA will not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, OR (c) Biden will not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en), credible media reports, and official declarations regarding the 25th Amendment.

para_P.title: Will the following three events take place: (a) Another presidential debate for the Democratic party will happen before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, (b) The Greens–EFA will secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, AND (c) Biden will be declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group ends up with the most seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be **No** for any other results. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two groups, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.

(c) This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en), reliable media sources, and official announcements related to the 25th Amendment.

para_P.title: If Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated prior to Friday, will S&D secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Maria Corina Machado, the leader of the opposition, is incarcerated before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Will the S&D secure the highest number of seats after the elections for the European Parliament in 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be incarcerated before the designated time. 
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if S&D secures the highest number of seats post the 2024 European Parliament elections. If there is a tie between two groups for the most seats, both will resolve as YES. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Conditionally on both Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday and S&D holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, including scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for this condition will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Given these conditions, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? This referendum must have the consent of the London government and may be advisory, but not a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum without UK government permission.

not_P.title: Conditionally on both Maria Corina Machado not being imprisoned before Friday and S&D not holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is not imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, excluding scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for this condition will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Given these conditions, will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? This referendum must have the consent of the London government and may be advisory, but not a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum without UK government permission.

para_P.title: Assuming that both Maria Corina Machado is incarcerated prior to Friday and S&D retains the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Scotland conduct an officially recognized referendum regarding independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following two scenarios as given:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is detained before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D has the largest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, including cases where S&D shares the top position with another party. The determination of this condition will rely on official declarations from the European Parliament or trustworthy media sources.

In light of these scenarios, will Scotland organize an officially sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom prior to May 3, 2024? This referendum must receive approval from the London government and can be advisory in nature, but it cannot be a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type referendum conducted without the consent of the UK government.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday? (b) Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for condition (b) will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(c) There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado not be imprisoned before Friday? (b) Will S&D not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if not all of the following conditions are met:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is not imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes scenarios where S&D is not tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for condition (b) will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(c) There is not a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is not held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may not be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, or by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must not be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

para_P.title: Are all of the following events going to take place: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be detained prior to Friday? (b) Will the S&D party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will there be an official referendum in Scotland regarding independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is detained before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D party secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This encompasses situations where S&D is tied for the highest number of seats with another party. The determination for criterion (b) will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or credible news sources.

(c) A referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom is conducted in Scotland, and this referendum takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; it does not need to have any legally binding consequences. It will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to authorize the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society organizations. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if reliable sources indicate that a candidate affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In case of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or announcement will be referenced. If the election does not take place before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Conditional on the Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question considers whether the Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election could be related to Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024.

Condition: The Republican Party must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. This is confirmed if credible sources report a Republican victory. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source will be used. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the condition is annulled.

Outcome: Biden is declared incapacitated if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, declaring him unable to discharge his duties, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of incapacity does not matter. Exiting office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.

not_P.title: Conditional on the Republican Party not retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question considers whether the Republican Party not retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election could be related to Biden not being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024.

Condition: The Republican Party must not win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. This is confirmed if credible sources report a Republican loss. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source will be used. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the condition is annulled.

Outcome: Biden is not declared incapacitated if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, declaring him unable to discharge his duties, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of incapacity does not matter. Exiting office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.

para_P.title: If the Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024, will Biden be deemed incapacitated as per Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines whether the Republican Party's retention of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election might be connected to Biden being deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024.

Condition: For this to be true, the Republican Party must secure a victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, a seat previously occupied by Bill Johnson. This will be validated if trustworthy sources announce a Republican win. If there are conflicting reports, an Ohio State source will be consulted. If no election takes place before January 1, 2025, this condition is void.

Outcome: Biden will be considered incapacitated if the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, stating he is unable to fulfill his responsibilities, leading the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of incapacity is irrelevant. Leaving office through other methods or invoking Section 3 does not apply.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election AND Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Resolution criteria for the condition: (a) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden must remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Given the Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election OR Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if the Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election or Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition: (a) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has not won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden must not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If the Republican Party holds on to Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024 AND Biden is deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if the Republican Party maintains control over Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024 and Biden is declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, while also remaining the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time). It will be answered with NO if Biden resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

Criteria for determining the condition: (a) Reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with statements from Ohio State being prioritized in case of disputes, and this election occurs before January 1, 2025. (b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office," leading to the Vice President acting as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern Time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden's exit from office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Criteria for the outcome: Biden must remain the US President until the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (2) Biden remains President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

(1) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. Additionally, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election nor Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (2) Biden does not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occur:

(1) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. Additionally, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves YES if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following scenarios to happen: (1) The Republican Party secures Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, (2) Biden continues to serve as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is considered a YES if both of the following conditions are satisfied:

(1) Reliable sources indicate that an individual affiliated with the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements being referenced in case of disputes, and the election takes place before January 1, 2025. Moreover, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) must invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President acting as the President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not contribute to a YES resolution.

(2) Biden must remain the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); the question resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his VP as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Lithuania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Lithuania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Lithuania fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

not_P.title: Given Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Lithuania secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also make it through?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In that case, will Slovenia compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Given both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Cyprus also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Lithuania and Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Cyprus participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement. 
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Cyprus qualifies for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement, and **No** otherwise. 
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Cyprus not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Lithuania and Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Cyprus participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement. 
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Cyprus does not qualify for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement, and **No** otherwise. 
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If both Lithuania and Slovenia secure their spots in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Cyprus also secure a spot?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Lithuania and Slovenia both take part in a Semi-final and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their places in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In this case, will Cyprus also take part in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is satisfied if Lithuania and Slovenia are confirmed for the Grand Final according to the EBU announcement. 
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Cyprus is confirmed for the Grand Final according to the EBU announcement, and **No** otherwise. 
- If the condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all three countries: Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus, participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus not all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the three countries: Lithuania, Slovenia, or Cyprus, does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If all of these countries qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if all three nations: Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus, take part in a Semi-final and are officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these nations fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
[image]

Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

not_P.title: Will USD be worth < 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
not_P.body:
[image]

Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: Is the value of USD expected to be 145 JPY or more at the market close on August 9, 2024?
para_P.body:
[image]

The market outcome will be determined based on the USD/JPY closing rate recorded on August 9, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Conditional on USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The USD is worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to the USD/JPY close listed on Yahoo! Finance. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Conditional on USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The USD is worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to the USD/JPY close listed on Yahoo! Finance. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, or for any other reason continue to be the director after October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: If the USD is valued at 145 JPY or more at the end of trading on August 9, 2024, will Kimberly Cheatle step down from her position as head of the Secret Service within the following 90 days?
para_P.body: Assuming the following condition holds: The USD is priced at a minimum of 145 JPY at the close of business on August 9, 2024, based on the USD/JPY closing rate provided by Yahoo! Finance. In that case, will Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold the director position before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on both USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, and Kimberly Cheatle no longer being the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance, and the USD is worth >= 145 JPY. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds her position before October 12, 2024. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and NO otherwise. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Conditional on both USD being worth < 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, or Kimberly Cheatle still being the director of the Secret Service on or after October 12, 2024, will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance, and the USD is worth < 145 JPY. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, or for any other reason still holds her position on or after October 12, 2024. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and NO otherwise. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Assuming that the USD is valued at 145 JPY or more at the closing on August 9, 2024, and that Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the head of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, will Donald Trump become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: Consider the following conditions: (a) The exchange rate for USD/JPY at the close on August 9, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance, indicates that the USD is valued at 145 JPY or higher. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, has either resigned, been terminated, or otherwise is not in her role before October 12, 2024. Under these circumstances, will Donald Trump be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer will be YES if Donald Trump is chosen as the nominee by the Republican National Convention, and NO if he is not. The outcome depends solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Kimberly Cheatle no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (c) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, must resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. (c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this is true, will Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this is true, will Biden not drop out and be able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Given that Asa Hutchinson is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw or be unable to continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time?

Criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the Republican National Convention delegates as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden withdraws or cannot continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: If Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee and Biden drops out before July 20, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) in a vote, according to reports from credible sources?

para_P.title: Should Asa Hutchinson become the Republican candidate and Biden withdraws prior to July 20, will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following conditions are met: Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and Biden either withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated before the stroke of midnight on July 20 Eastern Time. In that case, will the Pandemic Agreement be ratified during the voting at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024 based on information from reliable sources?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden drop out before July 20, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election, (2) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (3) during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. If any of these conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden drop out before July 20, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

If all of these conditions are met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will take place: (a) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined as **Yes** if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, irrespective of who is nominated on election day, (2) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time, and (3) during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is ratified in a vote, as reported by reliable sources. If any of these criteria are not fulfilled, this inquiry will be determined as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criterion for this condition: This is based on the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criterion for this outcome: This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual Republican nominee on the election day.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
