Resolution criterion for this condition: This is based on the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criterion for this outcome: This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual Republican nominee on the election day.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, will Chris Christie be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538. 

The criterion for resolving this condition: This is based on the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

Then, is it accurate to say that Chris Christie will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

The criterion for resolving this outcome: This is answered with Yes if Chris Christie is chosen as the nominee by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the selection made at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who the eventual Republican nominee is on election day.

question.title: Given both Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points and Chris Christie is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
2. Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is it true that Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition, both of the following must occur:
  (a) Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
  (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Given both Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points and Chris Christie is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead be 3 points or less on July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
2. Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is it true that Trump's lead over Biden will be 3 points or less on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition, both of the following must occur:
  (a) Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
  (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome, Trump's lead over Biden must be 3 points or less on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Considering that Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 4 points and that Chris Christie is the Republican candidate, will Trump's advantage be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: 
1. Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
2. Chris Christie has been designated as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is it accurate that Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Criteria for resolution:
- For the condition to be satisfied, both of the following must take place:
  (a) Trump's advantage over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
  (b) Chris Christie is confirmed as the nominee by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome, Trump's advantage over Biden needs to be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

If the condition is not fulfilled, the resolution will be N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes** if they are selected. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average, and will Chris Christie be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the national polling average from 538 shows that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead.

(b) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then subsequently removed, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

Then, will the BJP have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, expected for May 2024? This question resolves as Yes if the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, and No otherwise.

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will BJP not form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

Then, will the BJP not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, expected for May 2024? This question resolves as Yes if the BJP does not form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will the BJP secure the position of government after India's upcoming general elections in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements are not sufficient for resolution. The inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or potential reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024.

Consequently, will the BJP have an individual inaugurated as the next Prime Minister of India following the upcoming general elections anticipated for May 2024? This question is answered with Yes if the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, and No otherwise.

question.title: Given Trump is removed from a primary ballot and BJP forms government, will a Trump be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively. (2) The BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. 

Then, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? Resolves Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Resolves No otherwise.

not_P.title: Given Trump is not removed from a primary ballot or BJP does not form government, will no member of the Trump family be the 2024 Republican nominee?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively. (2) The BJP does not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. 

Then, will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? Resolves Yes if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: If Trump is excluded from a primary ballot and the BJP takes power, will a Trump be the Republican candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be substantiated by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry does not include legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively. (2) The BJP has a representative inaugurated as the next Prime Minister of India following the upcoming general elections. This question will be resolved for the next general election taking place after June 1, 2022, which is currently anticipated for May 2024.

Then, will a Trump family member be the Republican candidate for the U.S. Presidency in 2024? Resolves to Yes if one of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the U.S. Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Resolves to No otherwise.

question.body: This question will resolve as "Yes" if all of the following conditions are met: (1) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively. If all conditions are met, the answer is "Yes"; otherwise, it is "No."

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:

- OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must not indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus does not verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may not reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be less rigorous than "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, with verification from Metaculus that the commitment is satisfactory to at least one member of righttowarn.ai. 

Given this, will Joe Biden announce, before the end of July 2024 Pacific Time, both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term? The announcement must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned by then. If the announcement is made, this resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO on August 1st, 2024.

question.title: Given both (a) OpenAI commits to 'no retaliation for public risk disclosure' and (b) Joe Biden announces resignation by July 2024, will Iran initiate military action against Israel before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024. This means that before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:
- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

(b) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

For the purposes of this question, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. para_P.body:

(b) Joe Biden makes announcements that he is no longer a candidate for re-election and that he will resign and not finish his current term before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. A declaration of his intention to do so will be adequate for this market to resolve.

This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered. Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will be counted. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy forces will not be included.

question.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The linked market has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). Resolves NO otherwise. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The linked market has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Then, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). Resolves NO otherwise. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If the associated market reaches a minimum of 377 participants by the conclusion of July 15, will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The associated market has a minimum of 377 participants before the market closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Will Biden be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if the market has 377 participants before the market closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves to NO otherwise.

Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to announce that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). Resolves to NO otherwise. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden's departure from office due to death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

question.title: Given both the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15 and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for P: 
1. Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on 5 countries winning their debut gold and Kalenjin athletes winning both marathons at the 2024 Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the Games?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Olympics, at least 5 countries win their first-ever gold medal and both the men's and women's marathon races are won by athletes with Kalenjin roots. Then, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, and (2) both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will Portugal participate in a Semi-final and not be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: Should both Australia and Georgia make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Portugal also secure a spot?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Both Australia and Georgia take part in a Semi-final and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Then, will Portugal compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Australia, Georgia, and Portugal all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Australia, Georgia, or Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Australia, Georgia, or Portugal not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following occur: (a) Australia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (c) Portugal does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia, Georgia, and Portugal all qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Australia, Georgia, and Portugal all make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the following conditions are met: (a) Australia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Australia, Georgia, or Portugal fails to qualify, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Kimberly Cheatle must no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, due to resignation, being fired, or any other reason.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of acceptance. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made before the deadline.

not_P.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Kimberly Cheatle must no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, due to resignation, being fired, or any other reason.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of non-acceptance. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made before the deadline.

para_P.title: Should the head of the Secret Service step down in the upcoming 90 days, will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, either resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason is no longer serving as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. 

In that case, will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for the condition to be met: Kimberly Cheatle must cease to be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, due to resignation, termination, or any other cause.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive and unequivocal, allowing no possibility of acceptance. Resolves to NO if such a declaration is not made before the specified deadline.

question.title: Given both the head of the Secret Service resigns and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs:

(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds her position before October 12, 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, given these conditions, will Tucker Carlson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and **No** if any other candidate is selected.

not_P.title: Given both the head of the Secret Service does not resign and Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination, will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following does not occur:

(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, or for any other reason continues to hold her position before October 12, 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, given these conditions, will Tucker Carlson not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and **No** if Tucker Carlson is selected.

para_P.title: If both the head of the Secret Service steps down and Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Consider the following scenarios:

(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the head of the U.S. Secret Service, either resigns, is dismissed, or for any reason no longer occupies her role before October 12, 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that Joe Biden will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unequivocal and final, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

Under these conditions, will Tucker Carlson be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer will be **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen as the nominee by the Republican National Convention, and **No** if another candidate is selected.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(c) Will Tucker Carlson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) the head of the Secret Service does not resign within the next 90 days, (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (c) Tucker Carlson will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, or for any other reason still be the director of the Secret Service after October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden or his campaign not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(c) Will Tucker Carlson not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

para_P.title: Are all of the following events going to take place: (a) the head of the Secret Service steps down within the next 90 days, (b) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be terminated, or for any other reason cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle? The announcement must be explicit and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(c) Will Tucker Carlson be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will be answered with **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being chosen will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced in the future.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on election day in 2024; it is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: Will Team USA secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Olympic Games in Paris?
para_P.body: Resolves Yes if both the men's and women's teams achieve gold. Resolves No if either team finishes in a position other than first place.

question.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Then, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Then, will the Miami Heat not win the 2024 NBA Finals?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if the Miami Heat is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: If the United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Then, will the Miami Heat emerge as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?

Criteria for assessing the condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA earns both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team does not achieve gold.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is recognized as the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if any other team is declared champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from the running.

question.title: Given Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics and the Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. 

Then, is it true that the Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be considered broken if any athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or other credible sources.

not_P.title: Given Team USA does not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics or the Miami Heat does not win the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault not be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Team USA does not win gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or the Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. 

Then, is it true that the Olympic record for the men's pole vault will not be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be considered not broken if no athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or other credible sources.

para_P.title: If Team USA secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics and the Miami Heat clinches the 2024 NBA Finals, will the men's pole vault Olympic record be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Team USA achieves gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and the Miami Heat is declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. 

Then, can we ascertain that the Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The men's pole vault Olympic record will be deemed surpassed if any competitor successfully clears a height of 6.04m or more, based on results published by the International Olympic Committee or other reliable sources.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) The Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (2) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA, and (3) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. Resolves No if any of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) The Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is not broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if not all of the following conditions are met: (1) Team USA does not win gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (2) The Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA, and (3) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, no men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. Resolves No if all of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) The United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) The Miami Heat claims victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) The men's pole vault Olympic record is surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: Determines a Yes answer if each of the following criteria is satisfied: (1) Team USA achieves gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (2) The Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA, and (3) During the 2024 Paris Olympics, any male pole vaulter clears a height of 6.04m or more, as reported by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Determines a No answer if any of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will either resign, be dismissed, or for any other reason cease to hold the position of director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director before October 12, 2024. Given this scenario, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for President Biden to drop out of the presidential race before July 20, 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: P is considered true if Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the Secret Service for any reason by October 12, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Q: Q resolves to YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the provided source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

not_P.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director before October 12, 2024. Given this scenario, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for President Biden to drop out of the presidential race before July 20, 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: P is considered true if Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the Secret Service for any reason by October 12, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Q: Q resolves to YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the provided source shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators have called for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Should the Director of the Secret Service step down in the upcoming 90 days, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or otherwise ceases to be the director before October 12, 2024. In light of this situation, will 10 or more Democratic Senators request that President Biden exit the presidential campaign before July 20, 2024?

Criteria for determining P: P is deemed true if Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the head of the Secret Service for any reason by October 12, 2024.
Criteria for determining Q: Q is resolved as YES if at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the specified source indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to withdraw. Conversely, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, AND 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, will ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, AND (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, as indicated by the New York Times interactive 2024 elections page. Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is still the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, OR fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, will ChatGPT not be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, remains the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, OR (b) fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, as indicated by the New York Times interactive 2024 elections page. Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: If Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the head of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, AND at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside before July 20, 2024, will ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any reason ceases to be the director before October 12, 2024, AND (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, as reported by the New York Times interactive 2024 elections page. Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

The outcome will be determined as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

By "accessible to the public," it is meant that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to specific groups (such as minors), the outcome will still be considered positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can use it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The outcome remains positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).
