If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, remain the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024? (b) Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, as indicated by the New York Times interactive 2024 elections page? (c) Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators will demand that Biden withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, and (c) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be broadly accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, step down, be dismissed, or otherwise no longer hold the position of director before October 12, 2024? (b) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators request that Biden drop out before July 20, 2024, as reported by the New York Times interactive 2024 elections page? (c) Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024? The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. "Broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to specific groups (like minors), the answer will still be positive as long as more than 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered positive even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Iran not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault linked to Iran has taken place within the territory of Israel resulting in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Given Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Between the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

not_P.title: Given Iran does not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close outside the range of 75k to 76k on July 21, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Between the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

para_P.title: If Iran executes a lethal strike inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Between the time this question is posed and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an incident linked to Iran, occurring within the territory of Israel, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people. Then, on July 21, 2024, will the final closing figure of the BSE SENSEX be above 75,000 and at or below 76,000 as reported by Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Given both an Iranian deadly attack in Israel before May 1, 2024, and BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024, will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals, and (b) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will Mike Pence be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given both an Iranian deadly attack in Israel before May 1, 2024, and BSE SENSEX closing outside the range of 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024, will Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals, and (b) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is not greater than 75,000 or less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will Mike Pence not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If there is a lethal assault linked to Iran in Israel prior to May 1, 2024, and the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024, will Mike Pence be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) After the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack attributed to Iran has occurred within the borders of Israel, resulting in the deaths of at least five people, and (b) on July 21, 2024, the BSE SENSEX closes at a value exceeding 75,000 but not surpassing 76,000 as per Yahoo Finance. Then, will Mike Pence be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will be answered as **Yes** if Mike Pence is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, (b) the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k, and (c) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals, (b) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance, and (c) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Condition (c) is not restricted to the candidates currently known; other options may be added in the future. The resolution of condition (c) is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Iran does not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, (b) the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is not greater than 75k or not less than or equal to 76k, or (c) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals, (b) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is not greater than 75,000 or not less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance, and (c) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Condition (c) is not restricted to the candidates currently known; other options may be added in the future. The resolution of condition (c) is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) A lethal assault by Iran occurs within Israel's territory prior to May 1, 2024, (b) the BSE SENSEX closes at a value exceeding 75,000 but not surpassing 76,000 on July 21, 2024, and (c) Mike Pence becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if each of the following criteria is fulfilled: (a) after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information suggests that an attack linked to Iran has taken place within the borders of Israel, resulting in the deaths of at least five people, (b) on July 21, 2024, the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX is more than 75,000 and at most 76,000 as reported by Yahoo Finance, and (c) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The determination of condition (c) is not limited to the candidates currently known; additional candidates may emerge later. The outcome of condition (c) is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on June 28th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as reported by [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), with verification by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 3.5 would indicate Trump is 3.5 points ahead of Biden.

not_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 3.5 would indicate Trump is 3.5 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: On June 28, 2024, if Nvidia's market cap exceeds that of Apple, will Trump's advantage over Biden fall between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as per Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). 

Then, can we affirm that Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential race will be greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the data chart for that date, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, a reading of 3.5 means Trump is leading Biden by 3.5 points.

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap surpassing Apple's and Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points, will Nigel Farage be elected as an MP in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).
(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if credible media reports or official announcements confirm that Nigel Farage is elected as an MP for any UK constituency. The question resolves as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap not surpassing Apple's or Trump's lead over Biden being outside the range of 3 to 4 points, will Nigel Farage not be elected as an MP in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).
(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage not be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if there are no credible media reports or official announcements confirming that Nigel Farage is elected as an MP for any UK constituency. The question resolves as **No** if this does occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

para_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple and Trump's advantage over Biden is between 3 and 4 points, will Nigel Farage secure a seat as an MP in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: 
(a) By June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is confirmed to be greater than Apple's, as per Companies Market Cap around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).
(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is more than 3 but less than or equal to 4 points, according to Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election taking place on July 4, 2024? This question will be considered **Yes** if reliable media sources or official statements indicate that Nigel Farage has been elected as an MP for any constituency in the UK. It will be deemed **No** if this does not happen, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed past July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and (c) Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, or (c) Nigel Farage not be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(c) This question will resolve as **No** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is not elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **Yes** if this occurs, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple's by June 28, 2024, (b) Trump's margin over Biden is more than 3 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and (c) Nigel Farage wins a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as per [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as illustrated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(c) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, during the 2024 UK general election on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as a member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The resolution will be **No** if this does not happen, unless the general election is cancelled or delayed past July 4, 2024, in which case the inquiry will be **annulled**.

The resolution should reference reliable media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other significant UK news organizations; or the official statement from the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is standing as a candidate.

Farage does not need to be sworn in as an MP for the inquiry to resolve as **Yes** -- the resolution is based solely on his election or non-election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will Asa Hutchinson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Asa Hutchinson is chosen as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and NO otherwise. The resolution is based on the selection at the convention, not on who receives the nomination on the election day.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination, will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would decline the nomination.

Given this, will Asa Hutchinson not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Asa Hutchinson is not chosen as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and NO otherwise. The resolution is based on the selection at the convention, not on who receives the nomination on the election day.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
Imagine that Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will neither run for nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be straightforward and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would consider accepting the nomination.

In light of this, will Asa Hutchinson be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The outcome is YES if Asa Hutchinson is appointed as the Republican nominee by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, and NO in all other cases. The determination is made based on the choice at the convention, not on who is nominated on the election day.

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not accept the Democratic nomination and Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee, will the BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, with a definitive, public, official, unambiguous statement; and (b) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance?

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden accepts the Democratic nomination or Asa Hutchinson is not the Republican nominee, will the BSE SENSEX not close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, with a definitive, public, official, unambiguous statement; or (b) Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be less than or equal to 76,000 or greater than 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance?

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declines the Democratic nomination and Asa Hutchinson is chosen as the Republican candidate, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: (a) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in a clear and official manner; and (b) Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Will the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be more than 76,000 and at most 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, (b) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

(b) Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(c) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

para_P.title: Are the following events all expected to happen: (a) Glenn Youngkin becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Anthropic releases a report detailing findings from an external safety red-team evaluation of their models by June 30, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This inquiry will resolve as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report with the outcomes from an *external* party assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) This inquiry will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as No.

question.title: Given both Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee and Kamala's odds increase, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

question.title: If Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two political events in 2024. 

Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Larry Elder will be the Republican candidate to run for the presidency in the November 2024 US election.

Then, we ask if the following is true: Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. This resolves as **Yes** if, for any reason, Sunak does not win a seat as an MP in the election. If Sunak is elected as an MP for any constituency, it resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome should cite credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate, if applicable.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both ending on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in hypothetical scenarios are either leading or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of the first poll's formula minus the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will remain active until the closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will he be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:

This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The calculation is based on the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. Then, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for witness tampering: The question resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. This resolves YES if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

Then, given these conditions, will Joe Biden die before Saturday? This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump does not gain 3% among Manifold respondents against Biden and is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents. There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll does not exceed that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. (b) Donald Trump is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. This resolves YES if Trump is not charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

Then, given these conditions, will Joe Biden not die before Saturday? This resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Trump increases his support by 3% among Manifold survey participants against Biden and faces charges of witness tampering in Georgia, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: (a) When competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump secures at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold survey participants. There are two Manifold polls concluding on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat. This resolves to YES if Trump's vote percentage in the Biden poll surpasses that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude. (b) Donald Trump faces charges of witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024. This resolves to YES if Trump is charged for any remarks related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

Given these stipulations, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday? This resolves to YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents and Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024 (2) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
question.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This part of the question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Additionally, Donald Trump must be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(2) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents and Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024 (2) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
not_P.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This part of the question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Additionally, Donald Trump must not be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must not occur before June 1, 2024.

(2) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) In a direct matchup against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump secures a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants and Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024 (2) Joe Biden passes away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
(1) Two polls from Manifold will conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in the hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This segment of the question will resolve as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or greater at the time both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

Furthermore, Donald Trump must face charges or indictments concerning any remarks related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. These charges must be issued before June 1, 2024.

(2) Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Given at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI has been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is determined by the July 2024 poll results showing a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats, or if they are tied for the most seats with another group, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Given at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI has been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is determined by the July 2024 poll results showing a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: At least 30% of Manifold participants agree that weak AGI has been realized before July 23, 2024. This is established by the July 2024 survey results indicating a YES/(NO + YES) ratio that is at least 0.3, disregarding those with 'no opinion'.

Then, is it accurate to say that GUE/NGL will have the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This is deemed Yes if GUE/NGL possesses the most seats, or if they are tied for the most seats with another party, based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Conditional on both (a) at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (b) GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections.

(a) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024: Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding. Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th. This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

(b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: This question will resolve as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?

The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

If the condition is not met, resolve N/A.

However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will happen: (1) A minimum of 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was achieved prior to July 23, 2024, (2) GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (3) Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was achieved prior to July 23, 2024: Each month, a poll is conducted on Manifold to gather the consensus opinion on advancements towards AGI. Unlike many other markets and inquiries on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," without providing a definition for the term. The aim is to characterize AI progress broadly, allowing respondents to vote based on their personal interpretations. Progress has been consistent. Previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

Prior markets on this subject significantly underestimated Manifold's confidence in AI advancements, such as:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any particular model or define "AGI," except to clarify that the poll does not necessitate the software system's ability to interact with the physical world. The polls are open from the 23rd to the 30th of each month. This market will resolve to YES if the poll results in July 2024 show a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) of 0.3 or greater. The "no opinion" responses will be disregarded. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

(2) GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: This question will be answered Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and No for all other political parties. If two parties are tied in seat count, both will be considered Yes. This determination is based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

(3) Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024: The latest qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden participates in another such in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve NO. 

This market does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only include 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past interviews on 60 Minutes each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a trustworthy news source report the event no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and credible news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours ahead of President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not meet the criteria.

If President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, this market will be deemed N/A.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it 6 hours in advance, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out, and a reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This condition will not be met if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given this, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election? The question resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when they select a male presidential nominee.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it 6 hours in advance, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out, and a reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This condition will not be met if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given this, will the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election? The question resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when they select a female presidential nominee.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden withdraws and a credible news source reports it 6 hours prior, will a Woman be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Joe Biden withdraws, and a credible news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This condition will not be satisfied if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

In light of this, will the Democratic delegates choose a female presidential candidate for the 2024 election? The question resolves to “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a female presidential candidate for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when they choose a male presidential candidate.

question.title: Given both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman, then will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

(a) A big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout, if he does drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, confirmed by herself before August 7th?

This question resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.
This question resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate.

not_P.title: Given both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden does not drop out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman, then will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick not be Kelly or Shapiro?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

(a) A big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout, if he does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The Democratic delegates do not select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Then, will Kamala Harris not announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, confirmed by herself before August 7th?

This question resolves YES if Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.
This question resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate.

para_P.title: If both of the following conditions are met: (a) Should Joe Biden withdraw from the race, will a trustworthy news organization report on the event at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Candidate be a Woman, will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice Presidential choice?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) A major and credible news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on President Joe Biden's potential withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before his formal dropout announcement, provided he does indeed withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The Democratic delegates nominate a woman for the presidential candidacy in the 2024 election.

Then, will Kamala Harris declare her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, confirmed by her before August 7th?

This inquiry will be answered with YES if Kamala Harris names either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate.
This inquiry will be answered with NO if Kamala Harris chooses anyone else for her running mate.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? (c) Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
(a) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.
Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.
This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.
Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(c) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? (c) Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
not_P.body:
(a) Question resolves NO if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.
Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will be sufficient.
This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates do not select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(c) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.
