para_P.title: If Joe Biden decides to withdraw, will a trustworthy news source report the event at least 6 hours beforehand? Additionally, will the Democratic nominee for the 2024 Presidential election be a woman? Lastly, will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice Presidential candidate (YES), or will she choose someone else (NO)?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be marked as YES if a major and dependable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be labeled as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This will be marked as YES if and when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. It will be marked as NO if and when the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election.

(c) Currently, the leading candidates for Kamala's running mate are Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports indicate that Kamala will make her choice before August 7th. This market will be marked YES if and when Kamala Harris announces her selection of either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate. It will be marked NO if and when Kamala Harris announces a different individual as her running mate. I will wait for Kamala herself to confirm the selection before resolving this.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will no athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any tennis player achieves a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will at least 24 world records be broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria:
- Condition (P): Resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
- Outcome (Q): Resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. If fewer than 24 world records are broken, resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will fewer than 24 world records be broken?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will fewer than 24 world records be broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria:
- Condition (P): Resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
- Outcome (Q): Resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is fewer than 24. If 24 or more world records are broken, resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If a tennis player secures more than one medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the number of world records broken reach at least 24?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A tennis player earns no fewer than two medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Consequently, will the total of world records broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics be 24 or higher?

Resolution criteria:
- Condition (P): Resolves as **Yes** if any tennis player wins two or more medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
- Outcome (Q): Resolves as **Yes** if the tally of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or above. If the count of broken world records is less than 24, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis and at least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal in tennis, and (b) At least 24 world records are broken. Given this scenario, we ask whether the United States Olympic Team will win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Resolution Criteria for the Condition: 
- Condition (a) is met if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis.
- Condition (b) is met if the number of world records broken is 24 or greater.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the United States wins more Gold medals than Silver medals.
- Resolves NO if they do not.

not_P.title: Given both an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis and at least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA not win more Gold than Silver medals?
not_P.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal in tennis, and (b) At least 24 world records are broken. Given this scenario, we ask whether the United States Olympic Team will not win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Resolution Criteria for the Condition: 
- Condition (a) is met if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis.
- Condition (b) is met if the number of world records broken is 24 or greater.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the United States does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals.
- Resolves NO if they do.

para_P.title: If an athlete secures multiple medals in tennis and at least 24 world records are surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA achieve a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates the hypothetical situation where both of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete earns more than one medal in tennis, and (b) At least 24 world records are set. Under this premise, we question whether the United States Olympic Team will accumulate more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Criteria for Assessing the Conditions: 
- Condition (a) is fulfilled if any athlete claims at least two medals in tennis.
- Condition (b) is satisfied if the count of world records broken is 24 or higher.

Criteria for Determining the Outcome: 
- Resolves to YES if the United States garners more Gold medals than Silver medals.
- Resolves to NO if they do not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, (2) At least 24 world records are broken, (3) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis, (2) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater, (3) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, (2) At least 24 world records are broken, (3) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if not all of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) No athlete wins at least two medals for tennis, (2) The number of world records broken is less than 24, (3) The United States Olympic Team does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals.

para_P.title: Will every one of these events take place at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) A tennis player secures multiple medals, (2) A minimum of 24 world records are set, (3) The USA achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if all of the following criteria are fulfilled during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) Any tennis player earns at least two medals, (2) The total number of world records established is 24 or more, (3) The United States Olympic Team earns a greater number of Gold medals than Silver medals.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

not_P.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 75k or greater than 77k?
not_P.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the BSE SENSEX close above 75,000 and at or below 77,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the BSE SENSEX closing value and Iran's potential military action against Israel.

Condition: The closing value of the BSE SENSEX must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

Outcome: Resolves to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Military action is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, officially acknowledged by Iran or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are considered. Proxy attacks do not count. Resolves to "No" otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on BSE SENSEX closing not between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Iran not initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between the BSE SENSEX closing value and Iran's potential military action against Israel.

Condition: The closing value of the BSE SENSEX must not be greater than 75,000 or less than or equal to 77,000 on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

Outcome: Resolves to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Military action is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, officially acknowledged by Iran or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are considered. Proxy attacks do not count. Resolves to "No" otherwise.

If the condition is met, the question resolves to N/A.

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, will Iran launch a military action prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX and the likelihood of Iran taking military action against Israel.

Condition: The BSE SENSEX must close at a value exceeding 75,000 and at or below 77,000 on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

Outcome: This will be marked as "Yes" if Iran carries out military operations on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas between July 30 and August 12, 2024, by 11:59 PM ET. Military operations are defined as any forceful action executed by Iran on Israeli land, which is either officially recognized by Iran or widely corroborated by credible sources. This encompasses air raids, naval strikes, or ground assaults. Actions such as cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures do not qualify. Only actions that are explicitly claimed by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory are taken into account. Proxy attacks are excluded. It will be marked as "No" in all other cases.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Given both BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Iran initiates military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, will a Trump family member be the Republican nominee in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
2. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This includes any use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count, not attacks by proxy forces.

Given these conditions, will a member of the Trump family (Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump) be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

not_P.title: Given both BSE SENSEX does not close between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, or Iran does not initiate military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, will no Trump family member be the Republican nominee in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is not greater than 75,000 or not less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
2. Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This excludes any use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, and includes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Actions not explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory do not count, including attacks by proxy forces.

Given these conditions, will no member of the Trump family (Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump) be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, and Iran launches military operations against Israel from July 30 to August 12, 2024, will a member of the Trump family secure the Republican nomination in 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider the following scenarios:

1. On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is above 75,000 and at most 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.
2. Iran carries out military actions on Israeli land, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024, by 11:59 PM ET. This encompasses any military force utilized by Iran that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or a consensus of reliable news sources, such as airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions, but does not include cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures. Only actions that are explicitly stated by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory are considered, excluding attacks by proxy forces.

Based on these conditions, will a Trump family member (Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump) be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024? (c) Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as "Yes" if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000.

(b) This question resolves as "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, count. Attacks by proxy forces do not count.

(c) This question resolves as "Yes" if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 75k or greater than 77k? (b) Will Iran not initiate a military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024? (c) Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as "Yes" if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 77,000.

(b) This question resolves as "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, count. Attacks by proxy forces do not count.

(c) This question resolves as "Yes" if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

A "military operation" refers to any forceful action conducted by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime borders that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports, including airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers do not qualify. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil, are considered. Attacks carried out by proxy groups are excluded.

(c) This question is marked as "Yes" if any of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump

question.title: Suppose the BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024. Will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two separate events:

1. **Condition (P):** On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000. This is determined based on the closing value reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. **Outcome of Interest (Q):** On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. This forecast must show Biden having a higher probability of winning than Trump on that specific day, as indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's website.

The question asks whether, given that the BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, FiveThirtyEight will project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024.

not_P.title: Suppose the BSE SENSEX does not close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024. Will FiveThirtyEight not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:

1. **Condition (P):** On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is not greater than 76,000 or not less than or equal to 77,000. This is determined based on the closing value reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. **Outcome of Interest (Q):** On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is not projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. This forecast must show Biden not having a higher probability of winning than Trump on that specific day, as indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's website.

The question asks whether, given that the BSE SENSEX does not close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, FiveThirtyEight will not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024.

2. **Outcome of Interest (Q):** On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is forecasted by FiveThirtyEight to be the leading candidate in the US presidential race against Donald Trump. question.title: If Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:

question.title: Given Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and 10+ Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out by July 20, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024, and (b) at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out according to the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html.

Then, is Ted Cruz selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and **No** otherwise.

not_P.title: Given Trump is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, or 10+ Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out by July 20, 2024, will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024, or (b) at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, do 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out according to the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html.

Then, is Ted Cruz not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and **No** otherwise.

para_P.title: If Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, and more than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race by July 20, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any remarks related to possible witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024, and (b) by midnight July 20 Central Time, at least 10 Democratic Senators request Biden to step down as per the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html.

Then, is Ted Cruz nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and **No** in all other cases.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, or (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to no. Otherwise, it will resolve to yes.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will the following events take place: (a) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, and (c) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any statements about potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the indictments needing to occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) According to this source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html, if it is shown that 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to step down at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

(c) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is named the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. The resolution is not limited to the current candidates listed; additional options may emerge later.

The determination of this question does not depend on who is the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election; it is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per the NBA's official records. Given this condition, we are interested in whether France will place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must win the 2024 NBA Finals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: France must place in the top 5 in the Olympic medal table, calculated by the total number of medals and ordered by the number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per the NBA's official records. Given this condition, we are interested in whether France will not place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must win the 2024 NBA Finals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: France must not place in the top 5 in the Olympic medal table, calculated by the total number of medals and ordered by the number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: If the New York Knicks are victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals, will France achieve a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation in which the New York Knicks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the official NBA records. Under this premise, we seek to determine whether France will secure a position in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must triumph in the 2024 NBA Finals.

Criteria for the outcome: France must finish in the top 5 of the Olympic medal standings, which are determined by the total count of medals, prioritized by Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question remains unresolved if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Given both the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. (2) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024, based on the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The Olympics must take place in 2024 for this condition to be valid.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is determined by the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The question resolves positively if the US is the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

not_P.title: Given both the New York Knicks do not win the 2024 NBA Finals and France does not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) The New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. (2) France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024, based on the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The Olympics must take place in 2024 for this condition to be valid.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team not be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is determined by the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The question resolves positively if the US is not the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

para_P.title: If the New York Knicks secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals and France achieves a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Table in Paris 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: (1) The New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per the NBA's ruling. (2) France finishes in the top 5 (with ties favoring them) at the Olympics occurring in 2024, based on the overall medal count ranked by Gold, Silver, and then Bronze. The Olympics must indeed occur in 2024 for this premise to be applicable.

Under these circumstances, will the United States Olympic Team be the sole highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal standings are determined by the cumulative number of medals earned, ranked by Gold, Silver, and then Bronze. The outcome is considered positive if the US stands as the sole highest ranked team, ambiguous if the Olympics do not happen before 2027, and negative if any other team matches or surpasses the US ranking.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention. (2) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. (3) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) USA does not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if not all of the following conditions are met: (1) The New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention. (2) France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. (3) The United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve positively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) The New York Knicks become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) France secures a Top 5 position at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) The USA leads the Olympic Medal Count at Paris 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if all of these criteria are fulfilled: (1) The New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be marked as **No** for any other teams if they are out of the running. (2) France finishes within the top 5 (ties are considered favorable) at the 2024 Olympics. It will be marked as unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024. The medal standings are determined by the total medals earned by each participating nation, ranked by: 1. Total Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie in Gold) Total Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie in Silver) Total Bronze Medals. (3) The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be marked as unclear if the Paris Olympics do not happen before 2027. It will be marked as **No** if any team matches or surpasses the ranking of the US team. The medal standings are calculated by summing up all medals won by each participating country and ranking them by: 1. Total Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie in Gold) Total Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie in Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: If USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be > 3 and <= 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The USD/JPY exchange rate is worth 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The exchange rate must be 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be between 3 and 4 points (inclusive of 4) in the 538 national polling average on July 15, 2024, as accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: If USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The USD/JPY exchange rate is worth 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The exchange rate must be 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points in the 538 national polling average on July 15, 2024, as accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Should the value of USD reach at least 145 JPY by the end of trading on August 9th, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average from 538 on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming that the USD/JPY exchange rate is at least 145 yen for each dollar at the conclusion of trading on August 9th, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

Then, can we confirm that Donald Trump has a lead of more than 3 and up to 4 points over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election on July 15, 2024?

Criteria for the condition: The exchange rate must be 145 or higher yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance.

Criteria for the outcome: Trump's advantage over Biden needs to be between 3 and 4 points (including 4) in the 538 national polling average on July 15, 2024, as checked on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Conditional on both USD/JPY >= 145 on August 9, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden being >3 and <=4 on July 15, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions:

(a) The USD must be worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given that both conditions (a) and (b) are true, will any of the following occur before June 1, 2024?

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Resolution Criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if any of the above events occur before June 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. If none of these events occur, it resolves as **No**. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on both USD/JPY < 145 on August 9, 2024, or Trump's lead over Biden being <=3 or >4 on July 15, 2024, will there be no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Consider the following conditions:

(a) The USD must be worth less than 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given that at least one of the conditions (a) or (b) is not true, will none of the following occur before June 1, 2024?

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Resolution Criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if none of the above events occur before June 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. If any of these events occur, it resolves as **No**. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Given that the USD/JPY exchange rate is at least 145 on August 9, 2024, and Trump's margin over Biden is greater than 3 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Take into account these conditions:

If none of these events take place, it will be marked as **No**. If either condition (a) or (b) is not satisfied, the question will be marked as N/A.

(a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(c) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is either not dropping out or not resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is not sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare that he is withdrawing from the presidential race and stepping down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign, thus not finishing his current term. Such declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, it is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated his position by the end of July. A statement of his plans to do so will suffice to resolve this market.

If this does not occur, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: GIVEN Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out of the presidential race and resigning from the presidency. This announcement must be made in Pacific Time by the end of July 2024, but the actual resignation does not need to occur by then. 

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7th, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Joe Biden makes the specified announcements by the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time.
- The outcome resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and NO if she announces anyone else. The announcement must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself before August 7th, 2024.

not_P.title: GIVEN Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick not be Kelly or Shapiro?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out of the presidential race and resigning from the presidency. This announcement must be made in Pacific Time by the end of July 2024, but the actual resignation does not need to occur by then. 

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will not announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7th, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Joe Biden makes the specified announcements by the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time.
- The outcome resolves YES if Kamala Harris does not announce her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and NO if she announces either of them. The announcement must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself before August 7th, 2024.

para_P.title: IF Joe Biden declares his intention to withdraw and resign, will Kamala Harris select Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
para_P.body:
Imagine the following scenario: Joe Biden declares before the conclusion of July 2024 that he is both withdrawing from the presidential campaign and stepping down from the presidency. This declaration must occur in Pacific Time by the end of July 2024, although the actual resignation does not have to take place by that time. 

In this case, will Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7th, 2024? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- The condition is satisfied if Joe Biden makes the specified declarations by the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time.
- The outcome is a YES if Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and a NO if she chooses anyone else. The announcement must be made by Kamala Harris herself prior to August 7th, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Biden resigning and Harris picking Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, and (2) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Resolves YES if both (1) and (2) occur as described.
- Resolves NO if either (1) does not occur by August 1, 2024, or (2) if Kamala Harris picks someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.
- Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden resigning and Harris picking someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, will Israel not expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, and (2) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Then, will Israel not expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Resolves YES if both (1) and (2) occur as described.
- Resolves NO if either (1) does not occur by August 1, 2024, or (2) if Kamala Harris picks either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.
- Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Biden steps down and Harris selects either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, will Israel extend its ground offensive to Rafah prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (1) Joe Biden declares that he will not seek re-election and will resign, not completing his term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, and (2) Kamala Harris reveals her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. In this scenario, will Israel proceed to expand its ground offensive into the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: 
- Resolves to YES if both (1) and (2) happen as stated.
- Resolves to NO if either (1) does not take place by August 1, 2024, or (2) if Kamala Harris selects a candidate other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: 
- Resolves to YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) indicates Israeli military actions on its map at any of six sites around Rafah before June 1, 2024.
- Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator not say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators does not utter the word "deepfake." If this does happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has not uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the term "deepfake" be mentioned by Trump, Biden, or a moderator during the CNN debate taking place in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, during the airing of the presidential debate organized by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators says the word "deepfake." If this does not occur, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

The determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has said "deepfake" will be at the exclusive discretion of the Admins of Metaculus. They will have the final authority to decide whether this has occurred, and their decision will be conclusive. In situations of uncertainty, they may refer to CNN's official transcript, which is usually available at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It is crucial to understand that in the absence of a clear mention of the word, particularly if it is not recorded in the transcript, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: GIVEN both deepfake is mentioned in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024, and Mike Pence is the Republican nominee, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake," and (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if, before August 1, 2024, there is an official statement or credible report of diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China as specified in the Metaculus question.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) "deepfake" is said in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators says "deepfake." Metaculus's Admins will decide if this has occurred, potentially consulting CNN's transcript. If "deepfake" is not clearly uttered, it resolves as **No**.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(c) This resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, the Philippines or the PRC expels or recalls a diplomat from the other country, according to official statements or credible reports. If no such reports exist by that date, it resolves as **No."

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) "deepfake" is not said in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) no diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators does not say "deepfake." Metaculus's Admins will decide if this has occurred, potentially consulting CNN's transcript. If "deepfake" is clearly uttered, it resolves as **No**.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(c) This resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, the Philippines and the PRC do not expel or recall a diplomat from the other country, according to official statements or credible reports. If such reports exist by that date, it resolves as **No".

para_P.title: Are the following events all going to take place: (a) the term "deepfake" is mentioned during the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, (b) Mike Pence secures the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) there are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered **Yes** if during the airing of the presidential debate hosted by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators references the term "deepfake." The decision will be made by Metaculus's Admins, who may refer to CNN's transcript. If the term "deepfake" is not distinctly mentioned, it will be deemed **No**.

(b) This will be deemed **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is made solely based on the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention.

(c) This will be considered **Yes** if, before August 1, 2024, either the Philippines or the People's Republic of China expels or recalls a diplomat from the other nation, as confirmed by official statements or credible reports. If no such reports are available by that date, it will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Conditional on at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. These polls ask "has weak AGI been achieved," allowing respondents to vote based on their own understanding without a specific definition. The goal is to characterize AI progress broadly.

The poll results from previous months have shown a steady increase in the percentage of respondents agreeing that weak AGI has been achieved, with the latest results being 15% and 27% in the respective months.

The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI has been achieved. Then is it true that the Crimean Bridge will be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?

This question about the Crimean Bridge will resolve as YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.body:
Each month, a poll on Manifold is conducted to capture the collective opinion on advancements towards AGI. These polls inquire "has weak AGI been realized," permitting participants to cast their votes based on personal interpretations without a strict definition. The aim is to broadly assess AI development.

Recent poll outcomes have indicated a consistent rise in the fraction of participants affirming that weak AGI has been realized, with the latest figures being 15% and 27% in consecutive months.

The July 2024 poll will conclude with a YES if the proportion of YES/(NO + YES) is at least 0.3, disregarding those with "no opinion." If not, it will conclude with a NO.

Assuming the following holds: At least 30% of participants in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI has been realized. Then can we conclude that the Crimean Bridge will experience an attack prior to July 1, 2024?

This inquiry regarding the Crimean Bridge will be resolved as YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, reputable sources indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the bridge's structural integrity. If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given that at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, and the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, based on the monthly poll results, and (b) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for condition:
- For (a), the market resolves to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3.
- For (b), the market resolves to YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- The question resolves as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

not_P.title: Given that at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI was not achieved before July 23, 2024, or the Crimean Bridge is not attacked before July 1, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden not be greater than 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

- For (b), the market resolves to YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has not been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

- The question resolves as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.body:
Let us consider the following assumptions: (a) A minimum of 30% of Manifold respondents believe that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, based on monthly polling data, and (b) The Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, as confirmed by reliable sources.

Under these conditions, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?

Criteria for determining the condition:
- For (a), the market resolves to YES if the poll results from July 2024 show a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) that is at least 0.3.
- For (b), the market resolves to YES if credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been attacked with weapons, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the bridge's integrity after May 2, 2024, but before July 1, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome:
- The question resolves as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as documented in the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

not_P.title: Will Linda Yaccarino not be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Linda Yaccarino holds the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino occupies the CEO role at Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or reliable news outlets.

question.title: Given Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as CEO on July 1, 2024.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.
- If no such announcement is made by the deadline, the outcome resolves as **No**.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Sha'Carri Richardson winning a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any event she competes in.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves positively if the United States Olympic Team is the highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. Resolves negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver and Bronze Medals in case of ties.

question.title: Conditional on both Sha'Carri Richardson winning a gold medal and USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves Yes if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves No if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: The question will be answered Yes if the Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. It will be answered No if another team wins the championship or if the Miami Heat is no longer in the running.

The question will be answered affirmatively if both (a) and (b) take place as outlined.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in similar hypothetical scenarios is either ahead or within that margin. Do Manifold participants reflect the views of the broader public?

This market will settle as YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question are guaranteed to never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.
