question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% against Biden among Manifold respondents and Sunak fails in 2024, will Trump be blocked from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents; (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election.

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? 

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Given Trump gains less than 3% against Biden among Manifold respondents or Sunak is elected in 2024, will Trump not be blocked from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following occurs: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents; (b) Rishi Sunak is elected in the 2024 UK General Election.

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question resolves as **No** if for any reason Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? 

This question will resolve as "No" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is still removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: If Trump secures a minimum of 3% advantage over Biden among Manifold participants and Sunak does not succeed in 2024, will Trump be disqualified from any primary ballot due to the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Consider the following scenarios: (a) Against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump achieves at least a 3% lead among Manifold participants; (b) Rishi Sunak does not win the 2024 UK General Election.

(a) There are two polls from Manifold, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other queries respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion consistently indicates Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically polled is either ahead or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will resolve to YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the percentage from poll 1 minus the percentage from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, it is NO.

The polls and this question will remain open until the closing time, regardless of circumstances.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution must reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources, or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Then, is it accurate that Donald Trump will be prohibited or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? 

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially prohibited or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The prohibition or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur *after* the stated date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been prohibited from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that all of the following will happen: (a) Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat; (b) Rishi Sunak is not elected in the 2024 UK General Election; (c) Donald Trump is either removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) There are two polls conducted by Manifold that will close on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for a vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, whereas all other surveyed Democrats either lead or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents reflective of the general populace?

This market will resolve to YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, it will be NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Should Sunak be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution must refer to [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

(c) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of removal or barring must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if the specified conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place *after* the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or barred from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling figures between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number signifies that Trump is ahead, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Donald Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 4 or less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as not the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 4 or less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will Joe Biden not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Joe Biden has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, if Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4, will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average. Will Joe Biden be projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024?

Criteria for assessing the condition: This is determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, which was consulted by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

Criteria for assessing the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is forecasted to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher chance. If both have the same odds, it resolves to 50-50. The source for the resolution is the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and 538 projecting Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

not_P.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, or 538 not projecting Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Nigel Farage not be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are not met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 3 and not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage not be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is not elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

para_P.title: Assuming Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, and 538 indicates Biden as the preferred candidate on July 19, 2024, will Nigel Farage secure a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider the following circumstances:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by a margin greater than 3 and not exceeding 4 in the national polling average according to 538 for the 2024 presidential election. This information is derived from the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

2. On July 19, 2024, the FiveThirtyEight election forecast shows that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. This is based on the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for that date, and it will be finalized when the data points for July 20 are available. If no data points for July 19 are provided by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will rely on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Under these conditions, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election taking place on July 4, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nigel Farage is elected as the MP for any UK constituency in the 2024 general election on July 4, 2024. It will be resolved as **No** if he is not elected, unless the general election is cancelled or delayed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. The resolution should reference credible media reports from sources like the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other significant UK news outlets; or the official declaration from the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage does not need to be sworn in as an MP for the question to be marked as **Yes** -- the resolution is based solely on his election status.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and 538 will project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (2) Nigel Farage will be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves to "Yes" only if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. Additionally, Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as "No" if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as "Yes" -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve to "Yes." If either condition is not met, this question resolves to "No."

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or 538 will not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (2) Nigel Farage will not be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
This question resolves to "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. Additionally, Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is not elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as "Yes" if this occurs, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as "No" -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

At least one condition must be satisfied for this question to resolve to "Yes." If both conditions are met, this question resolves to "No."

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 based on 538's national polling average, and on July 19, 2024, 538 will indicate Biden as the frontrunner; (2) Nigel Farage will secure a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" only if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 3 and does not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024. This is based on the data for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump. Furthermore, Joe Biden must have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is determined by the blue and red trend lines for that date and will be finalized when the July 20 data points are released. If there are no July 19 data points available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will be based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

2. In the UK general election taking place on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage must be elected as a member of parliament (MP) for any constituency in the UK. The inquiry will be resolved as "No" if this does not happen, unless the general election is cancelled or delayed past July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be voided. Resolution should reference credible news reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other significant UK news outlets; or the official announcement from the returning officer for any constituency where Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage does not need to be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as "Yes" -- the resolution is based solely on his election status.

Both criteria must be met for this question to resolve to "Yes." If either criterion is not satisfied, the question will resolve to "No."

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before 7/13?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will withdraw before July 13?
para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or cannot proceed with his presidential campaign prior to midnight on July 13 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will end with a no.

question.title: Given that Biden drops out before 7/13, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before the specified time for this condition to be true.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Given that Biden drops out before 7/13, will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before the specified time for this condition to be true.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as No. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws prior to 7/13, will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time. In that case, will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Criteria for the condition to be met: Biden must withdraw or be unable to continue his presidential campaign before the specified deadline for this condition to hold true.
Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to Yes if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two parties have an equal number of seats, both will resolve as Yes. This determination is based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before 7/13 and GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, and (2) GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or be tied for the most seats. Then, will Joe Biden still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024? Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president at that time, and NO otherwise. If both conditions are not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden not dropping out before 7/13 and GUE/NGL not holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) Biden will not drop out and will continue his run as president after midnight July 13 Central Time, and (2) GUE/NGL will not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will not be tied for the most seats. Then, will Joe Biden not be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024? Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is not officially president at that time, and NO otherwise. If both conditions are not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden withdraws prior to July 13 and GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden remain in office by the end of July?
para_P.body: Consider the following scenario: (1) Biden will either withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time, and (2) GUE/NGL will secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or be tied for the highest. In that case, will Joe Biden still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024? The resolution criteria are as follows: Resolves to YES if Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president at that time, and NO otherwise. If either condition is not satisfied, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden drop out before July 13, GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: (1) Joe Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. (2) GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or be tied for the most seats. (3) Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. All three conditions must be met for this to resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not drop out before July 13, GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and Joe Biden not still be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: (1) Joe Biden will not drop out and will be able to continue his run as president after midnight July 13 Central Time. (2) GUE/NGL will not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and will not be tied for the most seats. (3) Joe Biden will not still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. At least one of these conditions must be met for this to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will withdraw from the presidential race before July 13, GUE/NGL will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and Joe Biden will remain the president by the end of July?
para_P.body: (1) Joe Biden will either withdraw or be otherwise unable to pursue his presidential campaign prior to midnight on July 13 Central Time. (2) GUE/NGL will have the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or will be tied for the highest number of seats. (3) Joe Biden will still hold the title of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. All three criteria must be fulfilled for this to be considered a YES.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a live, on-camera discussion lasting over 45 minutes, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest relevant interview occurred when Biden was featured on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will resolve to YES if Biden takes part in another such live interview that lasts a minimum of 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market does not consider press events, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town hall meetings, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage showing Biden being interviewed in-person for those appearances to be counted. A 50-minute video might only include 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not meet the criteria.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Conditional on Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Resolution criterion for the condition: If Biden appears in such an interview, this resolves YES; if not, it resolves NO.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: On June 1, 2024, the ISW map must show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control for this to resolve YES. If these coordinates are not under Russian control, it resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024, will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Given that Biden engages in a 45+ minute face-to-face interview on camera prior to the end of July 2024, will Russia possess control over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera that lasts no less than 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings. It may involve guest appearances on a podcast or late-night television show, or an interview that is compiled into a program like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview.

Resolution criterion for the condition: If Biden is present in such an interview, this will be resolved as YES; if he is not, it will resolve as NO.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: For this to resolve YES, on June 1, 2024, the ISW map must indicate that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under Russian authority. If these coordinates are not under Russian authority, it will resolve NO.

If the condition is unmet, the question will resolve N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024 and Russia controlling Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will he announce not accepting the Democratic nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024 and Russia not controlling Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will he announce accepting the Democratic nomination?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true:

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as not under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024 and that Russia has control over Chasiv Yar as of June 1, 2024, will he declare that he will not accept the Democratic nomination?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following conditions: 
1. Joe Biden must engage in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion lasting at least 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This interview should resemble Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. The requirements exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night television shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map must indicate the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as being under any classifications that signify Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other classifications indicating Russian dominance.

Under these stipulations, will Joe Biden publicly announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party? This will be considered a YES if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement declaring that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (2) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

3. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If all three conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If any condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (2) Russia does not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or (3) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must not be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

3. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If at least one of these conditions is met, the question resolves as YES. If all conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following events will take place: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, (2) Russia holds control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if all the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. Joe Biden engages in a personal interview or discussion on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes before July 31, 2024. This interview should resemble Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., are excluded, but appearances on podcasts or late-night television shows, or interviews incorporated into programs like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person, are included.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as falling under any classifications that denote Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories that signify Russian dominance.

3. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The declaration must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If all three criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as affirmative. If any condition fails to be met, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators apply pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly requested Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news outlets that they have given up on Biden's chances for victory in November.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are various drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the matter.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly suggest he does so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could happen through a group meeting with Biden, where they collectively request him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be enough for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.
