Behind the scenes, activities are even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one aimed at urging Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with these discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to consider withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could involve a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. If five individuals separately express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, that will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats asking Biden to step aside will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any uncertain situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves to YES if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information suggests that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory, resulting in the deaths of at least five people. It resolves to NO otherwise.

If the condition is unmet, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: Given both (a) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(b) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Then, given the above, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Given both (a) a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators do not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could mean that there are either no such individuals or that there are individuals but they do not form a group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this part resolves YES.

(b) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that no attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Then, given the above, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: If a minimum of five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and if Israel executes a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024, will at least 10 Democratic Senators demand Biden's withdrawal before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions are met: (a) A coalition consisting of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through a signed letter or alternative methods, such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively request his withdrawal. All five members must be part of the same collective communication. Merely five individuals independently expressing to the media that they believe Biden should step down is inadequate. Any reports involving unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not fulfill this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the specified deadline. Unclear situations will be interpreted as NO. If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this segment will resolve to NO.

(b) After the publication date of this inquiry and before May 1, 2024, credible information suggests that an attack linked to Israel occurring within the territory of Iran has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

Given these premises, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden's withdrawal prior to July 20? The resolution source is: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any moment before midnight on July 20 Central Time, it becomes evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators have made this call, the market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(b) This question resolves YES if, at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, as reported by the New York Times interactive 2024 US elections page.

(c) This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this part resolves YES.

(b) This question resolves YES if, at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, as reported by the New York Times interactive 2024 US elections page, does not occur.

(c) This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals does not occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will take place: (a) A coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th, 2024, (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators will demand Biden's withdrawal prior to July 20, 2024, and (c) Israel will execute a lethal strike within Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will resolve to YES if a coalition consisting of at least five identifiable Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his campaign for re-election in 2024, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could take the form of signing a letter or a group meeting with Biden in person, collectively urging him to step down. All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Merely five individuals expressing their separate opinions to the media that they believe Biden should withdraw is inadequate. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden to ask him to resign will not fulfill this condition unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. Ambiguous situations will be resolved in favor of NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this part will resolve to NO.

(b) This inquiry will resolve to YES if, at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, there is evidence of 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to withdraw, as documented by the New York Times interactive 2024 US elections webpage.

(c) This inquiry will resolve to YES if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports suggest that an attack attributed to Israel occurring within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Will Russia dominate Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, at the time of review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Authority

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications created by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area



The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the location is not categorized under any of the classifications indicating Russian authority, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Actions

- Any additional classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area.

question.title: Conditional on Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This is determined by the ISW map showing the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as 'Assessed Russian Control' or similar. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the seasonally adjusted Core CPI data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the exact value.

not_P.title: Conditional on Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This is determined by the ISW map showing the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as 'Assessed Russian Control' or similar. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the seasonally adjusted Core CPI data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the exact value.

para_P.title: Assuming Russia maintains authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the US Core CPI for July rise by over 0.1% compared to June?
para_P.body: Let’s consider this scenario: Russia retains control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This determination is made using the ISW map that indicates coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories that signify Russian dominance, such as 'Assessed Russian Control' or similar classifications. In this case, will the Core CPI for the US in July 2024 see an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to June 2024? The conclusion will rely on the seasonally adjusted Core CPI figures from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, utilizing the precise value.

question.title: Given Russia controls Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, and (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

Given these conditions, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Given Russia does not control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or US Core CPI does not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, or (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

Given these conditions, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If Russia has authority over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, and the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July 2024, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: (a) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are controlled by Russia, and (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

Under these circumstances, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially assert that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(b) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(b) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will take place: (a) By June 1, 2024, Russia controls Chasiv Yar, (b) In July 2024, the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rises by more than 0.1%, and (c) Before August 2024, Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of these classifications:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that signify Russian control of the area

The inquiry will be answered with **No** if the location is not categorized as under Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control of the area

(b) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the precise (not rounded) figure.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Context: A GOP lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution as long as over 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive resolution if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it), and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, will Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024? This resolves based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

not_P.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT not being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will Jonas Vingegaard not win the Tour de France 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it), and at most 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, will Jonas Vingegaard not win the Tour de France 2024? This resolves based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

para_P.title: Assuming that OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, is it true that Jonas Vingegaard will claim victory in the Tour de France 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union as of June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" implies that the majority of individuals in the EU can use it without needing a VPN (potentially requiring payment), and more than 50% of the population has access. "ChatGPT" denotes the standard web platform for engaging with GPT models, maintaining a positive resolution even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains largely the same.

In that case, will Jonas Vingegaard be the one to win the Tour de France 2024? This will be determined by the cyclist who is officially acknowledged as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results published on the Tour de France website or other reputable sources.

question.title: Given that both OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring payment), with availability to at least >50% of the population, and (b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 based on official results published on credible sources. Given these conditions, will the S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats, or ties for the most seats, after the elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Resolves as **No** otherwise.

not_P.title: Given that both OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, or Jonas Vingegaard does not win the Tour de France 2024, will S&D not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Either (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring payment), with availability to at least ≤50% of the population, or (b) Jonas Vingegaard is not officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 based on official results published on credible sources. Given these conditions, will the S&D not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D does not hold the most seats after the elections, or does not tie for the most seats, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Resolves as **No** otherwise.

para_P.title: If OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and Jonas Vingegaard is declared the winner of the Tour de France 2024, will the S&D party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is broadly available in the European Union starting June 30, 2024, which means that the majority of individuals in the EU can access it without needing a VPN (though it may involve a fee), with access granted to at least over 50% of the populace, and (b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially acknowledged as the victor of the Tour de France 2024 according to results published by reputable sources. Under these circumstances, will the S&D party have the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This will be considered **Yes** if the S&D party has the most seats or ties for the most seats after the elections, as reported by official European Parliament announcements or trustworthy media outlets. It will be deemed **No** in all other cases.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (b) Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, and (c) S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(c) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The question resolves as **NO** if any of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (b) Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, and (c) S&D does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if not all of the following conditions are met:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Not generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If available in all EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least ≤50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Jonas Vingegaard is not officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(c) The S&D does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The question resolves as **YES** if any of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Will the following events happen: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, (b) Jonas Vingegaard is declared the champion of the Tour de France 2024, and (c) S&D secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if all the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without utilizing a VPN (possibly needing to pay for it). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the populace can utilize it. "ChatGPT" here pertains to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or site has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially acknowledged as the victor of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(c) The S&D has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political factions. If two parties are tied in seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves based on [official announcements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media coverage.

The question resolves as **NO** if any of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If a single ballot suffices, then this question will resolve to **No**.

question.title: If Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between a brokered convention and Democratic Senators' support for Biden.

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: If more than one ballot is required, this condition is **Yes**; if only one ballot is required, this condition is **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this question resolves to **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves to **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: If Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between a brokered convention and Democratic Senators' support for Biden.

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: If more than one ballot is required, this condition is **Yes**; if only one ballot is required, this condition is **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not calling for Biden to drop out, this question resolves to **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves to **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Should there be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines how a brokered convention might influence the backing of Democratic Senators for Biden.

Assuming the following holds true: The Democratic Party must undergo multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Criteria for determining the condition: If more than one ballot is necessary, this condition is **Yes**; if only a single ballot suffices, this condition is **No**.

Criteria for determining the outcome: If at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step aside, this question resolves to **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves to **No**.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both a brokered Democratic convention and 10+ Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, and (b) at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- (a) Occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting to nominate its candidate.
- (b) Occurs if 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 as shown by the New York Times interactive.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on both a brokered Democratic convention and 10+ Democratic Senators not calling for Biden to drop out, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, and (b) at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators not calling for Biden to drop out.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- (a) Occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting to nominate its candidate.
- (b) Occurs if 10 or more Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out before July 20 as shown by the New York Times interactive.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Given a brokered Democratic convention and 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to withdraw, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: (a) The Democratic Party must go through multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 presidential election, and (b) prior to midnight on July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are advocating for Biden to step aside.

Under these circumstances, will Vivek Ramaswamy be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Criteria for the condition: 
- (a) This is fulfilled if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one voting round to nominate its candidate.
- (b) This is fulfilled if 10 or more Democratic Senators request Biden to withdraw before July 20, as shown by the New York Times interactive.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to YES if Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves to NO otherwise. If the condition is not satisfied, resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (c) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This occurs if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it does not occur.

(c) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024, (b) fewer than 10 Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out before July 20, or (c) Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This occurs if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it does not occur.

(c) Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will happen: (a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024, (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, and (c) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024: This takes place if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this does not happen.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: This occurs if, at any time before midnight Central Time on July 20, the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step aside. Otherwise, it does not occur.

(c) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other options may be introduced later.

For this question, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before 7/13?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to 7/13?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be unable to proceed with his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his presidential run before midnight July 13 Central Time for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

not_P.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his presidential run before midnight July 13 Central Time for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

para_P.title: If Biden exits the race before July 13, will Trump be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden exits the presidential race or is otherwise unable to proceed before midnight July 13 Central Time. In that case, will Donald Trump be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Criteria for the condition (P) to be valid: Biden must exit or be unable to continue his presidential campaign before midnight July 13 Central Time for this condition to hold true.

Criteria for the outcome (Q): This will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. It will be considered "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024. The question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals after the specified date.

question.title: Given both Biden drops out before July 13, 2024, and Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, Central Time, and (b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. 

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:

- For (a) Biden dropping out: This resolves to YES if Biden drops out before this time, otherwise NO.
- For (b) Trump being blocked: This resolves to YES if, on July 15, 2024, Trump is confirmed to be removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves to NO if these conditions are not met as of that date.
- For the ID political group: This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. It resolves as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Given both Biden does not drop out before July 13, 2024, or Trump is not blocked from the primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden does not drop out or is able to continue his run as president after midnight July 13, Central Time, or (b) Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. 

Then, will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:

- For (a) Biden not dropping out: This resolves to YES if Biden does not drop out before this time, otherwise NO.
- For (b) Trump not being blocked: This resolves to YES if, on July 15, 2024, Trump is confirmed to not be removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves to NO if these conditions are met as of that date.
- For the ID political group: This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. It resolves as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Biden resigns prior to July 13, 2024, and Trump is disqualified from the primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: (a) Biden resigns or is otherwise unable to pursue his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13, Central Time, and (b) Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. 

Then, will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:

- For (a) Biden resigning: This resolves to YES if Biden resigns before the specified time, otherwise NO.
- For (b) Trump being disqualified: This resolves to YES if, on July 15, 2024, it is confirmed that Trump is officially disqualified or barred through state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media reports. It resolves to NO if these conditions are not satisfied by that date.
- For the ID political faction: This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political faction holds the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official announcements from the European Parliament or credible media reports. It resolves as **No** for all other political factions. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two factions, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before 7/13, (b) Trump is removed or blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by 7/15/2024, and (c) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, Central Time. This will resolve to YES if Biden drops out before this time, otherwise NO.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This will resolve to YES if, on July 15, 2024, Trump is confirmed to be removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve to NO if these conditions are not met as of that date. Note: The question pertains strictly to Trump's status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

(c) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as YES if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as NO for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, this will resolve as YES.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before 7/13, (b) Trump is not removed or blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by 7/15/2024, or (c) the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president after midnight July 13, Central Time. This will resolve to YES if Biden does not drop out after this time, otherwise NO.

(b) Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This will resolve to YES if, on July 15, 2024, Trump is confirmed to not be removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve to NO if these conditions are met as of that date. Note: The question pertains strictly to Trump's status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

(c) The ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as YES if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as NO for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, this will resolve as YES.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Biden exits the race prior to 7/13, (b) Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by 7/15/2024, and (c) the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden must withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13, Central Time. This will be considered a YES if Biden withdraws before this deadline, otherwise it will be a NO.

(b) Donald Trump must be formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria: This market resolves YES if fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and (2) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Additionally, at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early if, before the end of Sunday, July 21st, a public letter is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also meet this condition. This is based on a draft letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and reported by Politico.

(2) Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by the outcome of the 2024 US election day.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or (2) Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(1) Democrats will not have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Additionally, at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early if, before the end of Sunday, July 21st, a public letter is not signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also do not meet this condition. This is based on a draft letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and reported by Politico.

(2) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by the outcome of the 2024 US election day.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (1) The Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024 where at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will publicly oppose the early virtual nomination of Biden, and (2) Francis Suarez will be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) A brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024 will occur if the party needs more than one voting round during its roll call ballot to officially nominate a candidate for the presidential election. Furthermore, at least 20 Democratic House or Senate members must sign a public letter against the early virtual nomination of Biden before the end of Sunday, July 21st, which can be fulfilled by either a single letter or multiple letters totaling 20 signatures. This is based on a draft letter that Rep. Jared Huffman circulated and was reported by Politico.

(2) Francis Suarez will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election if he is chosen by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, not based on the results of the election on 2024 election day.

question.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Given that the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), meaning they must not be eliminated from contention and must win the finals. (2) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means the US team must have the highest number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals, as per the official medal table ranking system. 

Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

This means the US team does not have the highest number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals, as per the official medal table ranking system. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) does not win gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means that no NOC must have won gold in two or more of these events. The question resolves as **No** if all of these conditions occur. Note: The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (1) The New York Knicks claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals, (2) The United States leads the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Games, and (3) The same country secures gold in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if all of these conditions are satisfied: (1) The New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), which means they must not be eliminated from the playoffs and must win the championship. (2) The United States Olympic Team is the sole top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, indicating that they must have the most Gold Medals, with any ties resolved by counting Silver and then Bronze Medals, according to the official medal ranking system. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means at least one NOC must have won gold in two or more of these competitions. The question will be answered with **No** if any of these criteria are not met. Note: The question will remain uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be inaugurated as President by this Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolution of this market will be official announcements from the US government, with a consensus of reliable news reports also taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.
