Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This will be evaluated based on the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

not_P.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will Trump's lead over Biden be not between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will not be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This will be evaluated based on the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Should Kamala Harris assume the presidency by Friday, will Donald Trump's margin over Biden fall between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Imagine this scenario: Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This determination will rely on official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources.

Under these conditions, can we conclude that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This will be assessed using the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. 

Criterion for (a): Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Criterion for (b): Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is to be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6? 

Resolution criteria for the conflict: Resolves Yes if, before June 6, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

not_P.title: Given Kamala Harris does not become President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, or Trump's lead over Biden is not between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will there be no armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris does not become President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 and not less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. 

Criterion for (a): Kamala Harris will not be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Criterion for (b): Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is to be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will there be no armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6? 

Resolution criteria for the conflict: Resolves Yes if, before June 6, 2024, credible reports confirm no deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is inaugurated as President or serves as Acting President before July 26, 2024, and on July 15, 2024, Trump is ahead of Biden by a margin of 2 to 3 points, will there be fatalities due to military conflict between China and Taiwan in 2024 prior to June 6?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any moment before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is more than 2 points but less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. 

Criterion for (a): Kamala Harris must be officially acknowledged as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. The primary source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources.

Criterion for (b): Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average will be verified on the chart for July 15, 2024, as referenced by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

Then, will there be military conflict deaths between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6? 

Resolution criteria for the conflict: Resolves Yes if, before June 6, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more fatalities among the armed forces of either China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between the two nations.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, and (b) Before June 6, 2024, there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris does not become President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, or Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, nor (b) Before June 6, 2024, there are no armed forces conflict deaths between China and Taiwan?
not_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris will not be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will not be greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **No** if, before June 6th, 2024, there are no credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Kamala Harris is named President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, and (b) Prior to June 6, 2024, there is a military conflict resulting in fatalities between China and Taiwan?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris will be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as recorded by 538, will exceed 2 and be at most 3 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

(b) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, before June 6, 2024, credible news sources confirm one or more fatalities among the military forces of China or Taiwan as a consequence of armed conflict between the two nations.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 surpasses a 0.1% increase relative to June 2024.

The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

question.title: Conditional on the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead and a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

not_P.title: Conditional on the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead and a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Assuming the US Core CPI rises by more than 0.1% in July, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Let us consider that the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by over 0.1% in comparison to June 2024, according to the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Under this condition, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will have a lead over Joe Biden of more than 2 and not exceeding 3, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, on July 15, 2024? This will be verified by the data shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure signifies a Trump lead and a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

question.title: Given both (a) US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

not_P.title: Given both (a) US Core CPI does not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024 and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is not between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel not expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is not greater than 2 and not less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, will Israel not expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: If both (a) the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July 2024 and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel extend its ground offensive to Rafah prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following two statements hold true:

(a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% when compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

Then, will Israel escalate its ground offensive to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) indicates Israeli military activities on its map at any of six designated sites surrounding Rafah (the specific sites are highlighted in the embedded map below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(c) Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Israel not expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(c) Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will happen: (a) The US Core CPI rises by more than 0.1% month-over-month in July 2024, (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (c) Israel will extend its ground invasion to the city of Rafah prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and at most 3. A positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number signifies Biden is ahead.

(c) Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) indicates Israeli military activity on its map at any of six specified locations around Rafah before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump testifies at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, as reported by credible sources. Then, will Israel carry out an attack attributed to them within Iran's borders that leads to the death of at least five individuals, as reported by credible sources, before May 1, 2024?

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump testifies at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, as reported by credible sources. Then, will Israel not carry out an attack attributed to them within Iran's borders that leads to the death of at least five individuals, as reported by credible sources, before May 1, 2024?

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Donald Trump gives evidence at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, according to reliable sources. Will Israel conduct an operation within Iran that results in the deaths of no fewer than five people, as reported by trustworthy sources, before May 1, 2024?

question.title: Given both Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and (b) credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Given both Donald Trump does not testify at the hush money trial and Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and (b) credible reports indicate that no attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial and Israel conducts a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and (b) trustworthy reports suggest that an attack linked to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people between the time this question is posed and May 1, 2024. Then, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate entity) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not included.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, before May 1, 2024; (b) Credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals, between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024; and (c) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (a) No credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, before May 1, 2024; (b) No credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals, between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024; and (c) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Will each of the following take place prior to their respective cut-off dates: (a) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial (b) Israel executes a lethal strike within Iran (c) Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment?
para_P.body: This inquiry is resolved as **Yes** only if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) Reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or virtually, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, before May 1, 2024; (b) Trustworthy reports suggest that an assault attributed to Israel, occurring within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people, between the date of this question's release and May 1, 2024; and (c) The Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this query. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is a terrorist incident expected to take place in metropolitan France during the Summer Olympics of 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if a terrorist incident occurs in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) that results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, it will be marked as No if this does not transpire.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any authority of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the EU not announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that the EU has not announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Given that a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the EU implement new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario is accurate: A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, resulting in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between and including the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An incident is classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official agency of the French State, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

Then, will the European Union implement new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This will be considered a Yes if reliable sources indicate that the EU has enacted new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024. If the condition is not satisfied, the question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and EU tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, which injures or kills at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between July 26 and August 11, 2024, and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by an official French source. (2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus having a brokered convention? The question resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is required, and **No** if only one ballot is needed.

not_P.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and EU tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, which injures or kills at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between July 26 and August 11, 2024, and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by an official French source. (2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Then, will the Democratic Party require only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus not having a brokered convention? The question resolves as **Yes** if only one ballot is needed, and **No** if more than one round of voting is required.

para_P.title: In light of a terrorist incident occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and the implementation of EU tariffs on electric vehicles from China, will the Democratic Party experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (1) A terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, resulting in injury or death to at least one individual (not including the terrorist(s)) between July 26 and August 11, 2024, and is officially labeled as a 'terrorist attack' by a French authority. (2) Prior to July 5, 2024, the European Union imposes new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles, as confirmed by reliable sources.

Under these circumstances, will the Democratic Party need to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 presidential election in the United States, thereby leading to a brokered convention? The answer will be **Yes** if more than one voting round is necessary, and **No** if only a single ballot suffices.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) The European Union does not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, or (3) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) A terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) The European Union does not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(3) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) The European Union introduces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (3) The Democratic Party holds a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The outcome will be Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between, and including, the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The outcome will be No if the aforementioned does not occur. An event will be deemed a 'terrorist incident' if classified as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

(2) The European Union introduces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared new tariffs or duties that would apply to the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(3) The Democratic Party holds a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question resolves as No.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, no [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Crimean Bridge will experience an attack prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and before the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, bombs, or projectiles that could threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, is the following true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If this occurs, the market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

not_P.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Biden not drop out before July 13, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, is the following true: Biden does not drop out and is otherwise able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If this occurs, the market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: If the Crimean Bridge experiences an attack prior to July 1, 2024, will Biden withdraw from the presidential race before July 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statement holds: The Crimean Bridge undergoes an assault before July 1, 2024. This will be marked as **Yes** if, between May 2, 2024, and the specified date, reliable sources confirm that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or other projectiles that could threaten the bridge's structural integrity.

Therefore, is it accurate to say: Biden will either withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13, Central Time? If this happens, the market will indicate yes. If not, it will indicate NO.

question.title: If both the Crimean Bridge is attacked and Biden drops out before July 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following are true:
1. After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.
2. Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time.
3. Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

If any of the first two conditions are not met, the resolution is N/A. If the first two conditions are met, but Asa Hutchinson is not selected as the nominee, the resolution is **No**.

not_P.title: If either the Crimean Bridge is not attacked or Biden does not drop out before July 2024, will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if none of the following are true:
1. After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.
2. Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time.
3. Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

If either of the first two conditions are met, the resolution is N/A. If the first two conditions are met, but Asa Hutchinson is selected as the nominee, the resolution is **Yes**.

para_P.title: Should both the Crimean Bridge come under attack and Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 2024, will Asa Hutchinson become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are satisfied:
1. Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the Crimean Bridge has experienced an assault involving gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly endanger the bridge's structural integrity.
2. Biden must withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13, 2024, Central Time.
3. Asa Hutchinson receives the nomination from the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

If either of the first two conditions is not fulfilled, the outcome is N/A. If the first two conditions are fulfilled, but Asa Hutchinson is not nominated, the resolution is **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack, (b) Biden drop out before July 13, 2024, and (c) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (2) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. (3) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack, (b) Biden not drop out before July 13, 2024, or (c) Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources do not report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (2) Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. (3) Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events will take place: (a) Between May 2, 2024, and June 30, 2024, the Crimean Bridge experiences an attack, (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 13, 2024, and (c) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if all of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and June 30, 2024, reliable sources confirm that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by weaponry, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly endanger the structure of the bridge. (2) Biden must withdraw or be otherwise incapable of continuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13, 2024, Central Time. (3) Asa Hutchinson must be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any of these criteria are not satisfied, this inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Iceland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Otherwise, it will result in a **No**.

question.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Iceland secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland follow suit?
para_P.body:
Assuming this is accurate: Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that it has advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. 

In that case, will Poland also compete in a Semi-final and be officially confirmed by the EBU as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024? If Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given both Iceland and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Iceland and Poland participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both Iceland and Poland qualify for the Grand Final. If either does not qualify, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Given both Iceland and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Iceland and Poland participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if either Iceland or Poland does not qualify for the Grand Final. If both qualify, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If both Iceland and Poland secure a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also make it through?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both Iceland and Poland take part in a Semi-final and are declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also make it through to the Grand Final? 

Criteria for determining the condition: The question is answered with **Yes** if both Iceland and Poland reach the Grand Final. If either fails to qualify, the condition is not satisfied.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The answer is **Yes** if Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other result, it answers **No**.

question.title: Will Iceland, Poland, and Georgia all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Iceland, Poland, or Georgia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Iceland, Poland, or Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following occur: (a) Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (c) Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If all of Iceland, Poland, and Georgia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Iceland, Poland, and Georgia all make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Iceland, Poland, or Georgia fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

"Widely accessible" in this context indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the primary web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems utilizing Large Language Models).

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that Russia will have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine," "Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Assessed Russian Control," "Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine," or any other categories indicating Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any categories indicating Russian control, including "Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives," "Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare," or any other categories indicating Ukrainian control or lack of Russian control.

not_P.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Russia not control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that Russia will not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating no Russian control, such as "Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives," "Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare," or any other categories indicating Ukrainian control or lack of Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any categories indicating Russian control, including "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine," "Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Assessed Russian Control," "Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine," or any other categories indicating Russian control.

para_P.title: With ChatGPT expected to be widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, possibly with a fee, and at least more than half of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

Then, is it the case that Russia will have authority over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024? This will be confirmed as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E in categories that denote Russian authority, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine," "Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Assessed Russian Control," "Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine," or any other categories that signify Russian authority. It will be confirmed as **No** if the location is not classified in any categories that indicate Russian authority, including "Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives," "Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare," or any other categories that suggest Ukrainian authority or absence of Russian authority.

question.title: Conditional on both ChatGPT being available in the EU and Russia controlling Chasiv Yar, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and that it is available to at least >50% of the population. This includes possible restrictions to certain countries or demographics, but the service remains substantially the same as OpenAI's general web interface for interacting with GPT models.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Control or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Conditional on both ChatGPT not being available in the EU or Russia not controlling Chasiv Yar, will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and that it is not available to at least >50% of the population. This includes possible restrictions to certain countries or demographics, but the service remains substantially the same as OpenAI's general web interface for interacting with GPT models.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Control or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine.

Then, will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If both ChatGPT is accessible in the EU and Russia maintains control over Chasiv Yar, will the ID political party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: (a) ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, meaning that most individuals in the EU can utilize it without needing a VPN, possibly with a fee, and that it is available to more than 50% of the populace. This may include specific limitations for certain nations or groups, yet the service remains largely consistent with OpenAI's standard web interface for engaging with GPT models.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any category denoting Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Control or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine.

Then, will the ID political party achieve the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This will be answered with **Yes** if the ID political party possesses the most seats according to official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable news sources. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two parties, both will be considered as **Yes**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (c) the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) ChatGPT not be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, (b) Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or (c) the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Not generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) ChatGPT will be accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, (b) Chasiv Yar will be under Russian control by June 1, 2024, and (c) the ID political group will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) The answer will be **YES** if ChatGPT is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. "Accessible to the general public" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not available in specific EU countries (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to certain demographics (like minors), the resolution will still be positive, provided more than 50% of the population can access it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution will still be positive if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map displays the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of these classifications: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of that area.
