It will be answered with **No** if the location is not categorized under any of the classifications indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories designated by ISW that denote Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control.

(c) The question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** if any other political groups have the highest number. In the event of a tie in the number of seats between two groups, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question's resolution is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft would request that Biden conclude his campaign, according to five sources acquainted with the situation.

This market will conclude with a YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter like the one mentioned above, or it could manifest as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently inform reporters of their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Reports regarding any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and requesting him to step down will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's conclusion. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Politico reports:

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. para_P.title: If at least five specific Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple's on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, and at least one draft is reportedly urging Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly advise him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest through a signed letter as mentioned above, or through another means such as a group meeting with Biden and jointly requesting that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of a unified message. If five individuals independently express to the media that they believe Biden should step aside, this will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will favor a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

Criteria for resolution: This question will resolve to YES if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, as per Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given that both (1) at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, and (2) Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Given that both (1) fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators do not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, and (2) Nvidia's market cap is not larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

(1) Fewer than 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or do not urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter or in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person. Not all five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient if they do not do it together. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats not writing to Biden and not asking him to step aside will satisfy this criterion unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's, as determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. If both conditions are met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If it is the case that (1) at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and (2) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple on July 17, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenarios are accurate:

(1) A minimum of five specific Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 presidential campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be achieved through a signed letter or another method, such as a group discussion with Biden in person. All five individuals must participate in the same collective communication. Merely having five individuals separately express their opinions to reporters that they believe Biden should step down is insufficient. Reports regarding any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not fulfill this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are subsequently disclosed before the deadline.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market valuation is greater than that of Apple, as verified by checking Companies Market Cap around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that date.

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be reported as higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will be determined based on data from the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023. If either of the conditions is not satisfied, the question will be resolved as N/A.

question.body:
(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization must be larger than Apple's. This is determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.

(3) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to its value on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, (2) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, and (3) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) Not at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This means that either fewer than 5 named individuals will pressure Biden, or they will not work together in a qualifying manner. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this part resolves YES.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization will not be larger than Apple's. This is determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.

(3) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will not be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to its value on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will take place: (1) A minimum of 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, 2024, (2) Nvidia's market value will surpass that of Apple's on July 17, 2024, and (3) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 5 identified members of the Democratic Party from either the US House of Representatives or the Senate must collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be through a signed letter or another method such as a group discussion with Biden face-to-face. All five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. Merely having five individuals separately express their opinions to the media that Biden should withdraw is not adequate. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to retire will not fulfill this requirement unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the cut-off date. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this aspect will conclude with a NO.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization must exceed that of Apple. This will be determined by examining the Companies Market Cap around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that specific day.

(3) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be greater on July 20, 2024, compared to its value from July 20, 2023. This will be confirmed based on data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024, must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible sources reporting that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Will the EU declare new tariffs or duties on imports of electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties that would pertain to the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Donald Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The EU must announce new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

not_P.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Donald Trump not be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The EU must announce new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must not be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: If the EU declares new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Donald Trump face disqualification from a primary ballot due to the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Prior to July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared that new tariffs or duties will be enforced on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. In that case, will Donald Trump be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: The EU must declare new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by trustworthy sources.

Criteria for resolving the outcome: Donald Trump must be officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. The question will be considered "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

question.title: If the EU imposes new tariffs on Chinese EVs and Trump is blocked from a ballot, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

Then, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria:
- The EU tariffs must be announced before July 5, 2024, with credible sources confirming.
- Trump must be removed or blocked from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office by July 15, 2024, with official confirmation.
- Renew must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, with ties resolved by official statements or credible media reports.

not_P.title: If the EU does not impose new tariffs on Chinese EVs or Trump is not blocked from a ballot, will Renew not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

Then, will Renew not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria:
- The EU tariffs must not be announced before July 5, 2024, with credible sources confirming.
- Trump must not be removed or blocked from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office by July 15, 2024, with official confirmation.
- Renew must not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, with ties resolved by official statements or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Should the EU introduce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles and if Trump is disqualified from a primary ballot, will Renew secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Consider the following conditions: 

1. Prior to July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the implementation of new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

In that case, will Renew secure the highest number of seats in the aftermath of the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Criteria for resolution:
- The announcement of EU tariffs must occur before July 5, 2024, with reliable sources confirming this information.
- Trump must be officially disqualified or barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position by July 15, 2024, with formal confirmation.
- Renew must achieve the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, with any ties resolved by official declarations or credible news reports.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The European Union announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, (2) Donald Trump be blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (3) Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

3. Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This condition will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) The European Union announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, (2) Donald Trump be blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (3) Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. After July 5, 2024, no credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

3. Renew does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This condition will resolve as **Yes** if Renew does not hold the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following events will take place: (1) The European Union will declare new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, (2) Donald Trump will be prevented from appearing on any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (3) Renew will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if all of these criteria are fulfilled:

1. Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources confirm that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties applicable to the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or barring must be validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial declarations will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will resolve as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or removed from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

3. Renew must have the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This condition will resolve as **Yes** if Renew has the most seats and as **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two parties for seats, this resolution will be based on official announcements from the European Parliament or credible media sources.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will ECR not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will ECR secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if ECR secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for any other results. In the event that two parties have an equal number of seats, both will be considered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Given ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Renew also hold the most seats?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew also holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning Renew and ECR are tied for the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. Resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Given ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Renew not hold the most seats?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning Renew and ECR are not tied for the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. Resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If ECR secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Renew also achieve the highest number of seats?
para_P.body: Assuming the following is accurate: ECR secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will be answered with **Yes** if Renew also secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, indicating that Renew and ECR are tied for the highest number of seats, and will be answered with **No** for all other results. The resolution will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Given both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats as well?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. This includes scenarios where ECR and Renew are tied for the most seats. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it also true that GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Given both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats as well?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. This includes scenarios where ECR and Renew are tied for the most seats. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it also true that GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If both ECR and Renew secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will GUE/NGL also secure the highest number of seats?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Both ECR and Renew secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. This includes cases where ECR and Renew are equal in the number of seats. The outcome will be determined by official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

Then, is it also accurate that GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political parties. If two parties are equal in the number of seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The outcome will be determined by official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: (a) ECR and Renew hold the most seats, (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) ECR and Renew hold the most seats, including scenarios where they are tied for the most seats, and (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats, including scenarios where they are tied for the most seats. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: (a) ECR and Renew hold the most seats, (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) ECR and Renew hold the most seats, including scenarios where they are tied for the most seats, and (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats, including scenarios where they are tied for the most seats. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: After the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will it be true that (a) ECR and Renew have the highest number of seats, and (b) GUE/NGL has the highest number of seats?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the following two conditions are satisfied following the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) ECR and Renew possess the highest number of seats, including cases where they are tied for the highest number, and (b) GUE/NGL possesses the highest number of seats, including cases where they are tied for the highest number. The determination will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Mayor Wilson show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body:
Resolves to yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024.If he dials in on zoom, it will resolve to yes, but we need confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself).

 Resolves to no if he isn't there. 

https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

not_P.title: Will Mayor Wilson not show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves to yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is not physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. If he dials in on zoom without confirmation it's him (e.g., camera off, not speaking and identifying himself), it will resolve to yes. 

Resolves to no if he is there.

para_P.title: Is Mayor Wilson expected to attend the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is present at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. If he participates via Zoom, it will also be a yes, provided we can verify his identity (for example, he must have his camera on and speak to confirm who he is).

 It will be a no if he is not in attendance.

https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

question.title: Conditional on Mayor Wilson attending the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. Then, we want to know if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom (with camera on and identification) at the meeting. Resolves NO if he is not present.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on the specified date according to 538's national polling average. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Mayor Wilson attending the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be 3 points or less or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. Then, we want to know if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is 3 points or less or greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom (with camera on and identification) at the meeting. Resolves NO if he is not present.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden is 3 points or less or greater than 4 points on the specified date according to 538's national polling average. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Mayor Wilson is present at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Mayor Kurt Wilson is either physically attending or has confirmed his attendance via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, we seek to determine whether Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is greater than 3 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, as indicated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom (with camera on and identification) at the meeting. Resolves NO if he is not present.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden exceeds 3 and is at most 4 points on the specified date according to 538's national polling average. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both Mayor Wilson attends the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.

Given these conditions, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For condition (a): Resolves YES if Mayor Wilson is confirmed present at the meeting, either physically or via Zoom with confirmation. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For condition (b): Resolves YES if Trump's lead is between 3 and 4 points inclusive on the specified date. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024 using the exact values from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Given both Mayor Wilson does not attend the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29, 2024, or Trump's lead over Biden is not between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Mayor Kurt Wilson is not physically present and not confirmed via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.

Given these conditions, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For condition (a): Resolves YES if Mayor Wilson is not confirmed present at the meeting, either physically or via Zoom with confirmation. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For condition (b): Resolves YES if Trump's lead is not between 3 and 4 points inclusive on the specified date. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024 using the exact values from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Mayor Wilson is present at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29, 2024, and Trump's advantage over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI rise by more than 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) Mayor Kurt Wilson is either in attendance or confirmed via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average.

Under these circumstances, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 show an increase of more than 0.1% when compared to June 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
- For condition (a): Resolves to YES if Mayor Wilson is verified to be present at the meeting, either in person or via confirmed Zoom attendance. Resolves to NO otherwise.
- For condition (b): Resolves to YES if Trump's lead is between 3 and 4 points inclusive on the given date. Resolves to NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves to YES if the Core CPI for July 2024 exceeds a 0.1% increase compared to June 2024, using the precise figures from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. Resolves to NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Mayor Wilson will show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Mayor Wilson will show at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. This resolves to yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. If he dials in on Zoom, it will resolve to yes, but we need confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves to no if he isn't there. More details at: https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a reported value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(c) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024. Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Mayor Wilson will show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Mayor Wilson will not show at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. This resolves to yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is not physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. If he dials in on Zoom, it will resolve to yes, unless we have confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves to no if he is there. More details at: https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a reported value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(c) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI will not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024. Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) Mayor Wilson will attend the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, (b) Trump's margin over Biden will exceed 3 but not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will rise by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Mayor Wilson will be present at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. This will be confirmed as yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on that date. If he joins via Zoom, it will still be counted as yes, provided it's confirmed to be him (e.g., camera on, speaking and identifying himself). It resolves to no if he is absent. More details can be found at: https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

(b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, a reported value of Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden would be a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(c) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI will experience an increase of more than 0.1% in July 2024. This will resolve to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for this resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

not_P.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission not publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), no entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Will the full results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, be released by the Venezuelan electoral authority prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any branch of the Venezuelan government has made public the results of the July 28, 2024 election, claiming to reflect 100% of the votes cast, detailed down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Given the Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), credible sources report that any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). 

Additionally, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as Yes. If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given the Venezuelan electoral commission does not publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be less than or equal to 76k or greater than 77k?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), credible sources report that no entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). 

Additionally, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be less than or equal to 76,000 or greater than 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. If either condition is met, the question resolves as Yes. If the first condition is met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the Venezuelan electoral authority releases complete results from the presidential election held on July 28 before August 12, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close at a value exceeding 76k but not surpassing 77k on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if, prior to Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), reliable sources indicate that any branch of the Venezuelan government has disclosed results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to account for 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). 

Moreover, the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be more than 76,000 and at most 77,000, based on Yahoo Finance. If both criteria are satisfied, the response will be Yes. If the first criterion is not fulfilled, the response will be N/A.

question.title: Given both the Venezuelan electoral results are published before August 12, 2024, and BSE SENSEX is between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden remain President through July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) Before August 12, 2024, the Venezuelan government publishes full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election, disaggregated to the level of parish, and (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k. Then, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024? Resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Given both the Venezuelan electoral results are not published before August 12, 2024, or BSE SENSEX is not between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden not remain President through July 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) The Venezuelan government does not publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election, disaggregated to the level of parish, before August 12, 2024, and (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is not greater than 76k or not less than or equal to 77k. Then, will Biden not remain US President through the end of July 2024? Resolves YES if Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If the complete electoral results from Venezuela are made public prior to August 12, 2024, and the BSE SENSEX is recorded between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, will Biden still hold the position of President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following conditions are met: (1) The Venezuelan government releases the comprehensive results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, before August 12, 2024, with details down to the parish level, and (2) On July 21, 2024, the final value of the BSE SENSEX is more than 76,000 but not exceeding 77,000. Then, will Biden continue as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024? The outcome is YES if Biden is still President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it is NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not result in a YES answer.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k, and (3) Biden remains President through end of July 2024?
question.body: (1) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). (2) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance. (3) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) The Venezuelan electoral commission does not publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is not greater than 76k or not less than or equal to 77k, or (3) Biden does not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body: (1) This question resolves as Yes if no credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). (2) This question resolves if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is not greater than 76k or not less than or equal to 77k. (3) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he does remain President through that period.

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that the following will take place: (1) The Venezuelan electoral authority releases complete results of the presidential election held on July 28 before August 12, 2024, (2) The closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceeds 76,000 but does not surpass 77,000, and (3) Biden continues to hold the office of President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: (1) This inquiry will be resolved with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that, prior to Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any branch of the Venezuelan government has disclosed results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to represent 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). (2) The resolution of this question will depend on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance. (3) This will resolve to YES if Biden remains in the presidency until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will resolve to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his VP as Acting President) will not result in a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will the likelihood of Kamala winning improve in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be deemed NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, given Kamala's odds increase next week?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for Kamala's odds: Resolves YES if Harris's Electoral College probability >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Biden's interview: Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc., but can include appearances on podcasts or shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Resolves NO if no qualifying interview is released before the deadline.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, given Kamala's odds increase next week?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for Kamala's odds: Resolves YES if Harris's Electoral College probability >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Biden's interview: Resolves YES if Biden does not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc., but can include appearances on podcasts or shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is not at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Resolves NO if a qualifying interview is released before the deadline.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, considering that Kamala's chances are set to improve next week?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kamala Harris's chances of winning in the Electoral College, as per Nate Silver's model, exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Then, can we confirm that Joe Biden will engage in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion for no less than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Criteria for evaluating Kamala's chances: Resolves YES if Harris's Electoral College probability is greater than 46.6% at the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model, and resolves NO otherwise.

Criteria for determining Biden's interview: Resolves YES if Biden participates in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc., but may include appearances on podcasts or shows like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new interview footage featuring Biden. Resolves NO if no qualifying interview is published before the deadline.

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase and Biden has an in-person interview, will 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris's odds of winning the Electoral College increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, specifically, her probability is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, will at least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning do not increase and Biden does not have an in-person interview, will fewer than 20 Democrats support early Biden nomination?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris's odds of winning the Electoral College do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, specifically, her probability is 46.6% or less on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, will fewer than 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter supporting the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? This resolves YES if a public letter supporting the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Kamala's chances of winning rise and Biden conducts a face-to-face interview, will 20 Democrats stand against an early Biden nomination?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) According to Nate Silver's model, Kamala Harris's chances of securing the Electoral College improve over the upcoming week, specifically, her likelihood exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion lasting at least 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This interview excludes press briefings, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings, but may include podcasts, late-night talk shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person.

Then, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early? This will be deemed YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 (c) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
