(b) Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Resolves NO if no such interview is released before market close at the end of July.

(c) This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 (c) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Resolves NO if such an interview is released before market close at the end of July.

(c) This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is not signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of less than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Kamala's chances of winning rise in the upcoming week as per Nate Silver's analysis (b) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview/discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024 (c) A minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly sign a letter against the proposal to nominate Biden virtually ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be NO if this condition is not met.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This will be YES if Biden participates in a face-to-face interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but may include podcasts, late night shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person. It will be NO if such an interview is not released before the market closes at the end of July.

(c) This market will resolve YES if a public letter against the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice to resolve this market as YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, the market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service going to step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is it true that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold the position of director before the date of October 12, 2024?

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director before October 12, 2024. Then, will Doug Burgum be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected as the nominee. It is not restricted to the current candidates; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is determined solely by the selection of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Doug Burgum not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director before October 12, 2024. Then, will Doug Burgum not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is not selected as the nominee. It is not restricted to the current candidates; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is determined solely by the selection of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Should the Director of the Secret Service step down in the upcoming 90 days, will Doug Burgum become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario holds: Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, either resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason ceases to hold this position prior to October 12, 2024. In that case, will Doug Burgum be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention? This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is indeed chosen as the nominee. The current candidates are not the only consideration; additional candidates may emerge later. The final decision will be made solely based on the choice of delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given both the Secret Service director resigns and Doug Burgum is the GOP nominee, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are met: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024; and (b) Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as **Yes** if more than one ballot is required, and **No** otherwise.

not_P.title: Given both the Secret Service director does not resign and Doug Burgum is not the GOP nominee, will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are not met: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, or for any other reason remains the director of the Secret Service on or after October 12, 2024; and (b) Doug Burgum is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, will the Democratic Party not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as **Yes** if one ballot is required, and **No** otherwise.

para_P.title: If both the Director of the Secret Service steps down and Doug Burgum becomes the GOP candidate, will the Democrats need a contested convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming that these two scenarios occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, either resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason is no longer serving in that role before October 12, 2024; and (b) Doug Burgum is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention.

Then, will the Democratic Party need to hold multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? The answer is **Yes** if more than one ballot is necessary, and **No** if it is not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days (b) Doug Burgum is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (c) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?
(b) Will Doug Burgum be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if he is selected by the delegates, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day.
(c) Will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as Yes if more than one ballot is required.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) The head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days (b) Doug Burgum is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (c) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, or for any other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service after October 12, 2024?
(b) Will Doug Burgum not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if he is not selected by the delegates, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day.
(c) Will the Democratic Party not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as Yes if one ballot is sufficient.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following events will take place: (a) The head of the Secret Service steps down within the next 90 days (b) Doug Burgum becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (c) The Democrats have a contested convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold the position of director before October 12, 2024?
(b) Will Doug Burgum be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be considered Yes if he is chosen by the delegates, irrespective of who is the nominee on election day.
(c) Will the Democratic Party need to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This will be considered Yes if more than one ballot is necessary.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from office prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes a declaration stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning, thereby not finishing his current term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his intention to do so will suffice for the resolution of this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines?

If there are no such reports before that date, then the outcome resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning, will there be no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, none of the following events occurs according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines?

If there are such reports before that date, then the outcome resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and resign, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: Joe Biden states that he will not seek re-election and will resign from his current position, with these announcements made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Is it accurate to say that before June 1, 2024, one of the following actions takes place as per official statements or reliable reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats who is in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats who is in the Philippines?

If there are no such reports by that date, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given both Biden's resignation announcement and diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will Israel attack Iran?
question.body:
Suppose the following two events occur: 

1. Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part as YES. Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

2. Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this part resolves as NO.

Given these two events occur, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Given both Biden's resignation announcement and diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will Israel not attack Iran?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following two events occur: 

1. Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part as YES. Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

2. Before June 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or credible reports: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are such reports before that date, then this part resolves as YES.

Given these two events occur, will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has not led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: In light of Biden's announcement of resignation and the rising tensions between China and the Philippines, is it possible that Israel will launch an assault on Iran?
para_P.body:
Consider the occurrence of these two scenarios: 

1. Joe Biden declares that he will not seek re-election and will resign from his position, with this announcement needing to be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He does not need to have officially left office by that time; merely announcing his intention to resign suffices for this part to be marked as YES. If he does not make such an announcement, this part will be marked NO on August 1st.

2. By June 1, 2024, one of these four actions takes place, as per official announcements or reliable reports: 
   - The Philippines sends home at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
   - The PRC sends home at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
   - The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If none of these events are reported by that date, this part will be marked as NO.

If both of these scenarios take place, will Israel execute a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024? This question will be answered with YES if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an Israeli attack occurring within Iran that results in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (3) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part as YES. Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

(2) Resolves YES if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

(3) Resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (3) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term, or if such announcements are made after the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. (2) Resolves YES if before June 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or credible reports:

(3) Resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (1) Joe Biden makes an announcement that he is both withdrawing from the presidential race and resigning from his position before the end of July 2024, (2) There are diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024, and (3) Israel executes a lethal assault within Iranian territory before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This part is resolved as YES if Joe Biden declares that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will resign, not completing his current presidential term. These declarations must be made before the conclusion of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated the office by that time. A statement of his intention to resign is enough for this part to be marked YES. Otherwise, it will be marked NO on August 1st.

(2) This part is marked YES if one of the following events occurs before June 1, 2024, according to official declarations or credible news sources: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If none of these events are reported before that date, then this part will be marked NO.

(3) This part is marked YES if, after the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: Will Team USA secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Olympics in Paris?
para_P.body: Resolves to Yes if the USA teams achieve gold in both categories. Resolves to No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first.

question.title: Given the US wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Then, is it true that a terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Given the US wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Then, is it true that no terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: If the United States secures gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The United States secures gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first.

Then, is it accurate that a terrorist incident will take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

An event will be regarded as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any official body of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given the US wins gold in both 5v5 basketball events and a terrorist act occurs during the 2024 Olympics, will a swimmer win the most gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and a terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The terrorist attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Both the US winning gold in both basketball events and the terrorist act must occur as described.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Resolves No otherwise.
- If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Given the US does not win gold in both 5v5 basketball events or a terrorist act does not occur during the 2024 Olympics, will a swimmer not win the most gold medals?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States does not win gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or a terrorist attack does not occur in metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The terrorist attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Either the US not winning gold in both basketball events or the terrorist act not occurring as described.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events. Resolves No otherwise.
- If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If the United States secures gold in both basketball competitions and a terrorist incident takes place during the 2024 Olympics, will a swimmer achieve the highest number of gold medals?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: The United States secures gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics, and a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France that causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). This terrorist incident must be officially recognized as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

Then, can we confirm that the athlete who wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics is a swimmer?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Both the US winning gold in the basketball events and the terrorist incident must take place as specified.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics is a swimmer. Resolves No otherwise.
- If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball and a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) a swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves Yes if all of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) a terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), and the attack is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers, and (c) the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Resolves No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (1) The United States does not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball or a terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, or (2) a swimmer does not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if at least one of the following does not occur: (a) Team USA does not win gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) a terrorist attack does not occur in metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), and the attack is not described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers, or (c) the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) The United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball while a terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) a swimmer achieves the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: Determines Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Team USA claims gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France resulting in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), and this incident is characterized as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers, and (c) the athlete who wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. Determines No in all other cases.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected as the nominee, this will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If another candidate is chosen, it will be answered with **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not significant; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

For the condition to be true, Tucker Carlson must be the nominee selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For the outcome to be true, the formal declaration under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment must occur before August 2024, regardless of the duration of the incapacity. Biden exiting the office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.

not_P.title: If Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Suppose Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

For the condition to be true, Tucker Carlson must be the nominee selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For the outcome to be true, the formal declaration under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment must not occur before August 2024, regardless of the duration of the incapacity. Biden exiting the office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee and Biden is declared incapacitated, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given these conditions, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If more than one ballot is required, this resolves as **Yes**. If only one ballot is required, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

not_P.title: Will Russian athletes not be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are not barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded with Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 

34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If no more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Russian athletes are excluded from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under any of the following conditions: (i) representing the Russian flag, (ii) under the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) using any other neutral or independent flag. The resolution will be based on the official roster of countries and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible news sources indicating that the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have concluded without the involvement of Russian athletes. For a **Yes** outcome, the number of competing Russians must not exceed 34. This limit was established as 10% of the [Russian athletes who took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to accommodate a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes are present at the 2024 Olympics, the outcome will be **No**.

In the event that the 2024 Olympics are canceled or postponed to 2025 or later, the resolution will be unclear.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

For the question to resolve as Yes, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as No. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: If Russian athletes are not allowed to participate in the 2024 Olympics and Biden is deemed unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: 

(a) Russian athletes are prohibited from competing in the 2024 Olympics under (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This determination will be based on the official roster of countries and athletes participating in the 2024 Olympics or credible news reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics have started or concluded without the presence of Russian athletes. For the response to be Yes, there must be no more than 34 Russian athletes competing in the 2024 Olympics. If the number exceeds 34, the response will be No. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, the response will be considered ambiguous.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Then, will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

This question will be answered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the answer will be No.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from the 2024 Olympics, Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, and Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ALL of the following occur:

(a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(c) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

All of the above conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will Russian athletes not be barred from the 2024 Olympics, Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, or Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ANY of the following occur:

(a) Russian athletes are not barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded with Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If 34 or fewer Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(c) Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Any of the above conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will Russian athletes be excluded from the 2024 Olympics, Biden be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August, and Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if ALL of the following conditions are met:

(a) Russian athletes are prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be determined based on the official roster of nations and athletes at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or through credible media reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have concluded without Russian involvement. For a **Yes** resolution, no more than 34 Russians may compete in the 2024 Olympics. The number 34 was selected as 10% of [Russian athletes who participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport-specific exceptions. If over 34 Russian athletes participate in the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are canceled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will resolve as ambiguous.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

(c) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes resolution, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

All of the above criteria must be fulfilled for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: If INC forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question explores the conditional scenario: Suppose the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections (expected in May 2024). Given this scenario, will any athlete run the Men's 100m race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63 seconds, breaking the Olympic record, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources? The resolution criteria for the condition are that the INC forms the government, and for the outcome, the Men's 100m dash time must be faster than 9.63 seconds.

The resolution criteria for the condition are that the INC forms the government, and for the outcome, the Men's 100m dash time must be 9.63 seconds or more.

In light of this scenario, will any competitor complete the Men's 100m event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, thereby breaking the Olympic record, as reported by the International Olympic Committee or other reliable sources? The criteria for the condition are that the INC must form the government, and for the outcome, the Men's 100m sprint time needs to be quicker than 9.63 seconds.

question.title: Given that INC forms the government after the next Indian general election and the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics breaks the Olympic record, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. (b) Any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

Then, will a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024)?

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Given that INC does not form the government after the next Indian general election or the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics does not break the Olympic record, will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
