Suppose the following is true: (a) The INC does not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. (b) No athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

Then, will no terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024)?

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is not described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Assuming the INC takes charge after the upcoming Indian general election and the winning time for the men's 100m sprint at the Paris Summer Olympics surpasses the Olympic record, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Let's consider the following premises: (a) The INC has a representative inaugurated as the next Prime Minister of India following the general elections anticipated around May 2024, after June 1, 2022. (b) An athlete completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results released by the International Olympic Committee or reliable sources.

In this context, will a terrorist incident occur in Metropolitan France that results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024)?

An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the French Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) INC forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, (b) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, and (c) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This resolves as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this resolves as **No**.

(c) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) INC does not form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, (b) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 does not break the Olympic record of 9.63s, and (c) No terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) This resolves as **Yes** if the INC does not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if no athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this happens, this resolves as **No**.

(c) The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is not described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following events take place: (a) The Indian National Congress (INC) takes power after the upcoming general elections in India in 2024, (b) The winning time for the men's 100m sprint at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics surpasses the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds, and (c) A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered **Yes** if a member of the INC is inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister after the general elections anticipated for May 2024, following June 1, 2022. Any other party will be deemed **No**.

(b) This will be marked as **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results verified by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If this does not occur, it will be marked as **No**.

(c) The outcome will be **Yes** if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury or death of at least one individual, excluding the assailants, during the period from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be marked as **No** if this does not occur.

An event will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French government agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will fewer than 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are there going to be a minimum of 5 nations that achieve their inaugural Olympic medal during the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if 5 or more nations secure their first Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics. In this context, we want to know if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) will win gold in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Resolves as **Yes** if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

not_P.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics. In this context, we want to know if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) will not win gold in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Resolves as **No** if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

para_P.title: Given that a minimum of 5 nations achieve their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will the same country secure victories in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which at least 5 nations earn their first-ever Olympic medal during the Paris Olympics. In this scenario, we seek to determine whether the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) will attain gold in multiple women's team events at the 2024 Olympics. 

Criteria for the condition's resolution: Resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more nations earn their first Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics.

Criteria for the outcome's resolution: Resolves as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Resolves as **Yes** if the same NOC triumphs in at least two of these competitions.

question.title: Given both (a) at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal and (b) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal, as confirmed by credible sources.

2. Women's teams representing the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win gold in more than one of the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Given these conditions, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

not_P.title: Given both (a) fewer than 5 countries win their first Olympic medal and (b) the same nation does not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Kalenjin athletes not win both the men's and women's marathon races?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:

1. Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal, as confirmed by credible sources.

2. Women's teams representing the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) do not win gold in more than one of the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Given these conditions, will Kalenjin athletes not win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if either the winner of the men's or the women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris does not have Kalenjin roots.

para_P.title: If it is true that (a) at least five nations secure their inaugural Olympic medal and (b) the same country achieves victories in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Kalenjin runners triumph in both the men's and women's marathon events?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds at the 2024 Paris Olympics:

1. At least five nations earn their first-ever Olympic medal, as verified by reliable sources.

2. Women's teams from the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claim gold in multiple team sports among the eight available: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Under these circumstances, will Kalenjin runners win both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This is confirmed as **Yes** if both the champions of the men's and women's marathons at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin heritage.

question.title: Will all of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal, (2) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport, and (3) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. Women's teams representing the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win gold in more than one of the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means the same NOC must have won at least two of these events. If women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in these sports, this condition is not met.

3. Both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal, (2) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport, and (3) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if not all of the following conditions are met:

1. Not at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. Women's teams representing different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in at most one of the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means that the same NOC does not win at least two of these events. If women's teams from the same NOC win gold in these sports, this condition is met.

3. Either the winner of the men's or women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris does not have Kalenjin roots.

para_P.title: Will all of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) at least 5 nations achieve their first Olympic medal, (2) a single country secures victories in more than one women's team sport, and (3) Kalenjin runners triumph in both the men's and women's marathon events?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with **Yes** if all of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. At least 5 nations earn their inaugural Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. Women's teams from the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win gold in multiple team sports out of the eight available: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This indicates that the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions. If women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in these sports, this requirement is not satisfied.

3. The champions of both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin ancestry.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply here.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Silver close above $30.50 on August 9, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President.

Resolution criteria for this condition: The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that the price of 1 ounce of silver will be above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: The market resolves YES if the price is above $30.50 USD. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below, the market resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Silver not close above $30.50 on August 9, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President.

Resolution criteria for this condition: The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that the price of 1 ounce of silver will not be above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: The market resolves YES if the price is not above $30.50 USD. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below, the market resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Biden is declared incapable under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August, will the price of silver exceed $30.50 on August 9, 2024?
para_P.body:
Imagine the following scenario: Before August 2024, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) utilizes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that President Biden is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his position, resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President.

Criteria for determining this condition: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

With that in mind, will it be the case that the cost of 1 ounce of silver will surpass $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9, 2024, according to the live ticker price per ounce available on Kitco.com?

Criteria for resolving this outcome: The market confirms YES if the price is above $30.50 USD. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or lower, the market confirms NO.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and Silver closing above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. This must occur before August 2024 (Eastern time), and the duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. (b) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. The price must be strictly above $30.50 USD, not exactly $30.50 or below.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question resolves as YES if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before this deadline that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on both Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and Silver closing above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. This must occur before August 2024 (Eastern time), and the duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. (b) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. The price must be strictly above $30.50 USD, not exactly $30.50 or below.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question resolves as YES if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before this deadline that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Given the scenario where both Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 and the price of silver exceeds $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) Joe Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, which means that the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant entity) formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President. This declaration must take place prior to August 2024 (Eastern time), and the length of incapacity is irrelevant. Biden stepping down from the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included, nor is Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. (b) The market price for 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at precisely 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, based on the live ticker price per ounce available on Kitco.com. The price must be strictly higher than $30.50 USD, excluding the exact figure of $30.50 or any lower value.

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden announce prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President? This inquiry will be answered with YES if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement before this cutoff time indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made before the specified deadline, the answer to this question will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (2) the Silver Close above $30.50 at 4pm on August 9th, 2024, and (3) Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Resolves YES if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024. The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time, the resolution is NO. The question is specific to the price being ABOVE $30.50 USD.

(3) Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (2) the Silver Close above $30.50 at 4pm on August 9th, 2024, and (3) Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Resolves YES if the price of 1 ounce of silver is not above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024. The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time, the resolution is NO. The question is specific to the price being NOT ABOVE $30.50 USD.

(3) Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (1) Biden being officially declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, (2) the price of silver exceeding $30.50 at 4pm on August 9, 2024, and (3) Biden publicly announcing before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

(2) Resolves YES if the cost of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) precisely at 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9, 2024. The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce shown on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or lower at that moment, the resolution is NO. The inquiry specifically concerns the price being ABOVE $30.50 USD.

(3) Resolves YES if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and final: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain in office until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will determine a yes outcome if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden continues to hold the official position of president of the United States.

question.title: If Joe Biden is still president by the end of July, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Then, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Joe Biden must be officially president at the specified time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves “yes” if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves “no” if they select a male presidential nominee.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden is still president by the end of July, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Then, will the Democratic delegates not select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Joe Biden must be officially president at the specified time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves “yes” if the Democratic delegates do not select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves “no” if they select a female presidential nominee.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden remain in office until the conclusion of July, will the Democratic Party choose a woman as their nominee for the 2024 presidential election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. In that case, will the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate as their presidential nominee for the upcoming 2024 election?

Criteria for the condition to be met: Joe Biden must be the official president at the specified time. 
Criteria for the outcome: Resolves “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves “no” if they opt for a male candidate.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden being president at the end of July 2024 and the Democratic Nominee being a woman, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores two separate geopolitical events and their potential overlap. Suppose the following is true: At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially the president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates have selected a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Given these conditions, will the South African National Assembly officially elect a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as 'yes' if both (a) Joe Biden is still president at the specified time, and (b) a female is the Democratic presidential nominee. 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves 'yes' if South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, based on credible reports. Resolves 'no' otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not being president at the end of July 2024 or the Democratic Nominee not being a woman, will South Africa not elect a president before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question explores two separate geopolitical events and their potential overlap. Suppose the following is true: At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is not officially the president of the United States, or the Democratic delegates have not selected a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Given these conditions, will the South African National Assembly not officially elect a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as 'yes' if either (a) Joe Biden is not president at the specified time, or (b) a female is not the Democratic presidential nominee. 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves 'yes' if South Africa does not elect a president before July 1, 2024, based on credible reports. Resolves 'no' otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden remains president at the close of July 2024 and the Democratic Nominee is a woman, will South Africa choose a president prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines two distinct geopolitical occurrences and their possible intersection. Let us assume the following holds true: At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the recognized president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates have nominated a woman for the presidential candidacy in the 2024 election. Under these circumstances, will the South African National Assembly formally elect a president before July 1, 2024, as reported by reliable sources? 

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: The question is answered 'yes' if both (a) Joe Biden is still the president at the given time, and (b) a woman is the Democratic presidential nominee. 
Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: It is answered 'yes' if South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, based on trustworthy reports. It is answered 'no' otherwise. If the condition is not satisfied, the answer is N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 and the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a woman, (b) South Africa will elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as 'yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (2) The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. It will resolve as 'no' if any of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will not still be president by the end of July 2024 or the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will not be a woman, (b) South Africa will not elect a president before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as 'yes' if any of the following conditions are not met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States, or the Democratic delegates do not select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (2) The South African National Assembly does not officially elect a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. It will resolve as 'no' if all of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Joe Biden remains the president by the close of July 2024 and a woman is chosen as the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee, (b) South Africa will have a presidential election prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'yes' if the following conditions are satisfied: (1) By 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates nominate a woman for the presidential election in 2024. (2) The South African National Assembly elects a president before July 1, 2024, based on reports from reliable sources. It will be answered with 'no' if any of these conditions are unmet.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or is unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, then this market will conclude with a no.

question.title: If Biden drops out before July 20, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close below $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close below $100 per share on any day before 7/31? Resolution criteria: For the condition, Biden must drop out or be unable to continue before July 20. For the outcome, NVDA must close below $100 on any day before 7/31.

not_P.title: If Biden drops out before July 20, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close at $100 per share or more by 7/31?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close at $100 per share or more on any day before 7/31? Resolution criteria: For the condition, Biden must drop out or be unable to continue before July 20. For the outcome, NVDA must close at $100 or more on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Should Biden exit the race prior to July 20, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) have a closing price under $100 per share by the end of July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario holds: Joe Biden exits or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) have a closing price below $100 per share on any date before July 31? Resolution criteria: Biden must exit or be unable to continue before July 20 for the condition, and NVDA must close below $100 on any date before July 31 for the outcome.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden dropping out before July 20 and Nvidia closing below $100 by July 31, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 on any day before July 31. Given these conditions, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link provided has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on both Biden not dropping out before July 20 or Nvidia closing at least $100 by July 31, will the linked market not get at least 377 traders by July 15?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, or (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes at least $100 on any day before July 31. Given these conditions, will the linked market not get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link provided does not have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming both Biden withdraws prior to July 20 and Nvidia finishes below $100 by July 31, will the associated market attract a minimum of 377 participants by July 15?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenarios: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, and (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) ends any day before July 31 with a closing price below $100. Under these circumstances, will the associated market draw at least 377 participants by the conclusion of July 15?

The outcome will be determined as follows: Resolves to YES if the market linked has 377 participants before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share by 7/31, and (c) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body: (a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. (b) This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31. (c) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share by 7/31, and (c) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
not_P.body: (a) If Biden does not drop out and is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to no. (b) This market resolves to NO if NVDA does not close below $100 on any day before 7/31. (c) Resolves NO if the market embedded above does not have at least 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves YES otherwise. (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) finishes below $100 per share by July 31, and (c) the referenced market attracts at least 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15?
para_P.body: (a) This market will be deemed a yes if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. (b) The market will resolve to YES if NVDA's closing price falls below $100 on any day before July 31. (c) It will resolve YES if the market mentioned above has 377 traders before the market closes on July 15 at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. It will resolve NO in all other cases. (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if no credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, continue to be held by the Republican Party in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if trustworthy sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. Should no election take place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

question.title: If the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Kamala Harris be president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? This will resolve as Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before the specified time. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with credible reporting as a secondary source.

not_P.title: If the Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Kamala Harris not be president by Friday?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person not representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will not be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? This will resolve as Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before the specified time. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with credible reporting as a secondary source.

para_P.title: Should the Republican Party hold onto Ohio's 6th congressional district during the 2024 special election, will Kamala Harris be acknowledged as president by Friday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This will be confirmed as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or statement will be prioritized. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be voided.

Then, is it accurate to say that Kamala Harris will be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET? This will be confirmed as Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States before the indicated deadline. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, with credible news reports serving as a secondary source.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district and Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree, unless no election is held before January 1, 2025, in which case this part is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4? For this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

not_P.title: Given the Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th district or Kamala Harris does not become President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden not be greater than 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A person representing the Republican Party does not win the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree, unless no election is held before January 1, 2025, in which case this part is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, not be greater than 3 or greater than 4? For this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: If the Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th district and Kamala Harris is either President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are satisfied: (1) A candidate from the Republican Party secures victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, relying on statements or sources from Ohio State if popular sources conflict, unless no election occurs before January 1, 2025, in which case this condition is void. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary reference being official US government data or a consensus from reliable reporting.

Then, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4? In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, (2) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if BOTH of the following occur: (1) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting. (3) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Kamala Harris does not become President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, (2) Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if NEITHER of the following occur: (1) No credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting. (3) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is reported as not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) The Republican Party successfully holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024 and Kamala Harris is installed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, (2) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (1) Reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements being prioritized if there is a conflict with popular sources. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this portion of the question is rendered void. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the main resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of trustworthy reporting. (3) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is documented as being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive value indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative value signifies Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party going to take place?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Given another Democratic party presidential debate, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is another Democratic party presidential debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
- The outcome resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Given another Democratic party presidential debate, will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is another Democratic party presidential debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
- The outcome resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 in 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If another Democratic presidential debate occurs, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: There will be an additional Democratic party presidential debate featuring potential nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Is it accurate to say that Donald Trump’s lead over Joe Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves to YES if a debate occurs as described. Resolves to NO otherwise.
- The outcome resolves to YES if Trump's lead over Biden is more than 3 and at most 4 in 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Resolves to NO otherwise.

question.title: If both a Democratic debate occurs and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for President in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and NO otherwise.

not_P.title: If both a Democratic debate occurs and Trump's lead over Biden is not between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for President in 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Ted Cruz not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Should both a debate among Democratic candidates take place and Trump's advantage over Biden be between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be chosen as the Republican candidate for President in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) A debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 but no more than 4 as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will Ted Cruz be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be considered a YES if Ted Cruz is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) a Democratic party presidential debate, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(c) Resolves YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) a Democratic party presidential debate, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(c) Resolves YES if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as YES. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) a presidential debate among Democratic candidates, (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average, and (c) Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 and at most 4 as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

(c) Resolves YES if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.
