question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this condition, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination.

Given this condition, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden publicly declares by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden makes a clear and official public statement indicating that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election. This announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, eliminating any chance that Biden might consider accepting the nomination.

Under this premise, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 show an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024? The determination will rely on the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, and the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? The resolution source for this is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators, the answer is YES. Otherwise, it is NO.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, or the US Core CPI does not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? The resolution source for this is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators, the answer is YES. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, and if the US Core CPI rises over 0.1% in July 2024, will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge him to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (1) Joe Biden makes a clear, public, and definitive statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for the upcoming presidential election in 2024. This announcement must be unequivocal and conclusive, allowing no interpretation that he might reconsider. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will at least 10 Democratic Senators request that Biden step aside before July 20, 2024? The reference for this resolution is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If, at any time prior to midnight Central Time on July 20, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, the answer is YES. If not, the answer is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (3) If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, then this condition is satisfied.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, the US Core CPI does not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, nor (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: Will none of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must allow for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (3) If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, then this condition is not satisfied.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, and the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July 2024, and (2) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: Is it the case that all of the following will happen: (1) Joe Biden makes a clear, public, and final announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the presidency in the 2024 election cycle, with no ambiguity regarding his acceptance. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the exact value found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (3) If, before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the New York Times website at https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down, then this condition is met.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially announced. 

Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially announced. 

Then, will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden passes away before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, as officially reported. 

Will the Pandemic Agreement then be approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official report of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves NO.

Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: Resolves YES if, at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is voted on and approved, per reports from reliable sources.

question.title: Given Joe Biden dies before Saturday AND the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions: 

1. Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.
2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to credible sources.

Given these conditions, will Biden drop out or otherwise be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time? If he does, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden does not die before Saturday OR the Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will Biden not drop out before 7/13?
not_P.body:
Consider the following conditions: 

1. Joe Biden does not die before Saturday, with no official announcement of his death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.
2. The Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to credible sources.

Given these conditions, will Biden not drop out or otherwise be able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time? If he does not, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday and the Pandemic Agreement receives approval during the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will he withdraw from the race before July 13?
para_P.body:
Take into account these scenarios: 

1. Joe Biden passes away before Saturday, with a formal announcement of his death made before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th.
2. The Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, based on reliable information.

Considering these scenarios, will Biden withdraw or otherwise be unable to pursue his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time? If he does, the answer will be YES. If not, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, and (c) Biden drops out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, (b) The Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, or (c) Biden does not drop out before July 13, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, (b) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, and (c) Biden withdraws from the presidential race before July 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is ratified in a vote, as reported by reliable sources.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If she is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Vice President for the Democratic Party?
para_P.body: In the event that Kamala Harris receives the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidential position, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP role, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP position after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market may resolve right after the nomination occurs.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is true. If someone else is selected, it is false. Changes after the initial nomination do not affect this.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Biden has a higher probability than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Trump is favored. Resolves 50-50 if odds are equal. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

not_P.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP, will 538 not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, will Joe Biden not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is true. If someone else is selected, it is false. Changes after the initial nomination do not affect this.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Trump is favored according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Biden has a higher probability than Trump. Resolves 50-50 if odds are equal. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

para_P.title: Assuming Kamala Harris is the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee, will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. In that case, will Joe Biden be projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024?

Criteria for determining P: If Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP, this condition holds true. If a different candidate is chosen, it is deemed false. Any developments after the initial selection do not alter this.

Criteria for determining Q: Resolves to YES if Biden's probability exceeds Trump's based on FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves to NO if Trump is favored. Resolves to 50-50 if the odds are equal. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP and 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. The nomination of Kamala Harris as VP will determine the resolution, regardless of any subsequent changes to the VP nomination. The resolution can occur immediately after the nomination. (2) On the day of July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. The forecast will be based on the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and the market will resolve once July 20 data points are available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous data will be used. If both conditions are met, the question resolves to 'Yes'; otherwise, it resolves to 'No'.

Given this scenario, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

not_P.title: Did someone not intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
not_P.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone did not intentionally shoot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump.

para_P.title: Was there an intentional shooting at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to the NYT: "It sounded like what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and seemed to be bleeding by his ear."

This will be marked as YES if someone deliberately fired a bullet or any similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It will be marked as NO if the incident was due to an accidental discharge or a ricochet that directed something towards Trump.

*The term bullet-like projectile refers to anything that functions as a bullet in a practical sense, even if it is not a conventional bullet. For instance, a BB gun pellet would not be considered, as it is not likely to be lethal like a bullet.

Criteria for the condition to be met: Doug Burgum must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
Criteria for the outcome: Tucker Carlson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Given Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are the Republican nominees, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic Vice President (VP)?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Both Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees.
- For the outcome: Kamala Harris must be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this resolves to no. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and not affected by any subsequent changes.

not_P.title: Given Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are the Republican nominees, will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP nominee?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Kamala Harris not be nominated as the Democratic Vice President (VP)?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Both Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees.
- For the outcome: Kamala Harris must not be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this resolves to yes. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and not affected by any subsequent changes.

para_P.title: If Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are the Republican candidates, will Kamala Harris be chosen as the Democratic VP candidate?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Republican National Convention has nominated both Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In that case, will Kamala Harris be chosen as the Vice President (VP) for the Democratic Party?

Criteria for resolution:
- For the condition: Both Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson must be chosen as nominees by the Republican National Convention.
- For the outcome: Kamala Harris must be selected as the Democratic VP. If another individual is nominated as VP, the answer will be no. The resolution is determined by the initial nomination and is not influenced by any later changes.

question.title: Will both Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If any of these conditions are not met, this will resolve as **No**.

For the first condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the second condition, if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will either Doug Burgum or Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP nominee?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Doug Burgum or Tucker Carlson are not selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If both of these conditions are met, this will resolve as **No**.

For the first condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the second condition, if Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Are Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election along with Kamala Harris as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Doug Burgum and Tucker Carlson are designated by the Republican National Convention as the candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, it will conclude with a **No**.

Regarding the first criterion, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined exclusively by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning the second criterion, if Kamala Harris is appointed as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, this market will resolve to yes. If a different individual is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. Any changes to the VP after the initial selection will not affect the outcome of this market. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure represents a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. This is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET? The four weeks are based on CDC's epidemiological weeks. The rate used is for all ages, races, and sexes, and the season is from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024. Data is considered after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US not occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 points. This is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season does not occur within four weeks (28 days) of the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET? The four weeks are based on CDC's epidemiological weeks. The rate used is for all ages, races, and sexes, and the season is from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024. Data is considered after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US happen within four weeks of the highest combined rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead of more than 2 and at most 3 points over Joe Biden in the national polling average by 538 for the 2024 presidential election. This is confirmed by checking the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage.

Then, is it accurate that the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the date when the combined peak for all three is recorded, as per the CDC's RESP-NET? The four-week timeframe is aligned with the CDC's epidemiological weeks. The rates considered are for all demographics, and the season spans from the week ending October 7, 2023, through the week ending June 1, 2024. The data is analyzed after the usual reporting delay, which is typically four weeks following the end of the week in question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 and hospitalization peaks align, will Ron DeSantis be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, according to the CDC's RESP-NET.

Then, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not between 2 and 3 or hospitalization peaks do not align, will Ron DeSantis not be the 2024 Republican nominee?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US does not occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, according to the CDC's RESP-NET.

Then, will Ron DeSantis not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

para_P.title: With Trump's advantage over Biden ranging from 2 to 3 and hospitalization peaks coinciding, will Ron DeSantis secure the Republican nomination for 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: 
(a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but no more than 3, based on 538's national polling average.
(b) The highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 people in the US takes place within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season, as per the CDC's RESP-NET.

Then, will the Republican National Convention choose Ron DeSantis as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will receive a **No** resolution. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, (b) the US hospitalization peak occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, and (c) Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3.

(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. The 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. The question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, (b) the US hospitalization peak occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, and (c) Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will not be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must not be greater than 2 or less than or equal to 3.

(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US will resolve as **No** if the maximum weekly rate for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is not less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. The 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. The question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

(c) This question will resolve as **No** if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden to be between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, (b) the peak of hospitalizations in the US to take place within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season, and (c) Ron DeSantis to be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The assessment of Trump's lead over Biden will be based on Donald Trump's standing against Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. The lead must exceed 2 and be at most 3.

(b) The highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 in the US will be deemed **Yes** if the peak weekly rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occur within four weeks (28 days) of the peak rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four-week period will be based on the end dates of the weeks. The rate will encompass all ages, races, and genders. The 2023-2024 season will be recognized as starting with the week ending October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending June 1, 2024. The resolution of this question will depend on data available after the typical reporting delay of 4 weeks following the week ending date.

(c) This question will be confirmed as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is designated by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other possibilities may emerge in the future.

For the purposes of this question, it is irrelevant who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections.  All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024)

not_P.title: Will BJP not form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP does not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections.  All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024)

para_P.title: Is it possible for the BJP to establish the government after the upcoming 2024 Indian general elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if a BJP member is inaugurated as the subsequent Indian Prime Minister after the forthcoming general elections. Any other political parties will result in a **No**.

This question pertains to the next general election taking place after June 1, 2022 (anticipated in May 2024).

question.title: Given BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential impact of BJP forming the government on the volatility of the S&P 500. 

Suppose the following is true: BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected to occur by May 2024. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023?

The resolution for the volatility index will be based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023 for a 'Yes' resolution.

not_P.title: Given BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question explores the potential impact of BJP forming the government on the volatility of the S&P 500. 

Suppose the following is true: BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected to occur by May 2024. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) not be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023?

The resolution for the volatility index will be based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023 for a 'Yes' resolution.

para_P.title: If the BJP takes power after the forthcoming Indian general elections in 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible effects of the BJP assuming control on the volatility of the S&P 500. 

Assuming the following holds true: a BJP member is inaugurated as the next Prime Minister of India after the upcoming general elections, which are anticipated to take place by May 2024. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be elevated on July 20, 2024, in comparison to July 20, 2023?

The determination for the volatility index will rely on data from the St. Louis Fed available at: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. A 'Yes' resolution requires that the reported figure for July 20, 2024, exceeds that of July 20, 2023.

question.title: Given both the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 and the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: 
1. The BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, meaning a BJP member is sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the general elections expected for May 2024. This resolves as **Yes** only if BJP forms the government after the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022.
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

not_P.title: Given both the BJP does not form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 and the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is not higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following are true: 
1. The BJP does not form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, meaning a BJP member is not sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the general elections expected for May 2024. This resolves as **Yes** only if BJP does not form the government after the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022.
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Then, will Donald Trump not be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: If the BJP secures power following the upcoming Indian general election in 2024, and the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index shows an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: 
1. The BJP secures power after the forthcoming Indian general election in 2024, signifying that a BJP representative is inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister after the elections anticipated in May 2024. This concludes as **Yes** only if the BJP comes into power after the general election taking place after June 1, 2022.
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) as reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, exceeds the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any comments related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must take place before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 (c) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) The BJP must have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections expected for May 2024. This resolves as **Yes** only if BJP forms the government after the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022. (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. (c) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. All conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be met for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 (c) Donald Trump is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) The BJP must not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections expected for May 2024. This resolves as **Yes** if BJP does not form the government after the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022. (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. (c) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must not occur before June 1, 2024. Not all conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be met for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events will happen: (a) The BJP secures a majority in the upcoming Indian general election in 2024 (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index shows an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024 (c) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) A representative from the BJP must be inaugurated as the next Indian Prime Minister after the general elections anticipated in May 2024. This condition is satisfied with a **Yes** only if the BJP successfully forms the government following the general election that takes place after June 1, 2022. (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) published by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, needs to exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023. (c) This question is answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any remarks concerning possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be brought before June 1, 2024. All three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be fulfilled for the answer to be **Yes**.

question.title: Will the Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.)
question.body:
This market will resolve yes if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Easter standard time on August 9th 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th the market will resolve as no. The question is particularly specific to the point ABOVE $30.50USD. 

Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD the market will resolve as a NO. 

I will do my best to resolve this market on time, if it hasn’t been resolved by 5pm EST time on August 9th 2024, please comment and remind me to resolve the marketplace! 

Thank you

not_P.title: Will the Silver Close at $30.50 or below @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.)
not_P.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

Then, will Meta publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not being president by the end of July, will Meta not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

Then, will Meta not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden remains president until the end of July, will Meta release a report detailing the findings from external red-teaming of their safety models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

In this case, will Meta make available a public report that includes the findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

Criteria for the condition to be met: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
Criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Joe Biden is still president by July 31, 2024, and Meta publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.
2. By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, any of the following occurs according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden is still president by July 31, 2024, and Meta publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls not occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.
2. By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls not take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, none of the following occurs according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any such reports occur before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden remains the president as of July 31, 2024, and Meta releases a safety report by June 30, 2024, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider the following assumptions: 

1. At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.
2. By June 30, 2024, Meta issues a public report detailing the findings from an external review of the safety of one of their AI models.

Under these circumstances, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

The outcome will be determined based on the following criteria: This question will be answered as **Yes** if, before June 1, 2024, any of the following events occur as reported by official sources or credible news outlets:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

If no such events are reported before that date, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (b) By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (c) Before June 1, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If any of these conditions are not met, then this resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024, will Meta not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or will diplomatic expulsions or recalls not take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States. (b) By June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (c) Before June 1, 2024, none of the following events happen, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If all of these conditions are met, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain the president, will Meta release a report detailing the findings from external assessments of their safety models by June 30, 2024, and will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is resolved as **YES** if all of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States. (b) By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *publicly accessible* report with the findings from an *independent* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models. (c) Before June 1, 2024, one of the following scenarios occurs, according to official announcements or [reliable reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats based in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If any of these criteria are not fulfilled, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Any other result will lead to the question being resolved as **No**.

question.title: Given Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Czechia also qualify for the Grand Final? This resolves as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, it resolves as **No**. If Georgia does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

If Czechia qualifies, it resolves as **No**. If Georgia does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Georgia makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also make it?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Georgia enters a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Therefore, will Czechia also make it to the Grand Final? This will be considered **Yes** if Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**. If Georgia does not qualify, this inquiry will be considered N/A.

question.title: Given both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Netherlands also qualify?

Suppose the following is true: Both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that both Georgia and Czechia have participated in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final.

Then, is it true that the Netherlands will also qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. not_P.title: Given both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Netherlands not qualify?

Suppose the following is true: Both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that both Georgia and Czechia have participated in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final.

Then, is it true that the Netherlands will not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If the Netherlands qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If both Georgia and Czechia make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will the Netherlands also make it?

Assuming the following holds: Both Georgia and Czechia have advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This indicates that both countries have taken part in a Semi-final and have been officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final.

Then, is it the case that the Netherlands will also be qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? question.title: Will Georgia, Czechia, and the Netherlands all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
