not_P.title: Will Georgia, Czechia, and the Netherlands not all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following does not occur: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (c) the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If all of Georgia, Czechia, and the Netherlands qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will all three countries, Georgia, Czechia, and the Netherlands, make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the following conditions are met: (a) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) the Netherlands competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should any of Georgia, Czechia, or the Netherlands fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If she is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: In the event that Kamala Harris receives the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP position, this market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can reach a conclusion right after the nomination.

question.title: GIVEN Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, is Donald Trump removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution Criteria for the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris needs to be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the condition is not met. The condition can be resolved immediately after the nomination.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome (Q):
- The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

not_P.title: GIVEN Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, is Donald Trump not removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution Criteria for the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris needs to be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the condition is not met. The condition can be resolved immediately after the nomination.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome (Q):
- The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

para_P.title: IF Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President, will Donald Trump be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will Donald Trump be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Criteria for Resolving the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris must be selected as the Democratic Vice President. If a different individual is chosen as VP, the condition is not satisfied. The condition can be resolved immediately following the selection.

Criteria for Resolving the Outcome (Q):
- The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports.
- The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. The resolution does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and Donald Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, meaning she is the initial nominee for the Vice President position by the Democratic party, and (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This means that on July 15, 2024, official announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports confirm his removal or blockage, and speculative reports do not count. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before the specified date.

not_P.title: Given Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and Donald Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Trump not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, meaning she is the initial nominee for the Vice President position by the Democratic party, and (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This means that on July 15, 2024, official announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports confirm his removal or blockage, and speculative reports do not count. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump not be charged or indicted with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Trump is not charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before the specified date.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate and Donald Trump is prohibited from appearing on the primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) Kamala Harris is selected as the Vice Presidential candidate by the Democratic party, and (b) Donald Trump is officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This indicates that on July 15, 2024, there are official announcements, judicial rulings, or reliable media reports confirming his disqualification or barring, and speculative reports are not included. Under these circumstances, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This would be considered **Yes** if Trump is charged for any remarks concerning potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before the mentioned date.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP, (b) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this part resolves to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this part resolves to no. The VP nomination is considered based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This part resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been removed or blocked based on official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for subsequent legal changes after this date.

(c) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

For the combined question to resolve as "Yes," all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must occur as described.

not_P.title: Will none of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP, (b) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this part resolves to yes. If Kamala Harris is nominated as VP, this part resolves to no. The VP nomination is considered based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination.

(b) Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This part resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been removed or blocked based on official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for subsequent legal changes after this date.

(c) Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must not occur before June 1, 2024.

For the combined question to resolve as "Yes," none of the three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must occur as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following three events to happen: (a) Kamala Harris gets selected as the Democratic Vice President, (b) Donald Trump faces removal or is barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Donald Trump receives charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is indeed selected for this role, this part will be considered a yes. If another individual is chosen for Vice President, this part will be a no. The selection for Vice President is based on the initial choice and will not change even if the Vice President is altered for any reason after the initial selection.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This part will be marked as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked based on state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information or unofficial statements will not be sufficient. The resolution is strictly based on the situation as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider any legal changes that may occur after this date.

(c) Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any comments about potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must take place before June 1, 2024.

For the overall question to be answered "Yes," all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be met as described.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before the clock strikes midnight on July 20 Eastern Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the outcome will be a no.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Linda Yaccarino not be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Linda Yaccarino not be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Biden exits the race prior to July 20, will Linda Yaccarino assume the role of CEO at Twitter by July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Biden exits or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. In that case, will Linda Yaccarino hold the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024?

Criteria for assessing the condition: This condition is fulfilled if Biden exits or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official announcements from Twitter or reliable news outlets. Resolves to NO in any other scenario.

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves to N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden dropping out before July 20 and Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024, seasonally adjusted, increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Conditional on both Biden not dropping out before July 20 and Linda Yaccarino not being CEO of Twitter on July 1, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024, seasonally adjusted, increase by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Given the scenario where Biden withdraws from the race before July 20 and Linda Yaccarino assumes the role of CEO at Twitter by July 1, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) Biden exits or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, and (b) Linda Yaccarino is officially recognized as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, by either Twitter's formal announcements or reliable news outlets. Will the US Core CPI for July 2024, adjusted for seasonality, show an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, utilizing the precise (not rounded) figure.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, (b) Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (c) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, (b) Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI does not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (c) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Are all of the following events going to happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, (b) Linda Yaccarino holds the title of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI rises by more than 0.1% in July?
para_P.body: (a) Biden either steps down or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. (b) Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official announcements from Twitter or reliable news outlets. (c) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024. The resolution will refer to the data found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (not rounded) figure.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Liz Cheney going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made, it resolves as No.

not_P.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made, it resolves as No.

para_P.title: If Liz Cheney becomes the Republican candidate, will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following is accurate: Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, can we assert that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Criteria for resolution: This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and final. If no such statement is made, it will be considered No.

question.title: If both Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic nomination for President. Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM?

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected as the Republican nominee.
- For (b): Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: If either Liz Cheney is not the Republican nominee or Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will seek or will accept the Democratic nomination for President. Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be less than or equal to 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM?

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is not selected as the Republican nominee.
- For (b): Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces he will accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is <=46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Should Liz Cheney be the Republican candidate and Joe Biden declare he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's chances of winning rise according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) Liz Cheney is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden makes a clear, public, official statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic nomination for President. Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's analysis exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM?

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is appointed as the Republican candidate.
- For (b): Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes a statement that he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is >46.6% at the specified date and time in Nate Silver's analysis. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

(c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
(a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate must resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

(b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(c) Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following events to take place: (a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President (c) Kamala's chances of winning improve in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
(a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For this question, it is not relevant who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President: This question will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To qualify for a Yes answer, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no doubt that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

(c) Kamala's chances of winning improve in the upcoming week according to Nate Silver's model: This will be answered with YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be answered with NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it is not pertinent who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Will Hurd is the Republican nominee, will Vivek Ramaswamy also be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Vivek Ramaswamy also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: If Will Hurd is the Republican nominee, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Vivek Ramaswamy not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Should Will Hurd be the Republican candidate, will Vivek Ramaswamy also be chosen as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Vivek Ramaswamy also chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as Republican nominees, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This scenario is highly unlikely as typically only one candidate is selected as the nominee. The resolution criterion for this condition is that both individuals must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is the following true? The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Given both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as Republican nominees, will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This scenario is highly unlikely as typically only one candidate is selected as the nominee. The resolution criterion for this condition is that both individuals must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is the following true? The Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This resolves as Yes if no credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is not held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are chosen as the Republican nominees, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the upcoming special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This situation is quite improbable since generally, only one individual is chosen as the nominee. The determining criterion for this scenario is that both candidates must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Now, is it correct to assert that the Republican Party maintains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously occupied by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This is considered true if reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If there are conflicting reports from popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are not selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) Neither Will Hurd nor Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) No credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are chosen as the Republican candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party successfully maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved affirmatively if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) The Republican National Convention selects both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the decision of the convention's delegates. (2) Reliable sources indicate that a representative of the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was previously occupied by Bill Johnson. In cases of conflicting reports, an official Ohio State source or statement will be prioritized. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will either resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold the position of director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service resigning, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

Every month, a Manifold poll is posted to gather consensus on the progress towards AGI, asking simply "has weak AGI been achieved," without defining the term. Respondents vote based on their understanding. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service resigning, will less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

Every month, a Manifold poll is posted to gather consensus on the progress towards AGI, asking simply "has weak AGI been achieved," without defining the term. Respondents vote based on their understanding. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is less than 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: If the head of the Secret Service steps down, will a minimum of 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was realized prior to July 23, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is terminated, or for any other reason ceases to occupy the role before October 12, 2024. 

In that case, will at least 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was realized before July 23, 2024?

Each month, a Manifold survey is conducted to assess the consensus on advancements in AGI, simply asking "has weak AGI been realized," without providing a definition for the term. Respondents cast their votes based on their interpretation. The July 2024 survey will conclude with a YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, disregarding "no opinion" responses. If not, it will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) at least 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

(a) This means Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will have resigned, been fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

(b) The July 2024 poll on Manifold will result in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, indicating that at least 30% of respondents agree weak AGI was achieved, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

not_P.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is still the director of the U.S. Secret Service on or after October 12, 2024, or fewer than 30% of Manifold respondents agree weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Either (a) Kimberly Cheatle will still be the director of the U.S. Secret Service on or after October 12, 2024, or (b) fewer than 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

(a) This means Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will not have resigned, been fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service on or after October 12, 2024.

(b) The July 2024 poll on Manifold will result in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) less than 0.3, indicating that fewer than 30% of respondents agree weak AGI was achieved, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Assuming Kimberly Cheatle is not the director of the U.S. Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, and a minimum of 30% of Manifold participants acknowledge that weak AGI was realized before July 23, 2024, will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Let us consider these conditions: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will cease to be the director of the U.S. Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, and (b) at least 30% of Manifold participants will concur that weak AGI was accomplished before July 23, 2024. 

(a) This implies that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will have either resigned, been dismissed, or otherwise no longer hold the position of director before October 12, 2024.

(b) The poll conducted by Manifold in July 2024 will yield a proportion of YES/(NO + YES) that is equal to or exceeds 0.3, signifying that at least 30% of respondents believe weak AGI was achieved, disregarding those with "no opinion."

Consequently, can we conclude that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be answered with a YES if Donald Trump is chosen as the nominee by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, (2) at least 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (3) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(2) Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

not_P.title: Will USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if no team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Standings at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the U.S. Olympic Team ranks as the (sole) top team at the Paris 2024 Olympics. It will be deemed unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team achieves a ranking that is equal to or surpasses that of the U.S. team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and arranging them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in Golds) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silvers) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Conditional on the USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two sporting events:

1. **Condition:** The USA must top the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This occurs if the United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team based on the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, the condition resolves ambiguously.

2. **Outcome:** Resolves YES if the American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game.

The question asks: If the USA is the top-ranked team at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?

not_P.title: Conditional on the USA not topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the American League Team not win the MLB All Star Game?
not_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between two sporting events:

1. **Condition:** The USA must not top the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This occurs if the United States Olympic Team is not the (unique) highest ranked team based on the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, the condition resolves ambiguously.

2. **Outcome:** Resolves YES if the American League Team does not win the MLB All Star Game.

The question asks: If the USA is not the top-ranked team at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the American League Team not win the MLB All Star Game?

para_P.title: If the USA leads the Olympic Medal Count at the Paris 2024 Games, will the American League Team secure victory in the MLB All Star Game?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between two athletic competitions:

1. **Prerequisite:** The USA must lead the Olympic Medal Count at the 2024 Paris Games. This condition is satisfied if the United States Olympic Team is the (sole) highest ranked team according to the total number of gold, silver, and bronze medals. Should the Paris Olympics not occur prior to 2027, the prerequisite becomes unclear.

2. **Result:** Results in YES if the American League Team triumphs in the MLB All Star Game.

The inquiry posits: If the USA is the leading team at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the American League Team emerge victorious in the MLB All Star Game?

question.title: Given the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 AND the American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game, will the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that order, and (2) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. Given these conditions, will the Milwaukee Bucks be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if any other team wins or if the Bucks are eliminated from contention. If either of the initial conditions is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given the USA does not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 OR the American League Team does not win the MLB All Star Game, will the Milwaukee Bucks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team is not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that order, or (2) The American League Team does not win the MLB All Star Game. Given these conditions, will the Milwaukee Bucks not be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks do not win the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if the Bucks win the Finals or if they are not eliminated from contention. If either of the initial conditions is met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the USA secures the top position in the Olympic Medal Count at Paris 2024 and the American League Team emerges victorious in the MLB All Star Game, will the Milwaukee Bucks claim the title in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (1) The United States Olympic Team ranks as the (sole) highest team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, determined by the tally of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that sequence, and (2) The American League Team prevails in the MLB All Star Game. Under these circumstances, will the Milwaukee Bucks be recognized as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals as per NBA regulations? The answer will be **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks are victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals. It will be **No** if any other team wins or if the Bucks are removed from the competition. If either of the initial conditions fails to be satisfied, the question will be considered N/A.

question.title: Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game, AND the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if ALL of the following occur: (1) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. (2) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. (3) The Milwaukee Bucks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

The question resolves negatively if any of these conditions fail.

not_P.title: Will the USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, the American League Team lose the MLB All Star Game, OR the Milwaukee Bucks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if ANY of the following occur: (1) The United States Olympic Team do not achieve the (unique) highest ranking at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if the US team is the highest or equal ranking team. (2) The American League Team loses the MLB All Star Game. (3) The Milwaukee Bucks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

The question resolves positively if any of these conditions fail.

para_P.title: Will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, the American League Team triumph in the MLB All Star Game, AND the Milwaukee Bucks secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if ALL of the following conditions are met: (1) The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by tallying all medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them according to: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie in Gold Medals) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie in Silver Medals) Number of Bronze Medals. It will be answered ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be answered negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to that of the US team. (2) The American League Team prevails in the MLB All Star Game. (3) The Milwaukee Bucks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

The question will be answered negatively if any of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Given both the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2023, and the VXVCLS is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:

Resolution criteria for the condition: The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2023. The VXVCLS question resolves YES if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an unambiguous and conclusive statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If the linked market reaches a minimum of 377 traders by July 15, 2023, and the VXVCLS increases Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for resolving the condition: The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before the market closes on July 15, 2023. The VXVCLS question resolves YES if the figure reported on July 20, 2024, exceeds the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an unequivocal and definitive announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(1) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

(2) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve YES if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

(1) The linked market will resolve YES if it has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

(2) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve YES if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(3) This question will resolve as **No** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek or will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **No** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of these events will take place: (1) the linked market achieves a minimum of 377 traders by the close of July 15, 2023, (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) shows a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(1) The linked market will be considered resolved as YES if it has at least 377 traders before the market closes on July 15, 2023, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. It will resolve as NO if this condition is not met. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

(2) The inquiry regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve as YES if the figure reported on July 20, 2024, exceeds the figure reported on July 20, 2023, as per the St. Louis Fed's reporting: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(3) This question will be answered as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.
