para_P.title: Will the BSE SENSEX close above 76,000 and at or below 77,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions: 

1. The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

2. The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) must invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Suppose the BSE SENSEX condition is met. Then, will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked as described before August 2024?

not_P.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
This question considers two conditions: 

1. The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

2. The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) must not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Suppose the BSE SENSEX condition is met. Then, will the 25th Amendment Section 4 not be invoked as described before August 2024?

para_P.title: If the BSE SENSEX finishes between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines two prerequisites: 

1. The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must fall above 76,000 and at or below 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. The Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent group) must activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Assuming the BSE SENSEX criterion is satisfied, will Section 4 of the 25th Amendment be enacted as outlined before August 2024?

question.title: Given both (a) BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true:

(a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
(b) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if he is selected, and NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Given both (a) BSE SENSEX does not close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, or (b) Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true:

(a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is not greater than 76,000 or not less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
(b) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to not serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if he is not selected, and NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If (a) the BSE SENSEX finishes between 76,000 and 77,000 on July 21, 2024, and (b) Biden is declared unable to perform his duties under the 25th Amendment prior to August, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold:

(a) On July 21, 2024, the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX is more than 76,000 and at most 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.
(b) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially announce that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," leading to the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden utilizing section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Under these circumstances, will Vivek Ramaswamy be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question is answered with YES if he is chosen, and NO if he is not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August? (c) Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 76k or greater than 77k? (b) Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August? (c) Will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the final value of BSE SENSEX exceed 76,000 but not surpass 77,000? (b) Will Biden be officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August? (c) Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry is resolved based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

If Biden leaves the Presidency through death, resignation, etc., it does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker is requesting Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(c) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is designated as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates listed currently; additional options may be included later.

For this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; it is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

not_P.title: Will the USA win no more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher total of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two independent events:

1. **Condition:** The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This resolves to Yes if the number of Gold medals is greater than the number of Silver medals.

2. **Outcome:** Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves to Yes if Donald Trump is chosen as the nominee.

Suppose the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

not_P.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question explores the relationship between two independent events:

1. **Condition:** The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This resolves to Yes if the number of Gold medals is greater than the number of Silver medals.

2. **Outcome:** Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves to Yes if Donald Trump is not chosen as the nominee.

Suppose the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: Assuming the USA secures a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Donald Trump be the chosen nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between two separate events:

1. **Condition:** The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This is considered Yes if the quantity of Gold medals exceeds that of Silver medals.

2. **Outcome:** Donald Trump is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is considered Yes if Donald Trump is nominated.

If the USA wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, then will Donald Trump be the Republican Party's nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and Donald Trump being the Republican nominee, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if both (1) and (2) are true. If either or both are not met, the condition is false.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

not_P.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and Donald Trump being the Republican nominee, will Russia not control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if both (1) and (2) are true. If either or both are not met, the condition is false.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the categories indicating Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

para_P.title: Given that the USA secures a greater number of Gold medals than Silver at the Paris 2024 Olympics and Donald Trump is the Republican candidate, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) The United States Olympic Team achieves more Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (2) Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In that case, will Russia possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Criteria for the condition to be satisfied: The condition is fulfilled if both (1) and (2) are true. If either or both are false, the condition does not hold.

Criteria for the outcome: This question will be marked as **Yes** if, when evaluated by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any category that signifies Russian control. It will be marked as **No** if the location is determined not to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (3) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves No.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Russia does not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if not all of the following conditions are met: (1) The United States Olympic Team does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (2) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (3) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. If all of these conditions are met, this question resolves No.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (a) the USA secures more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (b) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Russia maintains control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if all of these specific conditions are fulfilled: (1) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (2) Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (3) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any categories that denote Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area. If any of these stipulations are not satisfied, this inquiry will conclude with a No.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise. The nomination is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that Tucker Carlson will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise. The nomination is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, if Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average, will Tucker Carlson be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average. This is derived from Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, as viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

Thus, can it be confirmed that Tucker Carlson will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer is Yes if Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise. The nomination is exclusively determined by the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points and Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee, will 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Given these conditions, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For this to resolve YES, the group must collectively ask Biden to drop out, such as by signing a letter or speaking with him in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Separate individual statements do not count. Unnamed sources are insufficient unless at least 5 names are confirmed publicly before the end date. If these criteria are not met by July 20th, the question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points and Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee, will not 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Given these conditions, will a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to NOT ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to NOT urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For this to resolve YES, the group must NOT collectively ask Biden to drop out, such as by NOT signing a letter or NOT speaking with him in person. All five individuals must NOT be part of the same group message. Separate individual statements do not count. Unnamed sources are insufficient unless at least 5 names are confirmed publicly before the end date. If these criteria are met by July 20th, the question resolves YES.

para_P.title: With Trump's advantage over Biden being between 2 and 3 points and Tucker Carlson as the Republican candidate, will there be pressure from 5 Democratic House Members or Senators for Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenarios hold true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 3 points based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson has been nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Under these circumstances, will a coalition of at least five specific Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For this to be a YES, the group must formally request Biden to withdraw, such as by signing a letter or having a direct conversation with him. All five members must be included in the same collective communication. Individual statements made separately will not be considered. Anonymous sources will not suffice unless at least 5 names are publicly confirmed before the deadline. If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **No** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will take place: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, (2) Tucker Carlson is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being chosen will result in a **No** resolution. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other possibilities may emerge later. For this question, it is irrelevant who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) This market resolves YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as a signed letter as previously mentioned, or in another fashion such as a group discussing with Biden in person and collectively urging him to withdraw.

This market necessitates that all five individuals be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately indicating to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Any reports of unnamed democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's criteria unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not counted.

Background: A GOP lawmaker has urged Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

Then, is it true that credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

not_P.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

Then, is it true that there are no credible sources reporting Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Context: A Republican lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

Consequently, is it accurate that reliable sources indicate Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, regarding the trial about the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

question.title: Conditional on Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment and Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will the governor of Gagauzia travel to Russia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial concerning payments to Stormy Daniels. 
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. 
(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Then, is it true that the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, will travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

not_P.title: Conditional on Biden not being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment or Trump not testifying at the hush money trial, will the governor of Gagauzia not travel to Russia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or (b) Donald Trump does not testify at the hush money trial concerning payments to Stormy Daniels. 
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. 
(b) Resolves YES if there are no credible sources reporting that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Then, is it true that the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, will not travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024? 
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, there are no credible sources reporting that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

para_P.title: Assuming Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment and Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will the governor of Gagauzia make a trip to Russia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, and (b) Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial related to payments made to Stormy Daniels. 
(a) This will be confirmed as YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity does not impact this question. The President leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable either. 
(b) This will be confirmed as YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or virtually, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Consequently, is it accurate to say that the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, will visit the Russian Federation prior to June 1, 2024? This question will be answered with **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, reliable sources confirm that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory during that timeframe.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial, and (c) Evghenia Guțul travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(c) Resolves YES if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial, and (c) Evghenia Guțul travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if credible sources do not report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is not applicable. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

(b) This will be considered TRUE if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(c) This will be considered TRUE if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory during that timeframe.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), occurring between, and including, the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, it will resolve as No if the aforementioned scenario does not transpire.

An incident will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is classified as such by any governmental body of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: If a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that Asa Hutchinson will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: If a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that Asa Hutchinson will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Should a terrorist incident take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Asa Hutchinson be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The occurrence must be labeled as a 'terrorist incident' by any official French authority, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the French Council of Ministers.

Then, is it accurate that Asa Hutchinson will be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This determination is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is officially named as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Conditional on both a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Details for condition (1): The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for condition (2): This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Then, is it true that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a woman? The outcome resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Conditional on both a terrorist act not occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics or Asa Hutchinson not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a woman?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, or (2) Asa Hutchinson is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Details for condition (1): The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) does not injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for condition (2): This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Then, is it true that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will not be a woman? The outcome resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Given that a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Asa Hutchinson is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Democratic nominee for President in 2024 be a female?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds: (1) A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

For condition (1): The question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, apart from the terrorist(s), between and including the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will be answered with No if this does not occur. An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

For condition (2): This question will be answered with **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently acknowledged; additional options may be introduced later. For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Therefore, is it accurate to say that the Democratic nominee for President in 2024 will be a woman? The outcome is “yes” if the Democratic delegates select a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024. It is “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) the Democratic candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election is a woman?
para_P.body:

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on the US government ending its agreement with Verisign, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for condition: This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on the US government not ending its agreement with Verisign, will Joe Biden live until Saturday?
not_P.body:
Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for condition: This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does happen, this question resolves as No.

Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Should the US government discontinue its contract with Verisign, will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
Is it possible for the US government to terminate its agreement that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: This question will be marked as Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not occur, the question will be marked as No.

Criteria for determining the outcome: It will be marked YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be marked NO.

If the condition is unmet, it will be marked N/A.

question.title: Given both the US ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, and Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (with an official announcement before market close on Friday, July 26th). 

Given these conditions, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, (b) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, and (c) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

(b) Will Joe Biden die before Saturday? Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(c) Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

If this does not occur, the question will be answered as No.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no possibility of Biden accepting the nomination for the 2024 election cycle.

Then, will Asa Hutchinson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Hutchinson is chosen by the convention delegates, and No otherwise. Note that this is determined solely by the Republican National Convention's selection, not by the eventual nominee on the election day.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

It is important to note that this decision is based solely on the choice made by the Republican National Convention, not on who is ultimately chosen on election day.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination AND Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee, will Kamala Harris be President by July 26, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the condition:

1. Joe Biden's Announcement:
   - Resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.
   - The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.
   - If no such statement is made by the deadline, this component resolves as No.

2. Asa Hutchinson's Nomination:
   - Resolves as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
   - Determined solely by the selection of the Republican National Convention delegates, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

For the condition to resolve as Yes, both components (1) and (2) must resolve as Yes.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.
- Resolves No otherwise.

   - The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of not accepting the nomination.
   - If no such statement is made by the deadline, this component resolves as No.

2. Asa Hutchinson's Nomination:
   - Resolves as Yes if Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
   - Determined solely by the selection of the Republican National Convention delegates, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

For the condition to resolve as Yes, at least one of the components (1) or (2) must resolve as Yes.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves No if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.
- Resolves Yes otherwise.

For the condition to be confirmed as Yes, both parts (1) and (2) must be confirmed as Yes.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all fewer than five individuals not be part of the same group message. Fewer than five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a NO resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.
