para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news that they believe Biden's chances for a November victory are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will conclude with a YES if at least five named Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborate to request Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through a signed letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden and collectively requesting that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to journalists their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Any reports regarding an unspecified number of Democrats writing to Biden and requesting him to step down will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the end date of this market. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will likely resolve NO.

If the outlined conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: If a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressures Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and Anthropic publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will Biden announce not accepting the nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20, 2024, and (b) Anthropic publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for condition:
- (a) Resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign or urge him to do so before July 20, 2024.
- (b) Resolves YES if Anthropic publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle.
- Resolves NO if such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: If a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators do not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, or Anthropic does not publish a safety report by June 30, 2024, will Biden announce accepting the nomination before July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of fewer than 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or do not urge him to do so, before July 20, 2024, or (b) Anthropic does not publish a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for condition:
- (a) Resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign or do not urge him to do so before July 20, 2024.
- (b) Resolves YES if Anthropic does not publish a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle.
- Resolves NO if such a statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024.

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Should a coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and if Anthropic releases a safety evaluation report by June 30, 2024, will Biden declare that he will not accept the nomination before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) A coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before July 20, 2024, and (b) Anthropic releases a public safety evaluation report with findings from external red-teaming of their models by June 30, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination?

Criteria for assessing the conditions:
- (a) Resolves YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives/Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign or encourages him to do so before July 20, 2024.
- (b) Resolves YES if Anthropic releases a public report detailing results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome:
- Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination in the 2024 election cycle.
- Resolves NO if such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024.

If either condition (a) or (b) is unmet, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, (b) Anthropic publishes an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Politico reports: Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(b) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, (b) Anthropic does not publish an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, or (c) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Politico reports: Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(b) This question resolves as **NO** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) This question will resolve as **No** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **No** resolution, the statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following events take place: (a) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, (b) Anthropic releases a public red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) According to Politico, two members from secure districts have already called for Biden to step aside. Two vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they have already dismissed Biden's chances in November. Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. Several drafts of letters are in circulation among House Democrats, and at least one is expected to urge Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation. This market will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter like the one mentioned above, or through other means such as a group engaging with Biden in person and collectively asking him to withdraw. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are made public before the market's conclusion. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

(b) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic puts out a *public* report detailing the results from an *external* party evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive, leaving no ambiguity about Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a Yes if Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's on July 17, 2024, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market capitalization being larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Given this condition, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's on the specified date and time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee by the Republican National Convention, and No otherwise. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market capitalization being larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Given this condition, will Nikki Haley not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's on the specified date and time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Nikki Haley is not selected as the Republican nominee by the Republican National Convention, and No otherwise. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Assuming Nvidia's market value exceeds that of Apple on July 17, 2024, will Nikki Haley be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Under this premise, will Nikki Haley be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: Resolves Yes if Nvidia's market value is greater than Apple's on the specified date and time. 
Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: Resolves Yes if Nikki Haley is nominated as the Republican candidate by the Republican National Convention, and No in all other cases. This decision is exclusively based on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap surpassing Apple's and Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, and Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for P: (1) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap must be greater than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) Nikki Haley must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for Q: Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of acceptance.

not_P.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap not surpassing Apple's or Nikki Haley not being the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's, or Nikki Haley is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for P: (1) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap must not be greater than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) Nikki Haley must not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for Q: Joe Biden or his campaign must not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility of acceptance.

para_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple and Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate, will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is greater than that of Apple, and Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for determining P: (1) As of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization must surpass Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap, checked by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) Nikki Haley must be officially nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Criteria for determining Q: Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and final, with no possibility of acceptance.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 17, 2024: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds Apple's, (2) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves Yes if all of the following conditions are met:

(1) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(2) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

(3) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

All three components must be true for this question to resolve as Yes.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur by July 17, 2024: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization does not exceed Apple's, (2) Nikki Haley is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (3) Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question resolves Yes if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(1) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(2) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

(3) Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, allowing for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

At least one of the three components must be true for this question to resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: By July 17, 2024, will the following take place: (1) Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple, (2) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with Yes if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(1) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus at around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(2) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

(3) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination.

All three elements must be true for this question to be answered as Yes.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a live, on-camera discussion lasting over 45 minutes, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve to YES, Biden must engage in another in-person interview that lasts at least 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is made available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press briefings, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town hall meetings, etc. It may include guest spots on podcasts or late-night television shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person for these appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video may only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

Then, is it true that the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000? The closing value is determined according to Yahoo Finance.

not_P.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, not be greater than 75k or not be less than or equal to 76k?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

Then, is it true that the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will not be greater than 75,000 or not be less than or equal to 76,000? The closing value is determined according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, will the final value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but not surpass 76,000?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Joe Biden is involved in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for no less than 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night television shows, or an interview that is part of a program like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. 

Then, is it accurate to say that the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be above 75,000 and at most 76,000? The closing value is established based on Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given both Joe Biden's interview and BSE SENSEX closing value conditions are met, will US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but including appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes with at least 45 minutes of new footage, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 as per Yahoo Finance data. Then, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL?

not_P.title: Given both Joe Biden's interview and BSE SENSEX closing value conditions are NOT met, will US Core CPI NOT increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden does NOT have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but including appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes with at least 45 minutes of new footage, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is NOT greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 as per Yahoo Finance data. Then, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 NOT increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL?

para_P.title: If both conditions regarding Joe Biden's interview and the BSE SENSEX closing value are satisfied, will the US Core CPI rise by over 0.1% in July 2024?
para_P.body: Consider the following conditions: (a) Joe Biden engages in a personal interview or on-camera discussion for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024, not counting press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but including appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or programs like 60 Minutes with at least 45 minutes of fresh content, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the BSE SENSEX's closing figure is above 75,000 and at most 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance. Under these circumstances, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 show an increase of more than 0.1% when compared to June 2024, referencing the precise value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX will be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For example, Biden's interview on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualifies. However, an appearance with less than 30 minutes of interview footage, like his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, does not qualify.

(b) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, as per Yahoo Finance data.

(c) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX will be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden must not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For example, Biden's interview on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualifies. However, an appearance with less than 30 minutes of interview footage, like his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, does not qualify.

(b) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must not be greater than 75,000 or less than or equal to 76,000, as per Yahoo Finance data.

(c) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Will the following three events take place: (a) Joe Biden will engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, (b) On July 21, 2024, the final value of the BSE SENSEX will exceed 75,000 but not surpass 76,000, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will show an increase greater than 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden is required to participate in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night talk shows, or an interview that is incorporated into a program like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. For instance, Biden's interview on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes, qualifies. Conversely, an appearance with less than 30 minutes of interview footage, such as his segment on Jimmy Fallon in February, does not qualify.

(b) The closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be above 75,000 and at most 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance data.

(c) Resolves to YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 rises by more than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

not_P.title: Will Linda Yaccarino not be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that Linda Yaccarino will hold the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino occupies the role of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or reliable news outlets.

question.title: Given Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as Yes if Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as CEO on July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Given Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as Yes if Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as CEO on July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the Democratic nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Linda Yaccarino holds the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden make an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Linda Yaccarino is officially acknowledged as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on announcements from Twitter or reliable media outlets. In that case, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for confirming the condition: The response is Yes if Linda Yaccarino is verified as CEO on July 1, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The response is Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic nomination for President in the 2024 election. This statement must be clear and definitive.

If the condition is not satisfied, the resolution is N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (a) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources, and (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, will Team USA win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics? Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Conditional on both Linda Yaccarino not being CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, or Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following are true: (a) Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will seek or will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, will Team USA not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics? Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves No if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: Assuming that Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and that Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, will the United States secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Consider the following conditions: (a) Linda Yaccarino holds the CEO position at Twitter on July 1, 2024, as confirmed by official Twitter announcements or reliable news outlets, and (b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unequivocal and final, eliminating any possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic nomination for President in the 2024 election.

Under these circumstances, will Team USA achieve gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics? It will be considered a Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals, and a No if either the men's or women's team finishes in any position other than first.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (3) the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body: Will all of the following occur: (1) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources, (2) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, and (3) Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. The question resolves Yes if all three conditions are met. It resolves No if any one of these conditions is not met.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (3) the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources, (2) Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, and (3) Team USA does not win both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. The question resolves Yes if any one of these conditions is not met. It resolves No if all three conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (1) Linda Yaccarino will hold the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, (2) Joe Biden will publicly declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (3) the United States will secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: Is it true that the following will happen: (1) Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or reputable news outlets, (2) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be definitive and categorical, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election, and (3) Team USA achieves victory in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball, winning gold at the Paris Olympics. The question will be answered with Yes if all three criteria are satisfied. It will be answered with No if any one of these criteria is not satisfied.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Glenn Youngkin going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not dependent on who is the nominee on the day of the election, but solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If he does, the outcome is yes. Otherwise, the outcome is no.

not_P.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not dependent on who is the nominee on the day of the election, but solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will Biden not drop out and be able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If he does, the outcome is yes. Otherwise, the outcome is no.

para_P.title: With Glenn Youngkin as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, is it possible that Biden will withdraw prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Glenn Youngkin is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This nomination is independent of who is chosen on election day, relying solely on the decision made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

In that case, will Biden withdraw or be unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20? If this occurs, the answer is yes. If not, the answer is no.

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee and Biden drops out before July 20, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, meaning he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and (b) Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. Given these conditions, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

not_P.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee and Biden drops out before July 20, will the Venezuelan electoral commission not publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, meaning he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and (b) Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. Given these conditions, will the Venezuelan electoral commission not publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), no entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: If Glenn Youngkin is the Republican candidate and Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, will the Venezuelan electoral authority release complete results of the presidential election on July 28 before August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) Glenn Youngkin has been chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention, and (b) Biden exits the competition before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024. Under these circumstances, will the Venezuelan electoral authority disclose the complete results of the presidential election on July 28, 2024, before August 12, 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This is considered a Yes if reliable sources indicate that, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any Venezuelan government entity has published results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to represent all votes cast, broken down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden drops out before July 20, and (c) the Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: (a) Glenn Youngkin will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 election. (b) Biden will be considered to have dropped out if he is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (c) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Glenn Youngkin is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden does not drop out before July 20, or (c) the Venezuelan electoral commission does not publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) Glenn Youngkin will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 election. (b) Biden will be considered to have not dropped out if he is able to continue the race after July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (c) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), no entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) Glenn Youngkin becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, and (c) the Venezuelan electoral authority releases complete results of the July 28 presidential election prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Glenn Youngkin will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election if the Republican National Convention delegates select him as their candidate. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who is declared the nominee on election day in 2024. (b) Biden will be deemed to have withdrawn if he is unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. (c) This question will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that, before 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any Venezuelan governmental body has released election results for the July 28, 2024 election that claim to represent 100% of the votes cast, broken down by parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

This market resolves YES if fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.body:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination, which they believe suppresses the ongoing critical discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in this initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are profoundly concerned about the direction of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to suppress debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will conclude YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Several such letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will conclude NO.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

para_P.title: If at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early, will there be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A group of House Democrats is working on a strategy to express their dissent against their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, as indicated by a member involved in this movement.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) has been circulated and was acquired by POLITICO, marking the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are profoundly concerned about the direction of Biden’s candidacy.

Huffman remarked in an interview, “This is a very poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks this is a smart approach to end debate and, through sheer force, create unity, but that’s not how it functions.” He opted not to verify the letter's existence.

This market will conclude YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.
