question.title: Given at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and a brokered convention occurs, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls happen between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. 

1. At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

2. Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. This resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Then, given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? 

This resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, one of the following occurs:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, then this resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Given at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and a brokered convention occurs, will no diplomatic expulsions or recalls happen between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. 

1. At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

2. Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. This resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Then, given these conditions, will no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? 

This resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, none of the following occurs:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any of these events occur before that date, then this resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate express their opposition to Biden's early nomination through a signed letter and a brokered convention takes place, will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s assume the following holds true: A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate have signed a public letter opposing the plan to nominate Biden early, and there is a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024. 

1. A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate must sign a public letter against the early nomination of Biden. This will be considered YES if at least 20 members of the House or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party sign the letter before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. 

2. There must be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024. This will be considered YES if the Democratic Party requires multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. 

Given these stipulations, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? 

This will be considered YES if any of the following occurs prior to August 1, 2024:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these actions take place before that date, then this will be considered NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, and (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?

- This resolves to YES if both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This requires a letter (or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures) signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

2. Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

- This resolves as YES if before August 1, 2024, any of the following happen according to official statements or credible reports: (a) The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the PRC. (b) The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. (c) The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. (d) The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

This combined question resolves to YES if both of these conditions are met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, nor (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
1. Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?

- This resolves to YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This requires a letter (or multiple letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 signatures) signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. (b) The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

2. Will no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

- This resolves as YES if before August 1, 2024, none of the following happen according to official statements or credible reports: (a) The Philippines expels any diplomat representing the PRC. (b) The Philippines recalls any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. (c) The PRC expels any diplomat representing the Philippines. (d) The PRC recalls any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

This combined question resolves to YES if at least one of these conditions is not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events will happen: (1) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will publicly oppose Biden's early nomination by signing a letter, and there will be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024, and (2) There will be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
1. Is it true that at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will publicly sign a letter against the early virtual nomination of Biden, and will the Democratic Party hold a brokered convention in 2024?

- This will be considered YES if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) A public letter (or multiple letters totaling at least 20 signatures) opposing the early virtual nomination of Biden is signed by no fewer than 20 Democrats from the House or Senate before the end of Sunday, July 21st. (b) The Democratic Party needs to have more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 presidential election in the United States.

2. Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before the date of August 1, 2024?

- This will be considered YES if any of the following occurs before August 1, 2024, based on official statements or credible reports: (a) The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China. (b) The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the People's Republic of China. (c) The People's Republic of China expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines. (d) The People's Republic of China recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

This overall question will be answered with YES if both of these conditions are fulfilled.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Donald Trump must testify at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. This can be either in person or remotely, and must be reported by credible sources.

2. **Outcome**: Linda Yaccarino must be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024. This will be confirmed by official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

The question resolves as YES if both conditions are met as described. If Donald Trump does not testify, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump does not testify at the hush money trial, will Linda Yaccarino not be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Donald Trump must not testify at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. This can be either in person or remotely, and must be reported by credible sources.

2. **Outcome**: Linda Yaccarino must not be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024. This will be confirmed by official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

The question resolves as YES if both conditions are met as described. If Donald Trump testifies, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will Linda Yaccarino hold the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry consists of two prerequisites:

1. **Prerequisite**: Donald Trump must give testimony at the trial related to the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. This testimony can occur either in person or virtually and must be reported by reliable sources.

2. **Result**: Linda Yaccarino needs to be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024. This status will be verified through official announcements from Twitter or trustworthy media outlets.

The question will be answered with YES if both prerequisites are fulfilled as specified. If Donald Trump fails to testify, the question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if such a public letter is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 signatures would also suffice. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on either Donald Trump not testifying at the hush money trial or Linda Yaccarino not being CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

Given these conditions, will fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if such a public letter is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 signatures would also suffice. If these criteria are met by market close, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Under the assumption that both Donald Trump has provided testimony at the hush money trial and Linda Yaccarino holds the position of CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will there be at least 20 Democrats in the House or Senate who will publicly oppose the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions are met: 

1. Trustworthy sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter as of July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or reliable news outlets.

With these factors in mind, will a minimum of 20 Democratic House Members or Senators publicly sign a letter against the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden prematurely? 

The outcome will be determined as YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators sign such a public letter before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. A collection of letters totaling 20 signatures would also be acceptable. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, (2) Linda Yaccarino is CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (3) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (3) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, (2) Linda Yaccarino is CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (3) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if not all of the following conditions are met: (1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) Linda Yaccarino is not in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (3) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (1) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, (2) Linda Yaccarino holds the position of CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (3) at least 20 Democrats from the House/Senate endorse a public letter against the plan for virtually nominating Biden early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a **Yes** if each of the following stipulations is satisfied: (1) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. (2) Linda Yaccarino is confirmed as the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or trustworthy news outlets. (3) A public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators prior to the market's closure at the end of Sunday, July 21st. The existence of multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice to resolve this market in the affirmative.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve with a **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Poland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta qualify for the Grand Final as well?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Malta does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Poland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta not qualify?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Malta qualifies, the outcome resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Poland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also make it?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Poland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Malta also advance to the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Poland must compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Malta must compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Grand Final. If Malta does not advance, the outcome resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given that both Poland and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ukraine also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both Poland and Malta participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ukraine participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if Ukraine qualifies, and as **No** if Ukraine does not qualify.

not_P.title: Given that both Poland and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ukraine not qualify?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Both Poland and Malta participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ukraine participate in a Semi-final and not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if Ukraine does not qualify, and as **No** if Ukraine qualifies.

para_P.title: If both Poland and Malta make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, does that mean Ukraine will also make it?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Poland and Malta compete in their respective Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have reached the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In this case, will Ukraine compete in a Semi-final and be confirmed by the EBU as having reached the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024? The outcome is **Yes** if Ukraine qualifies, and **No** if Ukraine does not qualify.

question.title: Will Poland, Malta, and Ukraine all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all three countries, Poland, Malta, and Ukraine, participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland, Malta, and Ukraine not all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the three countries, Poland, Malta, or Ukraine, does not participate in their respective Semi-finals or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If all three countries qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Poland, Malta, and Ukraine set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Poland, Malta, and Ukraine all take part in their Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having earned a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Should any of these nations fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will be considered a Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both categories. It will be a No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than gold.

question.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If the United States secures gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Criteria for condition resolution: Resolves Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team finishes in any position other than gold.

Criteria for outcome resolution: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the condition is not fulfilled, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on the US winning gold in both basketball events and Biden not seeking the nomination, will Sha'Carri Richardson win gold at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur:

1. Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means that the United States must win the gold medal in both the men's and women's basketball competitions.

2. question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on both Joe Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024 and Mike Pence being the Republican nominee, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for (1): Joe Biden needs to appear in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

Resolution criteria for (2): Mike Pence must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

Then, will the ID political group secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be answered with **No** for any other political groups. In the case of a tie in the number of seats between two groups, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**. The resolution will be based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reputable media sources.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will no swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The question is answered with **Yes** if the competitor who achieves the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming competitions.

question.title: Conditional on a swimmer winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Resolves No otherwise. If confirmed before the end of the Games, resolves Yes immediately.

not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Resolves No otherwise. If confirmed before the end of the Games, resolves Yes immediately.

para_P.title: If a swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statement holds true: The competitor with the greatest quantity of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. Will the total gold medals won by Individual Neutral Athletes at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games reach 21 or more? 

Criteria for the condition to be met: Resolves to Yes if the competitor with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics is a swimmer.

Criteria for the outcome: Resolves to Yes if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively secure 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as per the official medal count from the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources. Resolves to No in all other cases. If verified before the conclusion of the Games, resolves to Yes immediately.

question.title: Given both a swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
(a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals. This means the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

Under these conditions, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics? 
The question resolves as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

not_P.title: Given both a swimmer does not win the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes do not win 21 or more gold medals, will Russian athletes not be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following are true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
(a) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals. This means the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively do not win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have not won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "No".

Under these conditions, will Russian athletes not be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics? 
The question resolves as **No** if Russian athletes are not barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded with Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **No**, more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If 34 or fewer Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.title: If a swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals, will Russian competitors be excluded from the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true at the Paris 2024 Olympics:
(a) A swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals. This indicates that the athlete with the greatest tally of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

Given these circumstances, will Russian competitors be excluded from participating in the 2024 Olympics? 
The question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian competitors are excluded from the 2024 Olympics under any of the following conditions: (i) representing the Russian flag, (ii) under the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This determination will rely on the official list of nations and athletes participating in the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have concluded without Russian involvement. For a **Yes** resolution, no more than 34 Russian athletes may be participating in the 2024 Olympics. The figure 34 was selected as it represents 10% of the [Russian athletes that competed in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to accommodate a few individual or sport-specific exemptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes are present at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

Should the 2024 Olympics be cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will resolve as ambiguous.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing?
question.body:
(a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events, and Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(b) Russian athletes are barred from competing: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

For the question to resolve as **No**, more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.body:

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they believe Biden's chances for a November victory are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters in circulation among House Democrats, and at least one is expected to request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals acquainted with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborates to ask Joe Biden to consider withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as a signed letter like the one mentioned above, or through another means such as a group meeting with Biden and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw does not fulfill the criteria for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to step down will not meet the market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In any unclear instances where such names are reported but not verified beyond reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, did someone intentionally shoot at him on July 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, did someone intentionally shoot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th?

Resolution criteria for Donald Trump testifying: This resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the shooting incident: Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, did someone not intentionally shoot at him on July 13th?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, did someone not intentionally shoot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th?

Resolution criteria for Donald Trump testifying: This resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the shooting incident: Resolves YES if no one intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th.

para_P.title: In light of Donald Trump's testimony at the hush money trial, was there an intentional shooting at him on July 13th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Therefore, was there an intentional act of shooting a bullet or similar projectile directed at Trump on July 13th?

Criteria for determining Donald Trump's testimony: This will be marked as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial.

Criteria for the shooting event: This will be marked as YES if someone aimed and shot a bullet or similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It will be marked as NO if the incident was due to an accidental discharge or ricochet that resulted in something being shot towards Trump.

question.title: Conditional on Trump testifying at the hush money trial and being intentionally shot at on July 13th, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) Someone intentionally shoots a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Donald Trump on July 13th, as per the New York Times report: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear." The resolution will be NO if the shooting incident was due to accidental discharge or ricochet.

Then, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
