not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Credible sources report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) No one intentionally shoots a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Donald Trump on July 13th, as per the New York Times report: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear." The resolution will be YES if the shooting incident was due to accidental discharge or ricochet.

Then, will Ron DeSantis not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **No** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Given that Trump is testifying at the hush money trial and is intentionally shot at on July 13th, will Ron DeSantis become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following facts are accurate: (1) Trustworthy sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (2) An individual deliberately fires a bullet or a projectile resembling a bullet at Donald Trump on July 13th, as reported by the New York Times: "It sounded like what could be gunshots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly removed from the stage and seemed to be bleeding from his ear." The outcome will be NO if the shooting incident resulted from an accidental discharge or ricochet.

Then, will Ron DeSantis be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will yield a **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to those candidates who are currently listed; additional options may be considered in the future. For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. It is only determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and is intentionally shot at on July 13th, AND (2) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur:

(1) Donald Trump testifies, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, AND someone intentionally shoots a bullet or bullet-like projectile at him on July 13th, as per credible sources. The shooting must not be due to accidental discharge or ricochet.

(2) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and is intentionally shot at on July 13th, NOR (2) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if NEITHER of the following occur:

(1) Donald Trump testifies, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, NOR someone intentionally shoots a bullet or bullet-like projectile at him on July 13th, as per credible sources. The shooting must not be due to accidental discharge or ricochet.

(2) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial and is deliberately shot at on July 13th, AND (2) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met:

(1) Donald Trump offers testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, AND an individual intentionally fires a bullet or similar projectile at him on July 13th, according to reliable sources. The shooting must not result from an accidental discharge or ricochet.

(2) Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will fewer than 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are there going to be 5 or more nations that secure their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their first Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Given at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?

There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

not_P.title: Given at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will Trump not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?

There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: If a minimum of 5 nations secure their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will Trump experience a rise of at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: At least 5 nations achieve their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, as reported by reliable sources.

Then, can we conclude that Donald Trump will see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants when up against Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat?

There are two Manifold polls available, both closing on July 6. One poll inquires about Manifold participants voting for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks participants to vote for a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. Otherwise, the result is NO.

question.title: Conditional on both at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games and Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (b) Donald Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. 

(a) This condition resolves as YES if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

(b) The condition involving Manifold polls resolves as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close.

Given these conditions, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an attack that injures or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 and the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024? The event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Conditional on both fewer than 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games or Trump gaining less than 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden, will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, or (b) Donald Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. 

(a) This condition resolves as YES if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

(b) The condition involving Manifold polls resolves as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a poll with Joe Biden does not exceed that in a poll with a generic Democrat by less than 3% when both polls close.

Given these conditions, will no terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an attack that injures or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 and the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024? The event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Given the scenario where at least 5 nations secure their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games and Trump receives a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants when competing against Joe Biden, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) A minimum of 5 nations achieve their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (b) Donald Trump garners at least 3% support among Manifold participants when matched against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. 

(a) This condition will be confirmed as YES if 5 or more nations win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, as per reliable sources.

(b) The condition regarding Manifold polling will be confirmed as YES if Trump's percentage of votes in a poll against Joe Biden surpasses that in a poll against a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

With these stipulations, will a terrorist incident occur in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an event that injures or kills at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 and the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024? The occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (c) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second Manifold poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.

(c) A terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as No if any of the above conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (c) A terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if not all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll does not exceed that in the second Manifold poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.

(c) No terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is not described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as Yes if any of the above conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (a) A minimum of 5 nations achieve their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, (b) When up against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, Trump secures at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents, and (c) A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if all of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) At least 5 countries earn their inaugural Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) The proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold survey surpasses that in the subsequent Manifold survey by 3% or more when both surveys conclude. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The response is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03.

(c) A terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will be answered with No if any of the aforementioned conditions are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, as checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU?

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, will the EU not announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU?

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but no more than 3 on July 15, 2024, will the EU declare new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has an advantage over Joe Biden that is more than 2 and at most 3, as per 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election.

The criteria for determining this condition: This is derived from the value shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, which was accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

Then, is it accurate to say: Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding new tariffs or duties affecting the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU?

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The market resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

The interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

not_P.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will Biden not have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Then, will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The market resolves YES if Biden does not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

The interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is recorded between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and the EU declares new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, will Biden conduct an in-person interview lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump leads Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election by a margin that is greater than 2 but less than or equal to 3, as indicated by the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. (b) Reliable sources indicate that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the implementation of new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Under these circumstances, will Joe Biden participate in an in-person interview on camera for a duration of 45 minutes or more before July 31, 2024? 

The outcome will be determined based on the following criteria: The market will resolve to YES if Biden is featured in an in-person interview that lasts for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. If no qualifying interview is released before the market closes at the end of July, the market will resolve to NO. 

Note that the interview does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town hall meetings, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs such as 60 Minutes. To qualify, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be counted. A 50-minute video may only contain 20 minutes of Biden's interview, which would not qualify.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. (c) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, not including press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) the European Union announce no new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or is greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that no new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. (c) Joe Biden does not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, not including press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

para_P.title: Will all of the following happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) the European Union unveil new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview/conversation on camera for over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if all of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this analysis, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. (b) Reliable sources report that prior to July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has declared that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. (c) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. This can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for P: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time, for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for P: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time, for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The lead must be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If Biden exits the race before July 20, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but remain at 4 or lower on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Joe Biden exits or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Criteria for P resolution: Biden must exit or be unable to continue the campaign before July 20, midnight Eastern Time, for this to be valid.

Criteria for Q resolution: This inquiry is resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump advantage. The advantage must exceed 2 but remain at 4 or lower for a YES resolution.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and Trump's lead is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Given this, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and Trump's lead is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Given this, will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and Trump's advantage is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) Biden exits or is otherwise unable to pursue the campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is more than 2 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average as shown in the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in front.

In this context, will Israel carry out a fatal assault within Iran before May 1, 2024? This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the publication of this question and prior to May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an attack linked to Israel and occurring within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average; (2) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, AND Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(2) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024, or Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average; (2) Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, OR Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(2) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has not led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will happen: (1) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average; (2) Israel executes a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Biden either steps down or is otherwise unable to proceed in the election before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024, AND Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.
(2) After the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack linked to Israel has taken place within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.
