question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

not_P.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council not include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name going to be part of the list of sanctioned candidates for the presidency by Iran's Guardian Council?
para_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council's roster of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election in Iran.

question.title: Conditional on Iran's Guardian Council including Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate, will 5 Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario: Suppose Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. Given this situation, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the condition to be true, Ahmadinejad must be included in the Guardian Council's list of candidates.

For the outcome to resolve YES, at least five named Democratic lawmakers must collectively and publicly urge Biden to drop out before July 20th, either through a signed letter or another form of group communication. If these criteria are not met, the outcome resolves NO.

not_P.title: Conditional on Iran's Guardian Council including Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate, will 5 Dem lawmakers not pressure Biden to drop out?
not_P.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario: Suppose Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. Given this situation, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the condition to be true, Ahmadinejad must be included in the Guardian Council's list of candidates.

For the outcome to resolve YES, at least five named Democratic lawmakers must not collectively and publicly urge Biden to drop out before July 20th, either through a signed letter or another form of group communication. If these criteria are not met, the outcome resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Iran's Guardian Council lists Ahmadinejad as a contender for president, will five Democratic lawmakers push Biden to withdraw?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the hypothetical situation: Imagine Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is added to the Guardian Council's roster of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election in Iran. In light of this scenario, will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic members of the US House or US Senate collaborate to request that Joe Biden contemplate stepping aside from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the condition to hold true, Ahmadinejad needs to be part of the Guardian Council's candidate list.

For the answer to be YES, a minimum of five specified Democratic lawmakers must jointly and publicly call on Biden to withdraw before July 20th, whether through a signed letter or some other collective communication method. If these stipulations are not fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Given both Ahmadinejad's candidacy approval and Democratic pressure on Biden, will Iran initiate military action on Israel by August 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message.

Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Given both Ahmadinejad's candidacy approval and Democratic pressure on Biden, will Iran not initiate military action on Israel by August 13th?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message.

Then, will Iran not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "No") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Considering the approval of Ahmadinejad's candidacy and the Democratic pressure on Biden, is it possible that Iran will commence military operations against Israel by August 13th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following circumstances are satisfied:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed as a qualified presidential candidate by Iran's Guardian Council for the forthcoming election.

2. A coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through a signed letter or by a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting his withdrawal. All five members must participate in the same group communication.

Then, is Iran expected to launch military action on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET?

For this market, "military action" refers to any force used by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, this market will conclude with a "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian soil, will be counted for this market's outcome. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy forces (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in this market's resolution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Iran's Guardian Council will include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran, (2) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (3) Iran will initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

3. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Iran's Guardian Council will include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran, (2) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, or (3) Iran will not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

3. Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will take place: (1) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name will be added to the list of candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidency, (2) a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th, and (3) Iran will commence a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if all of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the qualified presidential candidates by Iran's Guardian Council for the upcoming election.

2. A coalition consisting of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senate collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or other means, such as a collective meeting with Biden where they ask him to withdraw. All five individuals must participate in the same group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is inadequate for a YES outcome. Reports involving any number of unnamed Democrats soliciting Biden to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closure. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will tend to resolve to NO. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

3. Iran initiates a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military operation" will be defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot on Israeli land, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not contribute to the resolution of this market. Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will count towards the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (e.g., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will a terrorist act not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it possible that a terrorist incident will take place in metropolitan France during the Summer Olympics of 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the inquiry will be answered with No if this scenario does not occur.

An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise.

not_P.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: If a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Vivek Ramaswamy be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: A terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, resulting in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is classified as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

In light of this, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer is Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No in all other cases.

question.title: If both a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an attack that injures or kills at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France or by French government officials. (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Given both of these conditions are true, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: If either a terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics or Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body:
Consider the following conditions: (a) A terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an attack that does not injure or kill at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and is not described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France or by French government officials. (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Given either of these conditions is false, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, or for any other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service after October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Should both a terrorist incident take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the head of the Secret Service step down within the following 90 days?
para_P.body:
Take into account these conditions: (a) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, characterized as an attack that causes injury or death to at least one individual other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and is labeled as a 'terrorist attack' by any French State agency or officials. (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Assuming both of these conditions hold true, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be dismissed, or for any other reason cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about Vivek Ramaswamy will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(c) The question about the head of the Secret Service will resolve as Yes if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer is the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about Vivek Ramaswamy will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(c) The question about the head of the Secret Service will resolve as Yes if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer is the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that all of the following will happen: (a) a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) the head of the Secret Service steps down within the next 90 days?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding a terrorist incident will be deemed Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be marked as No if this does not occur. An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official entity of the State of France or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The inquiry concerning Vivek Ramaswamy will be marked as **Yes** if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later. For this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(c) The inquiry about the head of the Secret Service will be marked as Yes if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason ceases to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If not, it will be marked as No.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks regarding potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body:
The question about Donald Trump resolves **Yes** if he is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the indictments occurring before June 1, 2024.

The question about Joe Biden resolves yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

Given the condition about Donald Trump is met, will Joe Biden still be president by the specified time?

not_P.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body:
The question about Donald Trump resolves **Yes** if he is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the indictments occurring before June 1, 2024.

The question about Joe Biden resolves yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

Given the condition about Donald Trump is met, will Joe Biden not be president by the specified time?

para_P.title: Assuming that Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden remain in the presidency until the end of July?
para_P.body:
The inquiry regarding Donald Trump will be answered **Yes** if he is charged or indicted concerning any remarks linked to possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with such indictments taking place before June 1, 2024.

The inquiry regarding Joe Biden will be answered yes if, at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

Given that the condition concerning Donald Trump is satisfied, will Joe Biden still hold the presidency by the specified deadline?

question.title: Given Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, will Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
(a) Suppose Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*, with indictments occurring before June 1, 2024. (b) Suppose Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Given these conditions, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024? Resolves YES if such an announcement occurs, otherwise resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, will Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
(a) Suppose Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*, with indictments occurring before June 1, 2024. (b) Suppose Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Given these conditions, will there be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024? Resolves YES if such an announcement does not occur, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, and Biden remains in office until the conclusion of July 2024, will Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
(a) Assume that Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to possible witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*, with such charges happening before June 1, 2024. (b) Assume Joe Biden is still the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26, 2024? Resolves YES if such a declaration is made, otherwise resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, and (c) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. 

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

(c) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, or (c) Joe Biden does not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)* before June 1, 2024. 

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States. 

(c) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) Donald Trump faces witness tampering charges in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden remains president by July 31, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden passes away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
(a) The outcome will be **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks pertaining to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024. 

(b) This market will confirm yes if, at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

(c) Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Given the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, will a Trump family member be the Republican nominee in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. This means the market must have 377 traders before it closes.

Then, is it true that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? This resolves **Yes** if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

If none of these individuals is the nominee, it resolves **No**.

question.title: Given the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15 and a Trump family member is the 2024 Republican nominee, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" gross over $20 million in its opening weekend?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions:
1. The linked market reaches at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. The market is embedded here: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g. This resolves YES if true, NO otherwise.
2. A member of the Trump family becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This resolves YES if one of the following individuals is the nominee: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Given both of these conditions are met, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) gross more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend? The "Domestic Opening" number will be taken from BoxOfficeMojo, typically the 3-day FSS weekend plus previews, similar to the $16,854,735 opening for "Old."

question.title: Will the International Seabed Authority Secretary-General Michael Lodge be re-elected for a third term in the July elections?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise it will resolve **No**.

not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has not been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise it will resolve **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Michael Lodge will secure a third term as Secretary-General of the International Seabed Authority in the elections this July?
para_P.body: The outcome will be **Yes** if either the International Seabed Authority (ISA) or [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) announce that the current Secretary-General, Michael Lodge, has been re-elected for a third term during the elections in July. If not, it will be **No**.

question.title: If Michael Lodge is re-elected as ISA Secretary-General in July, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections.
2. The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A. If the first condition is met but the second condition is not, the question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: If Michael Lodge is re-elected as ISA Secretary-General in July, will South Africa not elect a president before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has not been elected for a third term in the July elections.
2. The South African National Assembly does not officially elect a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A. If the first condition is met but the second condition is not, the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Should Michael Lodge secure a third term as ISA Secretary-General in July, will South Africa choose a president prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:
1. The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or reliable sources indicate that the current Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been re-elected for a third term in the elections held in July.
2. The South African National Assembly formally selects a president before July 1, 2024, based on information from trustworthy sources.

If the first criterion is not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as N/A. If the first criterion is satisfied but the second is not, the inquiry resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals, will ISS advise against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Then, will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: The Indiana Pacers must win the 2024 NBA Finals.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if ISS advises against either Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.body:

Then, will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against neither Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting nor the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors?

- Outcome: Resolves YES if ISS does not advise against either Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO otherwise.

- Condition: The Indiana Pacers must be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if ISS recommends against either Elon Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given both the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals and ISS advises against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will Donald Trump be blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true:

1. The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

2. Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

Then, is it true that, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "Yes" if Trump has been removed or blocked as specified, and "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Given both the Indiana Pacers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals and ISS advises in favor of Elon Musk's pay package and Kimbal Musk's re-election, will Donald Trump not be blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true:

1. The Indiana Pacers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

2. Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *in favor of* Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

Then, is it true that, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "Yes" if Trump has not been removed or blocked as specified, and "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Assuming the Indiana Pacers secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals and ISS recommends opposing Elon Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's board re-election, will Donald Trump face exclusion from a primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Imagine the following holds true:

1. The Indiana Pacers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

2. Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion remuneration at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate that, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The exclusion or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will be considered "Yes" if Trump has been barred or excluded as outlined, and "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as **No**.

Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

If all of these conditions are met, the question resolves as **No**.

Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not be sufficient for resolution. The question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur *after* the specified date. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, such that he is not removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (c) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if any one or more of the following conditions are not met: (1) The Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (3) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

It resolves as **No** if all of the following conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) the Boston Celtics will be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) Linda Yaccarino will hold the position of CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (c) Tim Scott will be the chosen Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in **Yes** if all of these criteria are fulfilled: (1) The Boston Celtics are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as reported by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Linda Yaccarino occupies the role of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official Twitter announcements or reliable news outlets. (3) Tim Scott is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

It will be marked as **No** if any of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Drake vs Kendrick Lamar: will either artist release another diss track in May?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

not_P.title: Drake vs Kendrick Lamar: will neither artist release another diss track in May?
not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if neither Drake nor Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Drake and Kendrick Lamar: is there a possibility that one of them will drop a new diss track in May?
para_P.body: The answer will be **Yes** if either of the two artists puts out a new diss track aimed at the other between May 9, 2024, and June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Drake or Kendrick Lamar releasing a diss track in May, will Disney announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. Then, will Disney announce a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024?

Resolution criteria:
1. The condition is met if either artist releases a diss track aimed at the other after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024.
2. The outcome resolves YES if Disney announces a new night time parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024. It resolves NO if no such announcement is made, or if they announce an existing parade is moving to Florida. The question will close August 8, 2024, or sooner if an announcement is made before the convention.

not_P.title: Conditional on Drake or Kendrick Lamar not releasing a diss track in May, will Disney not announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Neither Drake nor Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. Then, will Disney not announce a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024?

Resolution criteria:
1. The condition is met if neither artist releases a diss track aimed at the other after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024.
2. The outcome resolves YES if Disney does not announce a new night time parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024. It resolves NO if such an announcement is made, or if they announce an existing parade is moving to Florida. The question will close August 8, 2024, or sooner if an announcement is made before the convention.

para_P.title: If either Drake or Kendrick Lamar puts out a diss track in May, will Disney reveal a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom by or during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
Imagine this scenario: Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar drops a diss track specifically targeting the other artist after May 9, 2024, but before June 1, 2024. In that case, will Disney disclose a new nighttime parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, by or during D23 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
1. The condition is satisfied if one of the artists releases a diss track directed at the other after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024.
2. The outcome is a YES if Disney announces a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom by or during D23 2024. It is a NO if no such announcement occurs, or if they state that an existing parade is relocating to Florida. This question will conclude on August 8, 2024, or earlier if an announcement is made prior to the convention.

question.title: Conditional on both a diss track between Drake and Kendrick Lamar and a new Disney night parade, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track intended for the other between May 10, 2024, and May 31, 2024, and (b) Disney announces a new night time parade for Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: For (a), a diss track must be released after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. For (b), Disney must announce a new night time parade at or before D23 2024, and it cannot be an existing parade moving to Florida.

Then, is it true that a terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: A terrorist attack must injure or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and be described as a 'terrorist attack' by an agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Conditional on both a diss track between Drake and Kendrick Lamar and a new Disney night parade, will a terrorist act not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track intended for the other between May 10, 2024, and May 31, 2024, and (b) Disney announces a new night time parade for Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: For (a), a diss track must be released after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. For (b), Disney must announce a new night time parade at or before D23 2024, and it cannot be an existing parade moving to Florida.

Then, is it true that a terrorist act will not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: A terrorist attack must not injure or kill any person, other than the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and must not be described as a 'terrorist attack' by an agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Given the occurrence of both a diss track from either Drake or Kendrick Lamar and the introduction of a new nighttime parade by Disney, is it possible that a terrorist incident will take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (a) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar puts out a diss track aimed at the other between May 10, 2024, and May 31, 2024, and (b) Disney reveals a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, on or before D23 2024. 

Criteria for assessing the condition: For (a), the diss track must be made public after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. For (b), Disney must announce a new nighttime parade at or before D23 2024, and it must not be an existing parade relocating to Florida.

Then, can it be affirmed that a terrorist incident will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: A terrorist attack must result in injury or death to at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and must be officially labeled as a 'terrorist attack' by a French state agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a diss track intended for the other in May 2024, (2) Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, and (3) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. 

(2) Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will resolve NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. The question will close on August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(3) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar does not release a diss track intended for the other in May 2024, (2) Disney does not announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, and (3) a terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
(1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar does not release another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. 

(2) Disney does not announce at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will resolve YES if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. The question will close on August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(3) The question will resolve as No if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France does not injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as Yes if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is not described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar puts out a diss track aimed at the other in May 2024, (2) Disney reveals a new nighttime parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, and (3) a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases a new diss track specifically targeting the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. 

(2) Disney discloses at or before D23 2024 a new nighttime parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida. It will resolve to NO if no new nighttime parade is revealed between now and the conclusion of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade like the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is relocating to Florida. The question will conclude on August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is disclosed prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(3) The question will resolve to Yes if a terrorist act in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) harms and/or kills at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between, and including, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve to No if the aforementioned does not occur.

An incident will be deemed a 'terrorist act' if it is characterized as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia surpass Apple in market capitalization on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap exceeding Apple's on July 17, 2024, will OpenAI commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap not exceeding Apple's on July 17, 2024, will OpenAI not commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is true:

- OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has not accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will OpenAI agree to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will OpenAI make a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI publicly affirms its commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must reflect a new level of commitment to the principle compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact select signatories or endorsers to gauge their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the condition is not fulfilled, the resolution will be N/A.

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap surpasses Apple's on July 17, 2024, and OpenAI commits to the no retaliation principle by July 1, 2024, will 5+ countries win debut gold at 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, with a statement indicating a new level of commitment relative to the righttowarn.ai statement, and this commitment is verified to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai by Metaculus.

Given these conditions, will at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources?

not_P.title: Given Nvidia's market cap does not surpass Apple's on July 17, 2024, or OpenAI does not commit to the no retaliation principle by July 1, 2024, will fewer than 5 countries win debut gold at 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, with a statement indicating a new level of commitment relative to the righttowarn.ai statement, and this commitment is not verified to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai by Metaculus.

Given these conditions, will fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources?

para_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple on July 17, 2024, and OpenAI adheres to the no retaliation principle by July 1, 2024, will 5 or more nations secure their initial gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following premises hold true: 

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is confirmed to be greater than Apple's, as reported by Companies Market Cap around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. By July 1, 2024, OpenAI makes a public declaration committing to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure," accompanied by a statement that reflects a heightened commitment compared to the righttowarn.ai statement, and this declaration is validated to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai by Metaculus.

Under these circumstances, will a minimum of 5 countries achieve their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, as per reliable sources?

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization will be larger than Apple's, (2) OpenAI will publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, or (3) At the 2024 Olympics, fewer than 5 countries will win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met:

2. Before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is not true:

para_P.body:
