question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 elections for the European Parliament?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the ID party secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament. It will be answered with **No** for any other party. In the event that two parties have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

question.title: Given the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Armenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be determined based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Then, will Armenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This will resolve as **Yes** if Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Armenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: The ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be determined based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Then, will Armenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This will resolve as **Yes** if Armenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament Elections, will Armenia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as confirmed by official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable news sources. Will Armenia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This will be answered with **Yes** if Armenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Armenia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and Armenia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following are true: (1) The ID political group holds the most seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. (2) Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Given these conditions, will Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Slovenia qualifies, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

If either of the initial conditions (about the ID political group or Armenia) is not met, then this question does not apply and should be considered N/A.

not_P.title: Given the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections or Armenia does not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where at least one of the following is true: (1) The ID political group does not hold the most seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. (2) Armenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Given these conditions, will Slovenia not participate in a Semi-final or not be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Slovenia does not qualify, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

If both of the initial conditions (about the ID political group or Armenia) are met, then this question does not apply and should be considered N/A.

para_P.title: If the ID political party secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and Armenia makes it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia advance to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines a hypothetical situation where both of the following statements hold true: (1) The ID political party has the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to official European Parliament declarations or reliable media sources. (2) Armenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Under these circumstances, will Slovenia compete in a Semi-final and be officially recognized by the EBU as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? Should Slovenia qualify, the answer will be **Yes**; if not, the answer will be **No**.

If either of the preliminary conditions (regarding the ID political party or Armenia) is not satisfied, this question is not applicable and should be regarded as N/A.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and will both Armenia and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (2) Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (3) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, or will either Armenia or Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) The ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (2) Armenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (3) Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If all of these conditions are met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and will Armenia and Slovenia both advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if all the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This determination will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources. (2) Armenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (3) Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these criteria are not satisfied, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Given the Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024. This is determined by checking if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, is it true that at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, the men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s? This resolves as Yes if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

If this does not occur, the answer is No.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the United States government terminate its agreement that allows Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com top-level domain prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or cancels its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, (b) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD).

2. Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

3. The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

If any of the above conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) The US government does not end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, (b) Asa Hutchinson is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (c) the USA does not win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. After August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD).

2. Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not by who does not receive the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

3. The United States Olympic Team does not win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

If all of the above conditions are met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (a) The United States government terminates its agreement with Verisign regarding the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024, (b) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 presidential election, and (c) the USA achieves a greater number of Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if all of these criteria are fulfilled:

1. The US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially concludes or lets expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024, thereby acknowledging Verisign's stewardship of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD).

2. Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

3. The United States Olympic Team secures more Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

If any of these conditions are not satisfied, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve based on two conditions:

1. **Condition:** Tadej Pogačar is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. **Outcome of Interest:** There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

If the condition about Tadej Pogačar is not met, the question resolves N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?

2. **Outcome of Interest:** There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

If the condition about Tadej Pogačar is not met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Tadej Pogačar triumphs in the Tour de France 2024, will Trump achieve a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on two stipulations:

1. **Stipulation:** Tadej Pogačar is officially declared the victor of the Tour de France 2024, according to the official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. **Focus of Interest:** There are two Manifold surveys conducted, both of which close on July 6. One survey prompts Manifold respondents to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other invites respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will resolve with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first survey surpasses that in the second survey by 3% or more at the time both surveys close.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result of this calculation for the first survey minus the result for the second survey is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The surveys and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

If the stipulation regarding Tadej Pogačar is not fulfilled, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024 and Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Criterion for condition: Both (a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024 and (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024, (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (c) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(b) In two Manifold polls closing on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll facing Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll facing a generic Democrat by 3% or more. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the nomination on the election day itself.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the agreement permitting Verisign to oversee the authoritative registry for the .com TLD be terminated by the US government prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: Suppose the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, ending Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. Then, will a person representing the Republican Party win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson, in 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report a Republican win. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Given the US government does not end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: Suppose the US Department of Commerce does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, not ending Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. Then, will a person representing the Republican Party not win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson, in 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report a Republican loss. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: If the US government terminates its contract with Verisign for managing the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: Imagine the US Department of Commerce officially ends its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which would conclude Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024. In that case, will a candidate from the Republican Party secure victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was formerly represented by Bill Johnson, in 2024? This is considered a Yes if reliable sources indicate a Republican victory. If there are conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be void.

question.title: Given both the US ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and Republicans retain Ohio's 6th district, will 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), and (b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. If popular sources are in disagreement regarding the election, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as No.

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Given both the US does not end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD before August 3, 2024, or Republicans do not retain Ohio's 6th district, will fewer than 5 Dem House Members or Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), or (b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has not won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. If popular sources are in disagreement regarding the election, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is not annulled. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as Yes.

Then, will a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a NO resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats not writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: If the US terminates its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024, and Republicans keep control of Ohio's 6th district, will five Democratic House Members or Senators push Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: (a) The US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially dissolves its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024, and (b) Reliable sources indicate that a Republican representative has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. In cases where popular sources conflict on the election outcome, an official Ohio State source will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this inquiry is void. If both conditions are satisfied, will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could involve signing a letter similar to what has been mentioned, or it might take the form of a group meeting with Biden and collectively urging him to step aside. For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Merely having five individuals express their personal opinions to reporters about Biden stepping down will not suffice.

Any reports of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden requesting him to step down will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In uncertain situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, and (c) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), (b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. If popular sources are in disagreement regarding the election, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met, the question resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) The US government does not end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, (b) The Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, or (c) A group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators does not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body: This question resolves as Yes if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) After August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), (b) Credible sources do not report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. If popular sources are in disagreement regarding the election, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled, and (c) A group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators does not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter or another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively not asking him to drop out. Not all five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this criterion regardless of whether at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. If these criteria are met, the question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events happen: (a) The US government cancels its contract with Verisign for the .com top-level domain prior to August 3, 2024, (b) The Republican Party holds on to Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024, and (c) At least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with Yes if all these stipulations are fulfilled: (a) The US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or allows to lapse its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which oversees the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024, (b) Reliable sources indicate that a representative of the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. In cases of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or statement will take precedence. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question becomes void, and (c) A collective of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to urge Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 presidential campaign, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This can occur through a signed letter or a group meeting with Biden to collectively request his withdrawal. All five members must be part of the same communication. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden to request he step aside will not fulfill this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the deadline. If these conditions are not satisfied, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

not_P.title: Will Albania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The response will be **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

question.title: Conditional on Albania qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the pole vault outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Conditional on Albania qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault not be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault not be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the pole vault outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, no men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Assuming Albania secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will the men's pole vault Olympic record be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Under these conditions, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be exceeded at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Criteria for determining the pole vault outcome: This question will be answered as **Yes** if, during the 2024 Paris Olympics, any male pole vaulter successfully clears a height of 6.04m or more, based on results reported by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If no athlete achieves this, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the men's pole vault Olympic record is broken, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final as announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), and (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, the men's pole vault Olympic record is broken with a clearance of 6.04m or higher.

Then, will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if a single NOC wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves as **No** if eight different NOCs win each of these events.

not_P.title: Given Albania does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final or the men's pole vault Olympic record is not broken, will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) Albania does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final as announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), or (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, the men's pole vault Olympic record is not broken with a clearance of 6.04m or higher.

Then, will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if no single NOC wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves as **No** if eight different NOCs win each of these events.

para_P.title: If Albania reaches the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the men's pole vault Olympic record is surpassed, will that same country secure victories in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements hold true: (1) Albania is confirmed to participate in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final as per the announcement from the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), and (2) The men's pole vault Olympic record is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics with a height of 6.04m or greater.

Then, will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieve triumph in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will be considered **Yes** if a single NOC claims gold in at least two of these women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It will be considered **No** if eight distinct NOCs win each of these competitions.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, water polo. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur: (a) Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and the Olympic record for the men's pole vault not be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) The same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following conditions are not met: (1) Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, no men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) does not win gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, water polo. If any of these conditions are met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Albania to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and the Olympic record for the men's pole vault to be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) The same country to secure victories in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if all of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any athlete in the men's pole vault successfully clears a height of 6.04m or greater, as reported by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or reliable sources. (3) The identical National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, water polo. If any of these criteria are not satisfied, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that will conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in hypothetical scenarios is either leading or within the margin of error. Are the responses from Manifold participants reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will be marked YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This is determined by comparing two Manifold polls which close on July 6, where one poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll must exceed that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The condition is met if this formula for the Biden poll minus the formula for the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03.

Then, is the following true: France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves positively if France ranks in the top 5 in the medal table, calculated by the number of Gold Medals, Silver Medals (if Golds are tied), and Bronze Medals (if Silvers are tied). It resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This is determined by comparing two Manifold polls which close on July 6, where one poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll must exceed that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The condition is met if this formula for the Biden poll minus the formula for the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03.

Then, is the following true: France does not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves positively if France does not rank in the top 5 in the medal table, calculated by the number of Gold Medals, Silver Medals (if Golds are tied), and Bronze Medals (if Silvers are tied). It resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: If Trump secures a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold voters against Biden, will France achieve a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Trump receives at least 3% greater support among Manifold respondents when pitted against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat. This is assessed by comparing two Manifold polls closing on July 6, one featuring Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. The proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll must surpass that in the generic Democrat poll by at least 3%. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The condition is satisfied if the difference between the Biden poll formula and the generic Democrat poll formula is >= 0.03.

Then, is it accurate to state: France finishes in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This is confirmed positively if France is among the top 5 in the medal standings, determined by the count of Gold Medals, Silver Medals (in case of tied Golds), and Bronze Medals (in case of tied Silvers). It is considered unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Given both Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents over a generic Democrat and France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, will Venezuela publish full election results before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This means that the percentage of votes for Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they rank in the top five based on the medal table ordered by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals.

Then, is it true that the Venezuelan electoral commission will publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024? This means that credible sources report that any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results representing 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish, before August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM VET.

not_P.title: Given both Trump does not gain 3% among Manifold respondents over a generic Democrat and France does not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, will Venezuela not publish full election results before August 12, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This means that the percentage of votes for Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden does not exceed that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. (b) France does not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they do not rank in the top five based on the medal table ordered by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals.

Then, is it true that the Venezuelan electoral commission will not publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024? This means that credible sources report that no entity of the Venezuelan government has published results representing 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish, before August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM VET.

para_P.title: If Trump secures a 3% increase among Manifold participants compared to a generic Democrat and France finishes in the Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, will Venezuela release complete election results prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (a) Against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump receives at least a 3% boost among Manifold participants. This indicates that Trump's vote share in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden surpasses that with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. (b) France achieves a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they are among the top five based on the medal standings categorized by the count of gold, silver, and bronze medals.

Then, can we affirm that the Venezuelan electoral authority will disclose complete results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024? This implies that reliable sources indicate that any branch of the Venezuelan government has made public results that reflect 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level, before August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM VET.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents, (b) France will place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) The Venezuelan electoral commission will publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) This question will resolve positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

(c) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents, (b) France will place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) The Venezuelan electoral commission will not publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. This question will resolve NO if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is NO if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is YES.

(b) This question will resolve negatively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

(c) This question resolves as No if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), no entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Is it true that the following events will all take place: (a) Trump will receive at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, (b) France will finish in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) The Venezuelan electoral authority will release complete results of the presidential election held on July 28 before August 12, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Two polls from Manifold will close on July 6. One poll presents a hypothetical ballot featuring Joe Biden, while the other includes a generic Democrat. This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is 3% or greater than in the second poll at the time both polls conclude. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the first poll's formula and the second poll's formula is 0.03 or more. If not, the answer is NO.

(b) This inquiry will confirm positively if France ranks in the top 5 (ties count as positive) during the 2024 Olympics. The medal standings are determined by the total medals won by each country, ranked by: 1. Total Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie) Total Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie) Total Bronze Medals. If the Olympics do not occur in 2024, the outcome will be uncertain.

(c) This question will be answered as Yes if reliable sources indicate that, prior to Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any Venezuelan government body has published results from the July 28, 2024 election claiming to reflect 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator not say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators does not utter the word "deepfake." If this does happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has not uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the term "deepfake" be mentioned by Trump, Biden, or a moderator during the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the word "deepfake" is spoken by Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or any of the moderators during the CNN presidential debate set for June 27, 2024. If the word is not mentioned, the outcome will be **No**.

The determination of whether the term "deepfake" has been spoken by one of the candidates or moderators lies solely with the Admins of Metaculus. They will have the exclusive authority to decide on this matter, and their decision will be conclusive. In cases where there is uncertainty, they may refer to CNN's official transcript, usually available at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It is crucial to understand that without a clear instance of the word being spoken, particularly if it is absent from the transcript, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If "deepfake" is said in the CNN debate, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has occurred will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will testify at the hush money trial? This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: If "deepfake" is said in the CNN debate, will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has occurred will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will not testify at the hush money trial? This question will resolve as **Yes** if there are no credible sources reporting that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial if the term "deepfake" is mentioned during the CNN debate?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: During the airing of the presidential debate organized by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the debate moderators mentions the term "deepfake." The verification of this event will be solely determined by the Admins of Metaculus, who may refer to CNN's official transcript for confirmation.

Then, can we conclude that Donald Trump will appear as a witness at the hush money trial? This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given both a "deepfake" mention in the June 27 CNN debate and Trump's testimony at the hush money trial, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators mentions the word "deepfake." This is determined by Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.
2. Credible sources report that Donald Trump testifies, either in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Given these conditions are met, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

Suppose the following is true: 
1. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators mentions the word "deepfake." This is determined by Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.

Assume the following conditions hold:
