If these stipulations are satisfied, will the United States Olympic Team be the sole highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The ranking is based on the total number of Gold Medals won, with any ties being resolved by counting Silver Medals first, and then Bronze Medals. If the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027, the question will remain unresolved.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Both of the following: (a) Trump, Biden, or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial; AND (2) USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Both of the following conditions are met:
   a. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has happened will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript. If the word is not clearly uttered, the condition is not met.
   b. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

If all conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any condition is not met, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) Both of the following: (a) Trump, Biden, or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial; AND (2) USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if not all of the following conditions are met:

1. Both of the following conditions are not met:
   a. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators does not utter the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has happened will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript. If the word is not clearly uttered, the condition is met.
   b. Credible sources do not report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. The United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve positively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

If not all conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If all conditions are met, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (1) Both of these conditions: (a) During the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, either Trump, Biden, or a moderator mentions the term "deepfake," and (b) Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial; AND (2) the USA will lead the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if all of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Both of these criteria must be fulfilled:
   a. In the airing of the presidential debate organized by CNN on June 27, 2024, the word "deepfake" is spoken by Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators. The determination of whether this has occurred will be solely at the discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may refer to CNN's official transcript. If the word is not clearly articulated, this condition will not be satisfied.
   b. Reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or virtually, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) highest ranked team in the Olympic medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027, the question will have an ambiguous resolution. It will be answered negatively if any other team matches or exceeds the ranking of the US team.

If all criteria are satisfied, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any criterion is unmet, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Israel does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Israel not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Israel does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Israel qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Israel going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Israel takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Israel does not make it, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Israel qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Conditional on Israel qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be 3 points or less or 4 points or more on July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be 3 points or less or 4 points or more on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: If Israel secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden of between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Israel competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Then, will the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election show Donald Trump ahead of Joe Biden by more than 3 points and no more than 4 points on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Given both Israel qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Borussia Dortmund win the UEFA Champions League?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Israel qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, which means Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified; and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead. Then, will Borussia Dortmund win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, which resolves **Yes** if they win the Final on June 1, 2024, according to UEFA, and **No** otherwise?

not_P.title: Given both Israel does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final or Trump's lead over Biden is not between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Borussia Dortmund not win the UEFA Champions League?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Israel does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, which means Israel does not participate in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified; and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead. Then, will Borussia Dortmund not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, which resolves **Yes** if they do not win the Final on June 1, 2024, according to UEFA, and **No** otherwise?

para_P.title: If Israel secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and Trump leads Biden by a margin of 3 to 4 points on July 15, 2024, can we expect Borussia Dortmund to triumph in the UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: (a) Israel successfully qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning they take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified; and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, where a positive figure signifies a Trump lead. In that case, will Borussia Dortmund claim victory in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, which will be marked as **Yes** if they win the Final on June 1, 2024, as per UEFA, and **No** if they do not?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Israel qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
(a) Israel will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final if it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. If Israel does not qualify, this part will resolve as **No**.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, the value reported for July 15, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by more than 3 points but not more than 4 points. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(c) Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League if they win the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Israel qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (c) Borussia Dortmund does not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
not_P.body:
(a) Israel will not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final if it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. If Israel qualifies, this part will resolve as **Yes**.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will not be greater than 3 and not less than or equal to 4 if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, the value reported for July 15, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by 3 points or less or by more than 4 points. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(c) Borussia Dortmund does not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League if they do not win the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following three events will take place: (a) Israel makes it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, (b) Trump's advantage over Biden falls between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (c) Borussia Dortmund secures victory in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body:
(a) Israel will reach the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final if it takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. If Israel fails to qualify, this part will be marked as **No**.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden is considered to be greater than 3 and not exceeding 4 if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, the figure reported for July 15, 2024, indicates Trump ahead of Biden by more than 3 points but no more than 4 points. This will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

(c) Borussia Dortmund is deemed the winner of the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League if they triumph in the Final on June 1, 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). Any other outcomes will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating to express their opposition to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that this suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the movement.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

Huffman remarked in an interview, "This is a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, I suppose, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions." He did not confirm the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given both (a) at least 20 Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and (b) the head of the Secret Service resigns, will BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This letter must be signed before the end of Sunday, July 21st, and can be a single letter or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures. (b) The head of the Secret Service, Kimberly Cheatle, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position of director before October 12, 2024.

Given these conditions, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance?

not_P.title: Given both (a) fewer than 20 Democrats do not sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and (b) the head of the Secret Service does not resign, will BSE SENSEX close outside of the range between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024?

Given these conditions, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance?

para_P.body:

(b) The Director of the Secret Service, Kimberly Cheatle, either resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason is no longer in her role as director before October 12, 2024.

Under these circumstances, will the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be more than 75,000 and at most 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will there be no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls occurring between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following four occurrences take place, as indicated by official announcements or [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines removes at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC removes at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If no such occurrences are reported before that date, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: If diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. Resolves as No otherwise.

not_P.title: If diplomatic expulsions or recalls do not take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the nomination. Resolves as No otherwise.

para_P.title: Should there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following occurs: Before August 1, 2024, one of these four scenarios takes place, based on official announcements or reliable reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one representative diplomat of the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one representative diplomat of the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

Then, will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Outcome determination criteria: Resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden might accept the nomination. Resolves as No in all other cases.

question.title: Given diplomatic tensions and Biden's announcement, will Machado be imprisoned by August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two events both occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China happen before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. This includes the Philippines or China expelling or recalling diplomats from each other's countries. (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive and unambiguous. 

Given these conditions, will the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET? The question will resolve as YES if she is imprisoned by that date and time.

not_P.title: Given diplomatic tensions and Biden's announcement, will Machado not be imprisoned by August 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following two events both occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China happen before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. This includes the Philippines or China expelling or recalling diplomats from each other's countries. (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive and unambiguous. 

Given these conditions, will the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado not be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET? The question will resolve as YES if she is not imprisoned by that date and time.

para_P.title: Considering the current diplomatic strains and Biden's declaration, is it possible that Machado will face imprisonment by August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume that both of the following conditions are met: (a) There are diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China occurring prior to August 1, 2024, as confirmed by official statements or credible news sources. This entails either the Philippines or China expelling or recalling diplomats from each other's nations. (b) Joe Biden makes a clear and unequivocal announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. 

Under these circumstances, will the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado be incarcerated before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET? The question will be answered with YES if she is imprisoned by that specified date and time.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) This part resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This part resolves as **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The combined question will resolve as **Yes** only if all parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will none of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado not being imprisoned before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This part resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomats representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomats representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are reports of any such events before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) This part resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This part resolves as **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is not imprisoned before Friday August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The combined question will resolve as **Yes** only if all parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden declaring before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado being incarcerated before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This section is answered with **Yes** if one of these four events occurs before August 1, 2024, based on official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If no such events are reported before that date, then this will be answered as **No**.

(b) This section is answered with **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This section is answered with **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if all sections (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: If at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is based on a monthly poll conducted by Manifold, where respondents vote based on their own understanding of "weak AGI." The poll results in a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that "House of the Dragon" S2E7 will be rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release? The rating will be checked on IMDB two days after release (July 30th), at noon PT, and must be strictly greater than 8.5, using the precision listed by IMDB.

not_P.title: If at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated ≤8.5 on IMDB?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is based on a monthly poll conducted by Manifold, where respondents vote based on their own understanding of "weak AGI." The poll results in a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that "House of the Dragon" S2E7 will be rated less than or equal to 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release? The rating will be checked on IMDB two days after release (July 30th), at noon PT, and must be less than or equal to 8.5, using the precision listed by IMDB.

para_P.title: Should at least 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was realized prior to July 23, 2024, will the rating for "House of the Dragon" S2E7 exceed 8.5 on IMDB?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: A minimum of 30% of participants in the Manifold survey believe that weak AGI was realized before July 23, 2024. This is derived from a monthly survey conducted by Manifold, where participants cast their votes based on their interpretation of "weak AGI." The results indicate a YES/(NO + YES) ratio of 0.3 or higher, excluding those with "no opinion."

Consequently, is it accurate to say that "House of the Dragon" S2E7 will receive a rating above 8.5 on IMDB two days post-release? The rating will be verified on IMDB two days after its release (July 30th), at noon PT, and must be strictly greater than 8.5, according to the precision provided by IMDB.

question.title: Conditional on both at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, and "House of the Dragon" S2E7 being rated >8.5 on IMDB, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio being >= 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" votes, in the July 2024 poll. (2) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 is rated strictly greater than 8.5 on IMDB, two days after its release on July 30, 2024, at noon PT.

Then, is it true that on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX will be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000? The closing value is based on Yahoo Finance data.

not_P.title: Conditional on both at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI was not achieved before July 23, 2024, and "House of the Dragon" S2E7 being rated <=8.5 on IMDB, will the BSE SENSEX not close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had not been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio being < 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" votes, in the July 2024 poll. (2) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 is rated less than or equal to 8.5 on IMDB, two days after its release on July 30, 2024, at noon PT.

Then, is it true that on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX will not be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000? The closing value is based on Yahoo Finance data.

para_P.title: Given that at least 30% of participants in the Manifold survey concur that weak AGI was realized prior to July 23, 2024, and that "House of the Dragon" S2E7 has an IMDB rating exceeding 8.5, will the BSE SENSEX finish between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (1) A minimum of 30% of those surveyed in the Manifold poll affirm that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, determined by the YES/(NO + YES) ratio being at least 0.3, excluding "no opinion" responses, in the July 2024 poll. (2) The IMDB rating for "House of the Dragon" S2E7 is greater than 8.5, two days post-release on July 30, 2024, at noon PT.

Then, can we confirm that on July 21, 2024, the closing price of the BSE SENSEX will be above 75,000 and not exceed 76,000? The closing price will be sourced from Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, (2) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release, and (3) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body:
(1) Every month, a Manifold poll is posted to gauge consensus on AGI progress. These polls ask "has weak AGI been achieved," allowing respondents to vote based on their understanding. Progress has been steady with previous polls showing increasing agreement. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is >= 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" votes.

(2) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title TBA) will be rated based on IMDB scores two days post-release (July 30th), at noon PT. The rating must strictly exceed 8.5. Context includes prior IMDB ratings for HotD, with a mix of scores for previous episodes.

(3) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance. The value must be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (1) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, (2) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release, and (3) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
not_P.body:
(1) At least one month, a Manifold poll does not show that 30% or more respondents agree that weak AGI has been achieved before July 23, 2024.

(2) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title TBA) will be rated based on IMDB scores two days post-release (July 30th), at noon PT, and the rating does not strictly exceed 8.5.

(3) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance. The value must not be greater than 75k or must be greater than 76k.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will take place: (1) A minimum of 30% of Manifold participants concur that weak AGI was achieved prior to July 23, 2024, (2) the episode S2E7 of "House of the Dragon" receives a rating over 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release, and (3) on July 21, 2024, the final value of the BSE SENSEX is more than 75,000 but not exceeding 76,000?
para_P.body:
(1) Monthly, a poll is conducted on Manifold to assess the consensus regarding AGI advancements. These polls inquire whether weak AGI has been realized, allowing respondents to cast votes based on their interpretations. Progress has been consistent, with earlier polls indicating a rising level of agreement. The poll in July 2024 will conclude with a YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is at least 0.3, disregarding votes of "no opinion."

(2) The episode S2E7 of "House of the Dragon" (title yet to be announced) will be evaluated based on IMDB ratings two days after its premiere (July 30th), at noon PT. The score must clearly surpass 8.5. This is in the context of earlier IMDB ratings for HotD, which have shown varied scores for past episodes.

(3) This inquiry will be resolved based on the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance. The figure must be above 75,000 and at most 76,000.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%? (i.e. "Fresh")
question.body:
"Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

question.title: Conditional on M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) having a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Consider the following condition: M. Night Shyamalan's film "Trap" (2024) achieves a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% one week after its release on August 9th, as verified by the Rotten Tomatoes page for the film. The score is measured as an integer percentage without decimals. If this condition is met, then the question is whether the Philadelphia 76ers will win the 2024 NBA Finals. The resolution criterion for this outcome is that the 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the official NBA website. If they are not the champions, the outcome resolves to No. If the condition regarding the film's score is not met, the resolution is N/A.

question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% as determined one week after its release (August 9th), reflecting precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal); and (b) the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA. para_P.title: If M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" receives a Rotten Tomatoes rating of no less than 60% and the Philadelphia 76ers emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals, will Joe Biden remain in office by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) achieves a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% as assessed one week post-release (August 9th), reflecting the accuracy provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually a whole number percentage, without decimals); and (b) the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA. Then, can we confirm that Joe Biden will still be the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, (b) the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) "Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). The score is based on the precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal). For reference, recent M. Night Shyamalan films have had scores such as "Knock at the Cabin": 67%, "Old": 50%, and "Glass": 37%. The "Fresh" designation is just illustrative.

(b) The Philadelphia 76ers will be considered the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals if they are crowned as such by the NBA. The question resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

(c) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, (b) the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) Joe Biden not still be president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) "Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is below 60% one week after release (August 9th). The score is based on the precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal). For reference, recent M. Night Shyamalan films have had scores such as "Knock at the Cabin": 67%, "Old": 50%, and "Glass": 37%. The "Fresh" designation is just illustrative.

(b) The Philadelphia 76ers will not be considered the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals if they are not crowned as such by the NBA. The question resolves **Yes** for all other teams if they are crowned champions.

(c) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) achieves a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of no less than 60%, (b) the Philadelphia 76ers emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) Joe Biden remains the president by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Trap" (2024) will indicate YES if the Tomatometer score reaches 60% or above, one week post-release (on August 9th). The score is determined by the figures provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually a whole percentage, without decimals). For context, recent films by M. Night Shyamalan have received scores like "Knock at the Cabin": 67%, "Old": 50%, and "Glass": 37%. The "Fresh" label is merely for illustration.

(b) The Philadelphia 76ers will be recognized as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals if they are officially declared so by the NBA. This question will resolve **No** for any other teams as they will be out of the running.

(c) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, as of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, based on the data from Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Tyson Fury defeat Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will Tyson Fury win the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk? The question resolves Yes if Tyson Fury wins the fight. It resolves No if Usyk wins or there is a draw. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is not larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Tyson Fury not defeat Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will Tyson Fury not win the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk? The question resolves Yes if Tyson Fury does not win the fight. It resolves No if Tyson Fury wins or there is a draw. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, if Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, will Tyson Fury emerge victorious against Oleksandr Usyk to claim the title of Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

In that case, will Tyson Fury triumph in the boxing match against Oleksandr Usyk? The answer is Yes if Tyson Fury wins the contest. It is No if Usyk wins or if the match ends in a draw. If no fight occurs between the two boxers prior to May 19, 2024, the question will be void.

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap surpasses Apple's on July 17, 2024, and Tyson Fury defeats Oleksandr Usyk, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, and Tyson Fury defeats Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion. 

- Criterion for Nvidia and Apple: This part resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

- Criterion for Tyson Fury: This part resolves Yes if Tyson Fury wins the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk. It will resolve No if Usyk wins or there is a draw. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled.

Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

- Criterion for Russian control: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
  - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
  - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Assessed Russian Control
  - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
  - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
  - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
  - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
  - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

not_P.title: Given Nvidia's market cap does not surpass Apple's on July 17, 2024, or Tyson Fury does not defeat Oleksandr Usyk, will Russia not control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's, or Tyson Fury does not defeat Oleksandr Usyk and therefore does not become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion. 

- Criterion for Nvidia and Apple: This part resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

- Criterion for Tyson Fury: This part resolves Yes if Tyson Fury does not win the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk. It will resolve No if Usyk wins or there is a draw. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled.

Then, will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

- Criterion for Russian control: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories:
  - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
  - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Assessed Russian Control
  - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
  - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
  - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
  - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
  - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
  - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: If Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple on July 17, 2024, and Tyson Fury triumphs over Oleksandr Usyk, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has taken the stand, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Scotland hold an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, and this referendum is officially sanctioned with the consent of the London government. It may be advisory but not a "wildcat" or unsanctioned referendum.

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Scotland not hold an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum held is not officially sanctioned with the consent of the London government, including if it is advisory or a "wildcat" or unsanctioned referendum.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will Scotland conduct an official referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. In that case, will Scotland carry out an officially recognized referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: The question is answered with YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified at the trial.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with YES if a referendum regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place in Scotland before May 3, 2024, and this referendum receives official approval from the London government. It may be advisory in nature but cannot be classified as a "wildcat" or unsanctioned referendum.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Scotland holding an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will there be a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. The referendum must have the consent of the London government and not be a "wildcat" or unauthorized vote.

Then, is the following true: 

Will there be a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41? A break is defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. Resolves "YES" if there is a break after chapter 40, "NO" if there is no break after chapter 40. This will be determined by official release or known-accurate leakers posting any details about a break ahead of time.

not_P.title: Conditional on either Trump not testifying at the hush money trial or Scotland not holding an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will there be no break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. No credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. There is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, or this referendum is not held before May 3, 2024. The referendum does not have the consent of the London government or is a "wildcat" or unauthorized vote.

Then, is the following true: 

Will there be no break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41? A break is defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. Resolves "YES" if there is no break after chapter 40, "NO" if there is a break after chapter 40. This will be determined by official release or known-accurate leakers posting any details about a break ahead of time.

para_P.title: Given that both Trump is testifying at the hush money trial and Scotland is conducting an official independence referendum prior to May 3, 2024, will there be a hiatus between chapters 40 and 41 of Kagurabachi?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold true: 

1. Reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or via remote means, during the trial concerning the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. A referendum is conducted in Scotland regarding its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum takes place before May 3, 2024. The referendum must receive approval from the London government and cannot be a "wildcat" or unauthorized vote.

Under these circumstances, is the following statement true: 

Will there be a hiatus between chapters 40 and 41 of Kagurabachi? A hiatus is defined as any duration sufficient for Shonen Jump to announce at the conclusion of chapters whether a break will occur before the subsequent chapter. Resolves "YES" if a break follows chapter 40, "NO" if no break occurs after chapter 40. This will be established by official releases or reliable leakers providing any information about a break in advance.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and (2) there is a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:  
(1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.  
(2) A break occurs between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41, defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. The question will close on the official release, or earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial nor Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, nor (2) there is no break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:  
(1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.  
(2) No break occurs between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41, defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. The question will close on the official release, or earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (1) Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial and Scotland conducts an official, authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024, and (2) there is a pause between chapters 40 and 41 of Kagurabachi?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

question.title: Given Luxembourg qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the French Prime Minister is not from New Popular Front or Together, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur: (1) Luxembourg is announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final after participating in a Semi-final. (2) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France belongs to a party other than New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources.

Given these conditions, the question resolves as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It resolves as **No** if any other party or group holds the most seats, or if Renew is tied for the most seats and official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports do not confirm Renew as holding the most seats.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

not_P.title: Did someone not intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
not_P.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if no one intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

para_P.title: Was there a deliberate shooting aimed at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to NYT: "There were sounds that resembled gunfire disrupting Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly escorted off the stage and seemed to be bleeding from his ear."

The answer is YES if an individual intentionally discharged a bullet or a similar projectile* towards Trump on July 13th. The answer is NO if the incident was caused by an accidental discharge or ricochet that directed something towards Trump.

*In this context, a bullet-like projectile refers to any object that functions similarly to a bullet, even if it doesn’t meet the strict definition of a bullet. For instance, a BB gun pellet would not be considered since it is not likely to be lethal like a bullet.

question.title: If someone intentionally shot at Trump on July 13th and at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th, and (b) After May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? 

This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Conditional on Kalenjin athletes winning both marathons and the USA winning both basketball golds at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will OpenAI commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races, and (b) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. This question resolves as **Yes** if both conditions are met.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle? This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the initial condition about the Olympics is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

Suppose the following is true: At least one of the following does not occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races, or (b) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the conditions is not met.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle? This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following is true:

- OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus does not verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be less rigorous than "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the initial condition about the Olympics is met, this question resolves as N/A.

Now, does it hold true that before July 1, 2024, OpenAI will make a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle? This will be marked as **Yes** if both of the next conditions are satisfied:

- OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a declaration by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This declaration can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must reflect a new commitment level to the principle compared to when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact select signatories or endorsers to gauge their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

If the initial condition regarding the Olympics is not satisfied, this question will be marked as N/A.

2. Prior to July 1, 2024, OpenAI must publicly affirm the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through an official statement from the company or a representative, demonstrating a heightened commitment compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was issued. Furthermore, Metaculus should validate that the company has embraced this principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with affirmations that are at least as stringent as "this was a good first step."

The question will be answered with **No** if either of the conditions fails to be fulfilled.
