question.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will ISS advise against Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?

Then, will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting?

question.title: Given both ICC arrest warrants for Israeli leaders and ISS advising against Musk, will OpenAI publish a red-teaming report by June 30, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Before July 1, 2024, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders? (b) Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election? (c) Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Before July 1, 2024, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders? (b) Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election? not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND does not advise against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following will happen: (a) Before the date of July 1, 2024, will the ICC release arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli officials? (b) Will ISS recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election? (c) Will OpenAI release a report detailing the findings from an external safety evaluation of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the listed Israeli cabinet members prior to July 1, 2024. It will be marked as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) The inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) publishes a statement clearly instructing Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR opposing Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. If not, it will be marked as **No**.

(c) This question will be resolved as **YES** if OpenAI releases a *public* report by June 30, 2024, containing the outcomes from an *external* review of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Slovenia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance. Then is it true that Slovenia will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The closing value of BSE SENSEX must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Slovenia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Slovenia does not qualify, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Given BSE SENSEX is between 75k and 77k and Slovenia qualifies for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will the men's 100m dash break the Olympic record at Paris 2024?
question.body:

Then, at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
1. The BSE SENSEX closing value on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
2. Slovenia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
The question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the Netherlands qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The Netherlands qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. Then, is it true that M. Night Shyamalan's film "Trap" (2024) will have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% one week after its release on August 9th? The score is determined by the Tomatometer on Rotten Tomatoes, typically an integer percentage, and a score of 60% or higher is considered "Fresh." For reference, recent M. Night Shyamalan films have had the following RT scores: "Knock at the Cabin": 67%, "Old": 50%, "Glass": 37%. The resolution will be based on the score listed on Rotten Tomatoes precisely one week after the release date.

question.title: Conditional on the Netherlands qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) having a Rotten Tomatoes score of at least 60%, will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?

question.title: Given both a change in French PM coalition and Nigel Farage's election, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together, as verified by credible sources.

2. Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election held on July 4, 2024, unless the election is cancelled or postponed.

Given these conditions, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024? The polling data should be accessed on July 17, 2024, and a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Given both a change in French PM coalition and Nigel Farage's election, will Trump's lead over Biden be not between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true:

Given these conditions, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 4 points according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024? The polling data should be accessed on July 17, 2024, and a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Considering the alteration in the French Prime Minister's coalition and the election of Nigel Farage, will Donald Trump maintain a lead over Joe Biden ranging from 2 to 4 points on July 15, 2024?

2. Nigel Farage secures a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election conducted on July 4, 2024, unless the election is called off or delayed.

Under these circumstances, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 points but not exceeding 4 points according to the national polling average from 538 on July 15, 2024? The polling figures should be reviewed on July 17, 2024, with a positive number indicating a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, (2) Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election, and (3) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met:

1. The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the Member of Parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as No if either condition is not met. Note that the second condition will be annulled if the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024.

3. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution should cite credible media reports as specified for each condition: credible sources for the first condition, credible UK media or official announcements for the second condition, and the 538 national polling average for the third condition.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is not elected as the Member of Parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as Yes if the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024.

3. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is not greater than 2 and not less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution should cite credible media reports as specified for each condition: credible sources for the first condition, credible UK media or official announcements for the second condition, and the 538 national polling average for the third condition.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be part of a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together, Nigel Farage be elected as an MP in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024, and will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if all the following criteria are satisfied:

1. The coalition of the Prime Minister of France is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

2. Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament (MP) for any constituency in the UK during the general election on July 4, 2024. If either condition is not fulfilled, the question will resolve as No. Note that the second condition will be void if the general election is cancelled or postponed past July 4, 2024.

3. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) must be more than 2 and at most 4, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

The resolution should refer to trustworthy media reports as outlined for each condition: reliable sources for the first condition, credible UK media or official announcements for the second condition, and the 538 national polling average for the third condition.

question.title: Will Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Conditional on Sifan Hassan winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Then, will a terrorist attack occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

If Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on Sifan Hassan not winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will a terrorist act not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:

The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Assuming Sifan Hassan secures a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

In that case, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

The outcome will be Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The outcome will be No if this does not take place.

An event will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

If Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, the question will be marked as N/A.

question.title: Given that both Sifan Hassan wins a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics and a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France, injuring and/or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given these conditions, will there be credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties before June 6, 2024? If both conditions are met, then the question resolves YES if there is such a death before June 6, 2024, and NO otherwise. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

Given these conditions, will there be no credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties before June 6, 2024? question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

not_P.title: Will USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if no team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude affirmatively if the United States Olympic Team is the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Games. It will remain uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will result negatively if any other team achieves a ranking that is equal to or surpasses that of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In the case of a tie in Gold Medals) Total Silver Medals
3. (In the case of a tie in Silver Medals) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Conditional on USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics based on the medal table, which is calculated by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals won. Then, is it true that "Twisters" (2024) will have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release (July 26th)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The US team must be the highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If the Olympics do not take place before 2027, the condition resolves ambiguously.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: "Twisters" (2024) must have a Tomatometer score of 75% or higher on Rotten Tomatoes one week after its release. The score is based on the integer percentage displayed by Rotten Tomatoes.

not_P.title: Conditional on USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of less than 75%?
not_P.body:

Then, is it true that "Twisters" (2024) will have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of less than 75% one week after its release (July 26th)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The US team must be the highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If the Olympics do not take place before 2027, the condition resolves ambiguously.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: "Twisters" (2024) must have a Tomatometer score of less than 75% on Rotten Tomatoes one week after its release. The score is based on the integer percentage displayed by Rotten Tomatoes.

para_P.title: If the USA leads the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Games, will "Twisters" (2024) achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics rating of at least 75%?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: The United States Olympic Team is the sole top-ranked team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics, determined by the total number of gold, silver, and bronze medals earned. Then, does it follow that "Twisters" (2024) will secure a Rotten Tomatoes critics rating of no less than 75% one week post-release (July 26th)?

Criteria for the condition to be met: The US team must be the top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If the Olympics do not occur before 2027, the condition remains uncertain.

Criteria for the outcome to be fulfilled: "Twisters" (2024) needs to have a Tomatometer score of 75% or greater on Rotten Tomatoes one week after its premiere. The score is based on the integer percentage shown by Rotten Tomatoes.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, (b) "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, and (c) the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
(a) Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th).

Details:

- I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).
- For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.
- "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).
- "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(c) Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, (b) "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, and (c) the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
(a) Will the USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
This question will resolve positively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team.

(b) Will "Twisters" (2024) not have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is below 75% one week after release (July 26th).

(c) Will the Los Angeles Clippers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No if they are crowned the champion.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) the USA to lead the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, (b) "Twisters" (2024) to achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, and (c) the Los Angeles Clippers to clinch the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
(a) Is the USA going to top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

It will remain uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will result in a negative outcome if any other team matches or surpasses the US team's ranking.

The medal table is determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total Bronze Medals

(b) Is "Twisters" (2024) going to receive a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of 75% or above?
This will be a Yes if the Tomatometer score reaches 75% or higher, one week post-release (July 26th).

Details:

- The score used will be whatever precision is provided by Rotten Tomatoes (generally an integer percentage, without decimals).
- For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This will be the reference score used.
- The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for illustration (to my knowledge, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be additional criteria—the resolution is based solely on the displayed score).
- "Twisters" (2024) is an independent sequel to the 1996 film, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(c) Are the Los Angeles Clippers going to win the 2024 NBA Finals?
This question will be answered Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered No for all other teams as they are eliminated from the competition.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question combines two distinct events: 

1. Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart for the 2024 presidential election on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

2. Then, is it true that Sifan Hassan will win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves YES if Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and NO otherwise.

If the first condition is not met, the question is not applicable.

not_P.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden not being greater than 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, will Sifan Hassan not win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question combines two distinct events: 

1. Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or greater than 3 points. This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart for the 2024 presidential election on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

2. Then, is it true that Sifan Hassan will not win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves YES if Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and NO otherwise.

If the first condition is not met, the question is not applicable.

para_P.title: Assuming that Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but no more than 3 on July 15, 2024, will Sifan Hassan secure a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry involves two separate occurrences: 

1. Let us assume the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3 points. This will be verified by looking at 538's national polling average chart for the 2024 presidential election on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

2. Next, is it accurate that Sifan Hassan will earn a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will be answered with YES if Sifan Hassan obtains any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and NO if she does not.

If the initial condition is not satisfied, the question does not apply.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, and Sifan Hassan winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This conditional question examines the outcome of the Miami Heat in the 2024 NBA Finals based on the following conditions:

Condition (a): Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported by the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Condition (b): Sifan Hassan must win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the conditional question to be considered. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves NO if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.
If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

not_P.title: Conditional on either Trump's lead over Biden being less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, or Sifan Hassan not winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
This conditional question examines the outcome of the Miami Heat in the 2024 NBA Finals based on the following conditions:

Condition (a): Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported by the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Condition (b): Sifan Hassan must not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Either condition (a) or (b) must be satisfied for the conditional question to be considered. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves NO if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.
If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Given that Trump's margin over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and Sifan Hassan secures a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the Miami Heat emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This conditional inquiry evaluates the Miami Heat's performance in the 2024 NBA Finals based on these stipulations:

Condition (a): On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must exceed 2 but not surpass 3, as indicated by the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

Condition (b): Sifan Hassan must achieve a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Both stipulations (a) and (b) must be fulfilled for the inquiry to be valid.

Outcome criteria: Resolves to YES if the Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves to NO if another team is declared champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from the competition.
If either stipulation (a) or (b) is not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves as follows: 

(a) Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported by the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) Sifan Hassan must win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(c) The Miami Heat must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

All conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be satisfied for this question to resolve YES; otherwise, it resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as follows: 

(a) Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must not be greater than 2 or not be less than or equal to 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported by the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) Sifan Hassan must not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(c) The Miami Heat must not be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

At least one of the conditions (a), (b), or (c) must not be satisfied for this question to resolve YES; otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will each of the following take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, (b) Sifan Hassan secure a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) the Miami Heat claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is determined as follows: 

(a) Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must exceed 2 and be at most 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as indicated by the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies a Biden advantage.

(b) Sifan Hassan must obtain any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(c) The Miami Heat must be recognized as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

All criteria (a), (b), and (c) must be fulfilled for this question to resolve in the affirmative; otherwise, it resolves in the negative.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

not_P.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US not occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
not_P.body:

The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

para_P.title: Will the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 individuals in the US take place within a month following the combined peak of COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) from the date of the peak rate for all three viruses combined, as reported by the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period will be determined based on the end dates of the weeks. The CDC utilizes "epidemiological weeks" that start on Sunday and conclude on Saturday. The rate will encompass all demographics, including age, race, and gender. Refer to the fine print for the appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined as starting with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending on June 1, 2024.

To accommodate for data updates and delays in reporting, the resolution of this question will depend on the data available after the reporting delay period, specifically when the relevant statistics for the ongoing season are displayed without a dashed line, typically four weeks following the week ending date.

question.title: Given the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the potential link between the timing of peak hospitalizations in the US for the 2023-24 season and Biden's decision to drop out of the race before July 20. 

Condition: The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV must occur within four weeks (28 days) of the combined peak for all three, according to the CDC's RESP-NET data. The relevant period is from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024.

Outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, otherwise resolves NO.

Outcome: Resolves YES if Biden does not drop out or is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, otherwise resolves NO.

question.title: Given both the US hospitalization peak timing and Biden dropping out, will "Trap" (2024) be Fresh on Rotten Tomatoes?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US for the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV, according to the CDC's RESP-NET data.
(b) Biden drops out of the presidential race before July 20, 2024.

Given these conditions, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, thereby being rated as "Fresh"? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher one week after release (August 9th). The score used will be the integer percentage listed on Rotten Tomatoes.

question.title: Given both 377 traders in the linked market by July 15, 2024, and Croatia qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, and (b) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: (a) Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close. (b) Resolves YES if Croatia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Resolves NO otherwise. If two groups are tied for seats, the resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Given both 377 traders in the linked market by July 15, 2024, and Croatia qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Renew not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, and (b) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Renew not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: (a) Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close. (b) Resolves YES if Croatia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Renew does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Resolves NO otherwise. If two groups are tied for seats, the resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If there are at least 377 participants in the linked market by July 15, 2024, and Croatia secures a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Renew possess the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (a) The market referenced in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) features no fewer than 377 participants by July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, and (b) Croatia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Renew possess the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: (a) Resolves YES if the market has 377 participants before market closure. (b) Resolves YES if Croatia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Renew possesses the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Resolves NO otherwise. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, the resolution will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or reputable media sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) both (a) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024, and (b) Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (2) Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) the market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time), and (b) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

(2) Resolves YES if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as NO for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (1) either (a) the linked market does not get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024, or (b) Croatia does not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, or (2) Renew does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
(1) Resolves YES if at least one of the following does not occur: (a) the market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time), or (b) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

(2) Resolves YES if Renew does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as NO for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) the linked market will reach a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024, and Croatia will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (2) Renew will secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(1) Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) the market linked in the URL (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders prior to the market closing (July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time), and (b) Croatia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Resolves NO if either condition is not met.

(2) Resolves YES if Renew has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and resolves NO for all other scenarios. In case of a tie between two parties for the number of seats, the resolution will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Iran not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable information suggests that an assault linked to Iran occurring within the territory of Israel has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Given Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Then, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? This resolves as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

not_P.title: Given Iran does not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will there be no armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
not_P.body: Suppose the following is true: After the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that there has not been an attack attributed to Iran occurring within Israel's borders that has led to the death of at least five individuals. Then, will there be no armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? This resolves as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm no deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

para_P.title: If Iran executes a lethal assault on Israeli territory prior to May 1, 2024, will there be fatalities resulting from military conflict between China and Taiwan in 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Following the release of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable information suggests that an assault attributed to Iran has occurred within the borders of Israel, resulting in the deaths of at least five people. Then, will there be fatalities resulting from military conflict between China and Taiwan in 2024? This is considered Yes if, before June 6, 2024, credible reports verify one or more deaths among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between these two nations.

question.title: Given both an Iranian attack in Israel and a China-Taiwan armed conflict death, will the Oklahoma City Thunder win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Then, will the Oklahoma City Thunder be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/)? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals, and **No** otherwise.

not_P.title: Given both an Iranian attack in Israel and a China-Taiwan armed conflict death, will the Oklahoma City Thunder not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Then, will the Oklahoma City Thunder not be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/)? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Oklahoma City Thunder does not win the 2024 NBA Finals, and **No** otherwise.

para_P.title: In light of an Iranian strike in Israel and fatalities from a military clash between China and Taiwan, will the Oklahoma City Thunder secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: 

(a) After this question is published and prior to May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack linked to Iran has occurred within Israel, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

(b) Before June 6, 2024, trustworthy reports confirm that there have been one or more fatalities among the military forces of either China or Taiwan due to the conflict between them.

Under these circumstances, will the Oklahoma City Thunder be declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/)? The outcome will be **Yes** if the Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals, and **No** if they do not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, (b) an armed forces conflict death occurs between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) the Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The Oklahoma City Thunder is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other outcomes as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, (b) an armed forces conflict death occurs between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) the Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if not all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, there are no credible reports confirming one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The Oklahoma City Thunder is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other outcomes as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for all of the following to take place: (a) Iran executes a lethal assault within Israel prior to May 1, 2024, (b) a fatal military conflict occurs between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) the Oklahoma City Thunder secures victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a resolution of **Yes** if the subsequent conditions are fulfilled:

(a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information suggests that an attack linked to Iran has transpired within the borders of Israel, resulting in the deaths of at least five persons.

(b) Prior to June 6, 2024, credible information verifies one or more fatalities among the military forces of China or Taiwan due to conflict between the two nations.

(c) The Oklahoma City Thunder is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be considered **No** for any other outcomes, as they will be ruled out.
